flavor:
"I am Aragorn son of Arathorn; and if by life or death I can save you, I will."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Aragorn
text: Sentinel. Response: After Aragorn commits to a quest, spend 1 resource from his resource pool to ready him.

flavor:
"Not all is dark. Take courage, Lord of the Mark..."
<cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Théodred
text: Response: After Théodred commits to a quest, choose a hero committed to that quest. Add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

flavor:
His beard, very long and forked, was white, nearly as white as the snow-white cloth of his garments.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Glóin
text: Response: After Glóin suffers damage, add 1 resource to his resource pool for each point of damage he just suffered.

flavor: "Men need many words before deeds. My axe is restless in my hands." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Gimli
text: Gimli gets +1 [attack] for each damage token on him.

flavor:
"I can walk this path, but others have not this skill."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Legolas
text: Ranged. Response: After Legolas participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, place 2 progress tokens on the current quest.

name: Thalin
text: While Thalin is committed to a quest, deal 1 damage to each enemy as it is revealed by the encounter deck.

flavor:
Slender and tall she was in her white robe girt with silver; but strong she seemed and stern as steel, a daughter of kings.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Éowyn
text: Action: Discard 1 card from your hand to give Éowyn +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase. This effect may be triggered by each player once each round.

flavor:
"Gondor wanes, you say. But Gondor stands, and even the end of its strength is very strong."
<cite>Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Eleanor
text: Response: Exhaust Eleanor to cancel the "when revealed" effects of a treachery card just revealed by the encounter deck. Then, discard that card, and replace it with the next card from the encounter deck.

flavor:
Captains rode to meet him at the ford, bearing messages from Gandalf. Dúnhere, chieftain of the folk of Harrowdale, was at their head.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Dúnhere
text: Dúnhere can target enemies in the staging area when he attacks alone. When doing so, he gets +1 [attack].

flavor:
"And the lord Denethor is unlike other men: he sees far."
<cite>Beregond, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Denethor
text: Action: Exhaust Denethor to look at the top card of the encounter deck. You may move that card to the bottom of the deck.

flavor:
"You saw him for a moment as he is upon the other side: one of the mighty of the firstborn."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Glorfindel
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from Glorfindel's pool to heal 1 damage on any character. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
But in the wild lands beyond Bree there were mysterious wanderers. The Bree-folk called them Rangers, and knew nothing of their origin.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Beravor
text: Action: Exhaust Beravor to choose a player. That player draws 2 cards. Limit once per round.

flavor:
"But the Lords of Minas Tirith still fight on, defying our enemies, keeping the passage of the River from Argonath to the Sea."
<cite>Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Guard of the Citadel

flavor:
"He leads now in all perilous ventures. But his life is charmed, or fate spares him for some other end."
<cite>Mablung, Ranger of Ithilien,
The Two Towers</cite>
name: Faramir
text: Action: Exhaust Faramir to choose a player. Each character controlled by that player gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

flavor:
...and the North-realm they made in Arnor, and the South-realm in Gondor above the mouths of Anduin.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Son of Arnor
text: Response: After Son of Arnor enters play, choose an enemy card in the staging area or currently engaged with another player. Engage that enemy.

flavor:
...he saw not a shadow, nor a blur, but the small figures of horsemen, many horsemen, and the glint of morning on the tips of their spears was like the twinkle of minute stars beyond the edge of mortal sight.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Snowbourn Scout
text: Response: After Snowbourn Scout enters play, choose a location. Place 1 progress token on that location.

flavor:
"We have been keeping watch on the rivers, ever since we saw a great troop of Orcs going north towards Moria, along the skirts of the mountains, many days ago."
<cite>Haldir of Lórien, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Silverlode Archer
text: Ranged.

flavor:
Five dead Orcs lay there. They had been hewn with many cruel strokes, and two had been beheaded. The ground was wet with their dark blood.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Longbeard Orc Slayer
text: Response: After Longbeard Orc Slayer enters play, deal 1 damage to each Orc enemy in play.

flavor:
...there is no knowing what a Dwarf will not dare and do for revenge and the recovery of his own.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Brok Ironfist
text: Response: After a Dwarf hero you control leaves play, put Brok Ironfist into play from your hand.

flavor:
"...no road looks toward safety any longer. Be vigilant!"
<cite>Gandalf, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Ever Vigilant
text: Action: Choose and ready 1 ally card.

flavor:
"We will make such a chase as shall be accounted a marvel among the Three Kindreds: Elves, Dwarves, and Men."
<cite>Aragorn, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Common Cause
text: Action: Exhaust 1 hero you control to choose and ready a different hero.

flavor:
And the tree that was withered shall be renewed,
and he shall plant it in high places,
and the City shall be blessed.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: For Gondor!
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, all characters get +1 [attack]. All Gondor characters also get +1 [defense] until the end of the phase.

flavor:
There is a seed of courage hidden (often deeply, it is true) in the heart of the fattest and most timid hobbit, waiting for some final and desperate danger to make it grow.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Sneak Attack
text: Action: Put 1 ally card into play from your hand. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play, return it to your hand.

flavor:
"He fell defending the Hobbits, while I was away upon the hill.
<cite>Aragorn, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Valiant Sacrifice
text: Response: After an ally card leaves play, that card's controller draws 2 cards.

flavor: "If there is only one way, then I must take it. What comes after must come." <cite>Frodo Baggins, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Grim Resolve
text: Action: Ready all character cards in play.

flavor:
"It was commanded yesterday."
<cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Steward of Gondor
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the Gondor trait. Action: Exhaust Steward of Gondor to add 2 resources to attached hero's resource pool.

flavor:
"You needn't," said Bilbo. "As a matter of fact it was all mine. Except that Aragorn insisted on my putting in a green stone. He seemed to think it important. I don't know why."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Celebrían's Stone
text:
Attach to a hero. Restricted.
Attached hero gains +2 [willpower]
If attached hero is Aragorn, he also gains a [spirit] resource icon.

flavor: "I am glad to have you standing nigh with your stout legs and your hard axe." <cite>Legolas, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Veteran Axehand

flavor: More than a thousand were there mustered. Their spears were like a sprining wood. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Gondorian Spearman
text: Sentinel. Response: After Gondorian Spearman is declared as a defender, deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.

flavor: A few of the riders appeared to be bowmen, skilled at shooting from a running horse. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Horseback Archer
text: Ranged.

flavor: "I don't need your service, thank you...but I expect you need mine." <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Beorn
text: Action: Beorn gains +5 [attack] until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase in which you trigger this effect, shuffle Beorn back into your deck. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
Throwing back his cloak, he laid his hand on the hilt of a sword that had hung concealed by his side. They did not dare to move.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Blade Mastery
text: Action: Choose a character. Until the end of the phase, that character gains +1 [attack] and +1 [defense].

flavor: Arrows thick as the rain came whistling over the battlements, and fell clinking and glancing on th estones. Many found their mark. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Rain of Arrows
text: Action: Exhaust a character you control with the ranged keyword to choose a player. Deal 1 damage to each enemy engaged with that player.

flavor: A few brave men were strung before them to make a feint of resistance, and many there fell before the rest drew back and fled to either side. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Feint
text: Combat Action: Choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.

flavor: "...for he that strikes the first blow, if he strikes it hard enough, may need to strike no more." <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Quick Strike
text: Action: Exhaust a character you control to immediately declare it as an attacker (and resolve its attack) against any eligible enemy target.

flavor:
With a word or cry, suddenly, the Riders halted. A thicket of spears were pointed towards the strangers...
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Thicket of Spears
text: You must use resources from 3 different heroes' pools to pay for this card. Action: Choose a player. That player's engaged enemies cannot attack that player this phase.

flavor:
A swift stroke she dealt, skilled and deadly.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Swift Strike
text: Response: After a character is declared as a defender, deal 2 damage to the attacking enemy.

flavor: ...and when the task was done, there they would come to an end, alone, houseless, foodless in the midst of a terrible desert. There could be no return. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Stand Together
text: Action: Choose a player. That player may declare any number of his eligible characters as defenders against each enemy attacking him this phase.

flavor:
It was rather splendid to be wearing a blade made in Gondolin for the goblin-wars of which so many songs had sung...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Blade of Gondolin
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [attack] when attacking an Orc. Response: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, place 1 progress token on the current quest.

flavor:
"Go to the armouries of the Citadel, and get you there the livery and gear of the Tower."
<cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Citadel Plate
text:
Attach to a hero. Restricted.
Attached hero gets +4 Hit Points.

flavor:
"But keep your bow ready to hand, and I will keep my axe loose in my belt."
<cite>Gimli, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Dwarven Axe
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gains +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if attached hero is a Dwarf.)

flavor:
'Slow should you be to wind that horn again, Boromir,' said Elrond, 'until you stand once more on the borders of your land, and dire need is on you.'
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Horn of Gondor
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Response: After a character is destroyed, add 1 resource to attached hero's pool.

flavor: ...but certainly there was something not entirely hobbit-like about them, and once in a while members of the Took-clan would go and have adventures. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Wandering Took
text: Action: Reduce your threat by 3 to give control of Wandering Took to another player. Raise that player's threat by 3.

flavor: "Indeed deep in the wood they dwell..." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Lórien Guide
text: Response: After Lórien Guide commits to a quest, place 1 progress token on the active location.

flavor:
"What roads would any dare to tread, what safety would there be in quiet lands, or in the homes of simple men at night, if the Dúnedain were asleep, or were all gone into the grave?"
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Northern Tracker
text: Response: After Northern Tracker commits to a quest, place 1 progress token on each location in the staging area.

flavor:
"Welcome to Caras Galadhan!" he said. "Here is the city of the Galadhrim where dwell the Lord Celeborn and Galadriel the Lady of Lórien"
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: The Galadhrim's Greeting
text: Action: Reduce one player's threat by 6, or reduce each player's threat by 2.

flavor:
Then Aragorn lead the way, and such was the strength of his will in that hour that all the Dúnedain and their horses followed him.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Strength of Will
text: Response: After you travel to a location, exhaust a [spirit] character to place 2 progress tokens on that location.

flavor:
'The hasy stroke goes oft astray,' said Aragorn. 'We must press our Enemy, and no longer wait on him for the next move.'
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Hasty Stroke
text: Response: Cancel a shadow effect just triggered during combat.

flavor:
"If Gondor has such men still in these days of fading, great must have been its glory in the days of its rising."
<cite>Legolas, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Will of the West
text: Action: Choose a player. Shuffle that player's discard pile back into his deck. Remove Will of the West from the game.

flavor:
"There is naught that you can do, other than to resist, with hope or without it"
<cite>Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: A Test of Will
text: Response: Cancel the "when revealed" effects of a card that was just revealed from the encounter deck.

flavor: "...we will fight on." <cite>Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Stand and Fight
text: Action: Choose an ally with a printed cost of X in any player's discard pile. Put that ally into play under your control. (The chosen ally can belong to any sphere of influence.)

flavor:
The light of the torches and the fire flickered about them...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: A Light in the Dark
text: Action: Choose an enemy engaged with a player. Return that enemy to the staging area.

flavor:
The dwarves no more shall suffer wrong,
The dwarves of your made mighty spells,
While hammers fell like ringing bells
In places deep, where dark things sleep,
In hollow halls beneath the fells.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Dwarven Tomb
text: Action: Return 1 [spirit] card from your discard pile to your hand.

flavor:
'Yes, fortune or fate have heped you,' said Gandalf, 'not to mention courage.'
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Fortune or Fate
text: Action: Choose a hero in any player's discard pile. Put that card into play, under its owner's control.

flavor:
"You are indeed high in the favor of the Lady!"
<cite>Unnamed Elf of Lórien,
The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: The Favor of the Lady
text:
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains +1 [willpower].

flavor:
"Power to defy our Enemy is not in him, unless shuch power is in the earth itself."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Power in the Earth
text:
Attach to a location.
Attached location gets -1 [threat].

flavor:
"Here am I, naughty little fly;
you are fat and lazy.
You cannot trap me, though you try,
in your cobwebs crazy."
<cite>Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Unexpected Courage
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust Unexpected Courage to ready attached hero.

flavor: "Here is Nimrodel! Of this stream the Silvan Elves made many songs long ago, and still we sing them in the North...I will bate my feet, for it is said that the water is healing to the weary." <cite>Legolas, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Daughter of the Nimrodel
text: Action: Exhaust Daughter of the Nimrodel to heal up to 2 damage on any 1 hero.

flavor: "In Erebor in the Kingdom of Dain there is such skill..." <cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Erebor Hammersmith
text: Response: After you play Erebor Hammersmith, return the topmost attachment in any player's discard pile to his hand.

flavor:
"And I reckon there's Elves and Elves. They're all elvish enough, but they're not all the same."
<cite>Sam Gamgee,
The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Henamarth Riversong
text: Action: Exhaust Henamarth Riversong to look at the top card of the encounter deck.

flavor:
...while the four dwarves sat around the table, and talked about mines and gold and troubles with goblins...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Miner of the Iron Hills
text: Response: After Miner of the Iron Hills enters play, choose and discard 1 Condition attachment from play.

flavor:
Then the Riders of the King's House upon white horses rode round about the barrow and sang together a song of Théoden Thengle's son that Gléowine his minstrel made...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Gléowine
text: Action: Exhaust Gléowine to choose a player. That player draws 1 card.

flavor:
"...understanding, making and healing...These things the Elves of Middle-earth have in some measure gained, though with sorrow."
<cite>Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Lore of Imladris
text: Action: Choose a character. Heal all damage from that character.

flavor:
"That is the fairest of all the dwellings of my people. There are no trees like the tress of that land."
<cite>Legolas, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Lórien's Wealth
text: Action: Choose a player. That player draws 3 cards.

flavor: "Radagast is, of course, a worthy Wizard, a master of shapes and changes of hue; and he has much lore of herbs and beasts, and birds are especially his friends." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Radagast's Cunning
text: Quest Action: Choose an enemy in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, that enemy does not contribute its [threat]

flavor: ...Beorn advised them to take this way; for at a place a few days' ride due north of the Carrock was the gate of a little-known pathway through Mirkwood... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Secret Paths
text: Quest Action: Choose a location in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, that location does not contribute its [threat]

flavor:
"Less welcome did the Lord Denethor show me then than of old, and grudgingly he permitted me to search among his hoarded scrolls and books."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Gandalf's Search
text: Action: Look at the top X cards of any player's deck, add 1 of those cards to its owner's hand, and return the rest to the top of the deck in any order.

flavor:
"...and my house is open to you, if ever you come back this way again."
<cite>Beorn, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Beorn's Hospitality
text: Action: Choose a player. Heal all damage on each hero controlled by that player.

flavor:
"We shall have it like a coney in a trap. Then we shall learn what kind of thing it is."
<cite>Unidentified Man of Gondor,
The Two Towers</cite>
name: Forest Snare
text:
Attach to an enemy engaged with a player.
Attached enemy cannot attack.

flavor:
'Speak no evil of the lady Galadriel!' said Aragorn sternly. 'There is in her and in this land no evil, unless a man bring it hither himself. Then let him beware.'
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Protector of Lórien
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Discard a card from your hand to give attached hero +1 [defense] or +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase. Limit 3 times per phase.

flavor:
'Go on then!' said Frodo. 'What do you know?'
'Too much; too many dark things,' said Strider grimly.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Dark Knowledge
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets -1 [willpower] Response: Exhaust Dark Knowledge to look at 1 shadow card that was just dealt to an enemy attacking you.

flavor:
...how much more of this would they have to endure, or could they endure?
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Self Preservation
text: Attach to a character. Action: Exhaust Self Preservation to heal 2 points of damage from attached character.

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

name: King Spider
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose and exhaust 1 character he controls.

name: Hummerhorns
text: Forced: After Hummerhorns engages you, deal 5 damage to a single hero you control.

name: Ungoliant's Spawn
text: When Revealed: Each character currently committed to a quest gets -1 Wilpower until the end of the phase.

name: Great Forest Web
text: Travel: Each player must exhaust 1 hero he controls to travel here.

name: Mountains of Mirkwood
text:
Travel: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck and add it to the staging area to travel here.
Response: After Mountains of Mirkwood leaves play as an explored location, each player may search the top 5 cards of his deck for 1 card and add it to his hand. Shuffle the rest of the searched cards back into their owners' decks.

name: Eyes of the Forest
text: When Revealed: Each player discards all event cards in his hand.

name: Caught in a Web
text: When Revealed: The player with the highest threat level attaches this card to one of his heroes. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Attached hero does not ready during the refresh phase unless you pay 2 resources from that hero's pool.")

name: Wolf Rider
text: Surge.

name: Hill Troll
text: Excess combat damage dealt by Hill Troll (damage that is dealt beyond the remaining hit points of the character damaged by its attack) must be assigned as an increase to your threat.

name: Goblin Sniper
text:
During the encounter phase, players cannot optionally engage Goblin Sniper if there are other enemies in the staging area.
Forced: If Goblin Sniper is in the staging area at the end of the combat phase, each player deals 1 point of damage to 1 character he controls.

name: Marsh Adder
text: Forced: Each time Marsh Adder attacks you, raise your threat by 1.

name: Wargs
text: Forced: If Wargs is dealt a shadow card with no effect, return Wargs to the staging area after it attacks.

name: Despair
text: When Revealed: Remove 4 progress tokens from the current quest card. (If there are fewer than 4 progress tokens on the quest, remove all progress tokens from that quest.)

name: The Brown Lands
text: Forced: After the players travel to The Brown Lands, place 1 progress token on it.

name: The East Bight
text: When faced with the option to travel, the players must travel to The East Bight if there is no active location.

name: Dol Guldur Orcs
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses 1 character currently committed to a quest. Deal 2 damage to that character.

name: Chieftain Ufthak
text:
Chieftan Ufthak gets +2 Attack for each resource token on him.
Forced: After Chieftan Ufthak attacks, place 1 resource token on him.

name: Dol Guldur Beastmaster
text: Forced: After Dol Guldur Beastmaster attacks, deal it 1 additional shadow card.

name: Driven by Shadow
text: When Revealed: Each enemy and location currently in the staging area gets + 1 Threat Strength until the end of the phase. If there are no cards in the staging area, Driven by Shadow gains surge.

name: The Necromancer's Reach
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each exhausted character.

name: Necromancer's Pass
text: Travel: The first player must discard 2 cards from his hand at random to travel here.

name: Enchanted Stream
text: While Enchanted Stream is the active location, players cannot draw cards.

name: Forest Spider
text: Forced: After Forest Spider engages a player, it gets +1 ATK until the end of the round.

name: East Bight Patrol
text: Goblin. Orc.

name: Black Forest Bats
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose 1 character currently committed to a quest, and remove that character from the quest. (The chosen character does not ready.)

name: Old Forest Road
text: Response: After you travel to Old Forest Road, the first player may choose and ready 1 character he controls.

name: Forest Gate
text: Response: After you travel to Forest Gate, the first player may draw 2 cards.

name: Dungeon Jailor
text: Forced: If Dungeon Jailor is in the staging area after the players have quested unsuccessfully, shuffle 1 unclaimed objective card from the staging area back into the encounter deck.

name: Nazgul of Dol Guldur
text:
Forced: When the prisoner is "rescued," move Nazgul of Dol Guldur into the staging area.
Forced: After a shadow effect dealt to Nazgul of Dol Guldur resolves, the engaged player must choose and discard 1 character he controls.

name: Cavern Guardian
text: Doomed 1.

name: Under the Shadow
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the phase, raise the total Threat Strength in the staging area by X, where X is the number of players in the game.

name: Iron Shackles
text: When Revealed: Attach Iron Shackles to the top of the first player's deck. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "The next time a player would draw 1 or more cards from attached deck, discard Iron Shackles instead.)

name: Endless Caverns
text: Doomed 1. Surge.

name: Tower Gate
text: Forced: After travelling to Tower Gate, each player places the top card of his deck, face down in front of him, as if it just engaged him from the staging area. These cards are called "Orc Guard," and act as enemies with: 1 hit point, 1 Attack, and 1 Defense.

name: Gandalf's Map
text:
Guarded. Restricted.
Action: Raise your threat by 2 to claim this objective when it is free of encounters. When claimed, attach Gandalf's Map to a hero you control. (Counts as an attachment. If detached, return Gandalf's Map to the staging area.)
Attached hero cannot attack or defend.

name: Dungeon Torch
text:
Guarded. Restricted.
Action: Raise your threat by 2 to claim this objective when it is free of encounters. When claimed, attach Dungeon Torch to a hero you control. (Counts as an attachment. If detached, return Dungeon Torch to the staging area.)
Forced: At the end of each round, raise attached hero's controller's threat by 2.

name: Shadow Key
text:
Guarded. Restricted.
Action: Raise your threat by 2 to claim this objective when it is free of encounters. When claimed, attach Shadow key to a hero you control. (Counts as an attachment. If detached, return Shadow Key to the staging area.)
Forced: At the end of each round, attached hero suffers 1 damage.

name: Misty Mountain Goblins
text: Forced: After Misty Mountain Goblins attacks, remove 1 progress token from the current quest.

name: Massing at Night
text: When Revealed: Reveal X additional cards from the encounter deck. X is the number of players in the game.

name: Banks of the Anduin
text: Forced: If Banks of the Anduin leaves play, return it to the top of the encounter deck instead of placing it in the discard pile.

name: Gladden Fields
text: Forced: While Gladden Fields is the active location, each player must raise his threat by an additional point during the refresh phase.

name: Eastern Crows
text:
Surge.
Forced: After Eastern Crows is defeated, shuffle it back into the encounter deck.

name: Evil Storm
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each character controlled by each player with a threat of 35 or higher.

name: Pursued by Shadow
text: When Revealed: Each player raises his threat by 1 for each character he controls that is not currently committed to a quest.

name: Treacherous Fog
text: When Revealed: Each location in the staging area gets +1 Threat Strength until the end of the phase. Then, each player with a threat of 35 or higher chooses and discards 1 card from his hand.

name: Flies and Spiders
text: Setup: Search the encounter deck for 1 copy of the Forest Spider and 1 copy of the Old Forest Road, and add them to the staging area. Then Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: A Fork in the Road
text: Forced: When you defeat this stage, proceed to one of the 2 "A Chosen Path" stages at random.

name: A Chosen Path: "Don't Leave the Path!"
text:
When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 Spider card of his choice, and add it to the staging area.
The Players must find and defeat Ungoliant's Spawn to win this game.

name: A Chosen Path: Beorn's Path
text: Players cannot defeat this stage while Ungoliant's Spawn is in play. If players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: The Necromancer's Tower
text: Setup: Search the encounter deck for the 3 objective cards, and place them in the staging area. Also, place the Nazgul of Dol Guldur face up but out of play, alongside the quest deck. Then, shuffle the encounter deck, and attach 1 encounter to each objective card.

name: Through the Caverns
text:
Response: After placing any number of progress tokens on this card, flip the "prisoner" hero card face-up, and place 1 damage token on it. This hero has been "rescued," and may now be used by its controller.

The players, as a group, cannot play more than 1 ally card each round.

Players cannot advance to the next stage of this quest unless they have rescued the prisoner and have all 3 "Escape from Dol Guldur" objective cards.

name: Out of the Dungeons
text:
Forced: At the beginning of each quest phase, each player places the top card of his deck, face down in front of him, as if it just engaged him from the staging area. These cards are called "Orc Guard," and act as enemies with 1 hit point, 1 Attack, and 1 Defense.

Players cannot defeat this stage while Nazgul of Dol Guldur is in play. If this stage is defeated and Nazgul of Dol Guldur is not in play, the players have won the game.

name: To the River...
text: Setup: Each player reveals 1 card from the top of the encounter deck, and adds it to the staging area.

name: Anduin Passage
text: Reveal 1 additional card from the encounter deck each quest phase. Do not make engagement checks during the encounter phase. (Each player may still optionally engage 1 enemy each encounter phase.)

name: Ambush on the Shore
text:
When Revealed: Reveal 2 encounter cards per player, and add them to the staging area.
Skip the staging step of the quest phase for the remainder of the game.
Once there are no enemies in play, the players have won the game.

flavor:
"Well, my dear fellow," said Bilbo, "now you've heard the news, can't you spare me a moment? I want your help in something urgent."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Bilbo Baggins
text: The first player draws 1 additional card in the resource phase.

name: Dúnedain Mark
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +1 [attack] Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dúnedain Mark to another hero.

flavor: "It is a fair tale, though it is sad, as are all the tales of Middle-earth, and yet it may lift up your hearts." <cite>Strider, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Campfire Tales
text: Action: Each player draws 1 card.

name: Winged Guardian
text: Sentinel. Winged Guardian cannot have restricted attachments. Forced: After an attack in which Winged Guardian defends resolves, pay 1 [tactics] resource or discard Winged Guardian from play.

flavor: "The Eagles! The Eagles!" <cite>Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit</cite>
name: The Eagles Are Coming!
text: Action: Search the top 5 cards of your deck for any number of Eagle cards and add them to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

flavor: "Your own valour has done more, and the stout legs of the Westfold-men marching through the night." <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Westfold Horse-Breaker
text: Action: Discard Westfold Westfold Horse-Breaker to choose and ready a hero.

flavor: "More speed we cannot make, if the strength of Rohan is to be gathered." <cite>Éomer, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Mustering the Rohirrim
text: Action: Search the top 10 cards of your deck for any 1 Rohan card and add it to your hand. Then, shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

flavor: As Elrond entered and went towards the seat prepared for him, Elvish minstrels began to make sweet music. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Rivendell Minstrel
text: Response: After you play Rivendell Minstrel from your hand, search your deck for 1 Song card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

flavor: "My cuts, short or long, don't go wrong." <cite>Strider, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Strider's Path
text: Response: After a location is revealed from the encounter deck, immediately travel to that location without resolving its Travel effect. If another location is currently active, return it to the staging area.

flavor:
From the ashes a fire shall be woken,
A light from the shadows shall spring:
Renewed shall be blade that was broken,
The crownless again shall be king.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Song of Kings
text:
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains a [leadership] resource icon.

name: The Hunt Begins
text:
Setup: Reveal 1 card per player from the encounter deck, and add it to the staging area.

Forced: After the players quest successfully, the first player looks at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Reveal and add 1 of those cards to the staging area, and discard the other 2 cards.

name: A New Terror Abroad
text: Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, the first player looks at the top 2 cards of the encounter deck. Reveal and add 1 of those cards to the staging area, and discard the other.

name: On the Trail
text:
Any player who does not control a hero with at least 1 Clue objective attached cannot commit characters to this quest. If there are ever no heroes with Clue objectives attached in play, reset the quest deck to stage 2B.

If the players defeat this stage, the players have once again found a true sign of Gollum's passing, and won the game.

name: Signs of Gollum
text:
Guarded.
Response: After the players quest successfully, the players may claim Signs of Gollum if it has no attached encounters. When claimed, attach Signs of Gollum to any hero committed to the quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with: "Forced: After attached hero is damaged or leaves play, return this card to the top of the encounter deck.")

name: The Old Ford
text: X is the number of ally cards in play.

name: The Eaves of Mirkwood
text: While The Eaves of Mirkwood is the active location, encounter card effects cannot be canceled.

name: River Ninglor
text: While River Ninglor is the active location, remove 1 progress token from it and from the current quest at the end of each round.

name: The East Bank
text: While The East Bank is the active location, ally cards cost 1 additional matching resource to play from hand.

name: The West Bank
text: While The West Bank is the active location, attachment and event cards cost 1 additional matching resource to play from hand.

name: Goblintown Scavengers
text: When Revealed: Discard the top card of each player's deck. Until the end of the phase, increase Goblintown Scavenger's Threat by the total printed cost of all cards discarded in this way.

name: Hunters From Mordor
text: Hunters from Mordor get +2 ATK and +2 Threat for each Clue card in play.

name: False Lead
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses and shuffles a card with the printed Clue trait back into the encounter deck. If there are no Clue cards in play, False Lead gains surge.

name: Flooding
text:
Doomed 1. Surge.
When Revealed: Remove all progress tokens from all Riverland locations.

name: Old Wives' Tales
text: When Revealed: Discard 1 resource from each hero's resource pool, if able. Exhaust any hero that could not discard a resource from its pool.

flavor: Frodo began to feel restless, and the old paths seemed too well-trodden. he looked at maps and wondered what lay beyond their edges... <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Frodo Baggins
text: Response: After Frodo Baggins is damaged, cancel the damage and instead raise your threat by the amount of damage he would have been dealt. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Dúnedain Warning
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +1 [defense] Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dúnedain Warning to another hero.

flavor:
...he was just sitting down to a nice little second-breakfast in the dinning-room...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Second Breakfast
text: Action: Each player returns the topmost attachment card from his discard pile to his hand.

flavor: "We are getting near," said Gandalf. "We are on th eedge of his bee pastures." <cite> The Hobbit</cite>
name: Beorning Beekeeper
text: Action: Discard Beorning Beekeeper from play to deal 1 damage to each enemy in the staging area.

flavor: "Very well," said Gandalf. "Take us where and as far as you will!" <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Born Aloft
text: Attach to an ally. Action: Discard Born Aloft from play to return attached ally to its owner's hand.

flavor: "You I have not seen before, for you are young, but I have spoken with Eomund your father..." <cite>Aragorn, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Éomund
text: Response: After Éomund leaves play, ready all Rohan characters in play.

flavor: "Nor indeed am I a stranger: for I have been in this land before, more than once, and ridden with the host of the Rohirrim, though under other name and in other guise." <cite>Aragorn, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Nor am I a Stranger
text: Attach to a character. Attached character gains the Rohan trait.

flavor: On the table in the light of a big lamp with a red shade he spread a piece of parchment rather like a map. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Longbeard Map-Maker
text: Action: Spend 1 [lore] resource to give Longbeard Map-Maker +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

flavor:
"Keep close to the fire, with your faces outward!" cried Strider. "Keep some of th elonger sticks ready in your hands."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: A Burning Brand
text:
Attach to a [lore] character.
While attached character is defending, cancel any shadow effects on cards dealt to the attacking enemy.

flavor:
It sit beside the fire and think
of all that I have seen,
of meadow-flowers and butterflies
in summers that have been
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Song of Wisdom
text:
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains a [lore] resource icon.

name: Grimbeorn's Quest
text:
Setup: Add The Carrock to the staging area. Remove 4 unique Troll cards and 4 copies of the "Sacked!" card from the encounter deck and set them aside, out of play. Then shuffle 1 "Sacked!" card per player back into the encounter deck.

Forced: After placing the 7th progress token on Grimbeorn's Quest, The Carrock becomes the active location. Discard the previous active location from play.

name: Against the Trolls
text:
When Revealed: Place the unique Troll cards previously set aside into theh staging area.
Players cannot defeat this stage if there are any Troll enemies in play.

name: Grimbeorn the Old
text:
Grimbeorn the Old does not exhaust to defend against Troll enemies.
If Grimbeorn the Old has 8 or more resource tokens on him, he joins the first player as an ally.
Action: Spend 1 Leadership resource to place that resource on Grimbeorn the Old.

name: Louis
text:
While Louis is engaged with a player, all Troll enemies gain, "Forced: After this enemy attacks, the defending player must raise his threat by 3."
Response: After defeating Louis, you may choose and discard 1 "Sacked!" card from play.

name: Morris
text:
While Morris is engaged with a player, all Troll enemies get +1 ATK.
Response: After defeating Morris, you may choose and discard 1 "Sacked!" card from play.

name: Stuart
text:
While Stuart is engaged with a player, all Troll enemies get +1 DEF.
Response: After defeating Stuart, you may choose and discard 1 "Sacked!" card from play.

name: Rupert
text:
Forced: After Rupert attacks, shuffle all copies of the "Sacked!" card from the discard pile back into the encounter deck.

Response: After defeating Rupert, you may choose and discard 1 "Sacked! card from play.

name: Muck Adder
text: Forced: If Muck Adder damages a character, discard that character from play.

name: The Carrock
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Players cannot travel to The Carrock except through quest card effects.
While The Carrock is the active location, Troll enemies get +1 ATK and +1 DEF.

name: River Langflood
text: While it is in the staging area, River Langflood gets +1 Threat for each Troll enemy in play.

name: Bee Pastures
text: Response: After you travel to Bee Pastures, search the encounter deck and discard pile for Grimbeorn the Old and add him to the staging area. Then shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Oak-wood Grove
text: While Oak-wood Grove is the active location, resource tokens from any sphere may be spent as Leadership resource tokens.

name: A Frightened Beast
text: When Revealed: Each player raises his threat by the total Threat of all cards in the staging area. Any player may choose to discard from play 1 Creature ally card he controls to cancel this effect.

name: Sacked
text: When Revealed: Attach to a hero with no "Sacked!" cards attached controlled by the first player. (Cannot be canceled.) Counts as a condition attachment with the text: "Attached hero cannot attack, defend, commit to a quest, tirgger its effect, or collect resources."

name: Roasted Slowly
text: When Revealed: Destroy all heroes with the card "Sacked!" attached. Then, shuffle Roasted Slowly back into the encounter deck.

flavor: But beyond, in the great fief of Belfalas, dwelt Prince Imrahil in his castle of Dol Amroth by the sea, and he was of high blood, and his fold also, tall men and proud with sea-grey eyes. <cite>The Return of the King.</cite>
name: Prince Imrahil
text: Response: After a character leaves play, ready Prince Imrahil. (Limit once per round.)

name: Dúnedain Quest
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +1 [willpower] Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dúnedain Quest to another hero.

flavor: Inside the hall there was piled a large assortment of packages and parcels and small articles of furniture. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Parting Gifts
text: Action: Move any number of resource tokens from a [leadership] hero's resource pool to any other hero's resource pool.

name: Landroval
text: Sentinel. Landroval cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After a hero card is destroyed, return Landroval to his owner's hand to put that hero back into play, with 1 damage token on it. (Limit once per game.)

flavor: The pale peaks of the mountains were coming nearer, moonlit spikes of rock sticking out of black shadows. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: To the Eyrie
text: Response: After an ally is destroyed, exhaust 1 Eagle character to move that ally from the discard pile to its owner's hand.

name: Escort from Edoras
text: While committed to a quest, Escort from Edoras gets +2 [willpower] Forced: After resolving a quest to which Escort from Edoras was committed, discard Escort from Edoras from play.

flavor: The Mathom-house it was called; for anything that Hobbits had no immediate use for, but were unwilling to throw away, they called a mathom. Their dwellings were apt to become rather crowded with mathoms... <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Ancient Mathom
text: Attach to a location. Response: After attached location is explored, the first player draws 3 cards.

flavor: "But there are some of us still who go abroad for the gathering of news and the watching of our enemies, and they speak the languages of other lands." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Haldir of Lórien
text: Ranged. Sentinel.

flavor: That's cursed rebel-talk, and I'll stick you, if you don't shut it down, see? <cite>Orc Soldier, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Infighting
text: Action: Move any number of damage from one enemy to another.

flavor: "I have an urgent errand. My news is evil."
name: Radagast
text: Radagast collects 1 resource each resource phase. These resources can be used to pay for Creature cards played from your hand. Action: Spend X resources from Radagast's pool to heal X wounds on any 1 Creature.

name: The Wounded Eagle
text: Setup: Search the encounter deck for Rhosgobel and Wilyador, and add them to the staging area with 2 damage tokens on Wilyador. Then, shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Radagast's Request
text:
Response: After the quest phase begins, the first player may place X dmage tokens on Wilyador to look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Reveal and add 1 of these cards to the staging area, and discard the other 2. X is the number of players in the game.
Forced: After a card effect heals Wilyador, remove that card from the game.

name: Return to Rhosgobel
text:
When Revealed: Heal 5 wounds from Wilyador for each Athelas objective card the players control.
If Wilyador is completely healed when this effect resolves, Wilyador survives and the players have won the game. Otherwise, the players have lost the game.

name: Athelas
text:
Guarded.
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective if it has no encounters attached. Then, attach Athelas to that hero.

name: Wilyador
text:
No attachments. The first player gains control of Wilyador, as an ally.
Forced: At the end of each round, Wilyador suffers 2 damage.
Wilyador cannot be healed of more than 5 wounds by a single effect. If Wilyador leaves play, the players have lost the game.

name: Rhosgobel
text:
X is the number of players in the game.
While Rhosgobel is in the staging area, Wilyador cannot be healed.
Travel: Players must complete stage one of this quest before they can travel to Rhosgobel.

name: Forest Grove
text: Response: After the players explore Forest Grove, search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 Athelas objective, and add it to the staging area. Then, shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Exhaustion
text: When Revealed: Deal 2 damage to each exhausted character.

name: Swarming Insects
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each character without any attachments.

name: Festering Wounds
text: When Revealed: Deal 2 damage to each wounded character.

name: Mirkwood Flock
text: Only Eagle characters or characters with ranged can attack or defend against Mirkwood Flock.

name: Black Forest Bats
text: Only Eagle characters or characters with ranged can attack or defend against Black Forest Bats.

flavor:
"The grandson of Bard the Bowman rules them, Brand son of Bain son of Bard."
<cite>Glóin, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Brand son of Bain
text: Ranged. Response: After Brand son of Bain attacks and defeats an enemy engaged with another player, choose and ready one of that player's characters.

flavor:
Then something Tookish woke up inside him...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Keen-eyed Took
text: Response: After Keen-eyed Took enters play, reveal the top card of each player's deck. Action: Return Keen-eyed Took to your hand to discard the top card of each player's deck.

flavor:
In the dark at the rear, grim and silent, walked Aragorn.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Rear Guard
text: Quest Action: Discard a [leadership] ally to give each hero committed to this quest +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: Descendant of Thorondor
text: Descendant of Thorondor cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After Descendant of Thorondor enters or leaves play, deal 2 damage to any 1 enemy in the staging area.

flavor:
Not event an eagle poised against the sun would have marked the hobbits sitting there, under the weight of doom...
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Meneldor's Flight
text: Action: Choose an Eagle ally. Return that character to its owner's hand.

flavor:
"And there are no horses like the ones that are bred in that great vale between the Misty Mountains and the White."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: The Riddermark's Finest
text: Action: Exhaust and discard The Riddermark's Finest to place 2 progress tokens on any location.

flavor:
"Death! Ride, ride to ruin and the world's ending!"
<cite>Éomer, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Ride to Ruin
text: Action: Discard a Rohan ally to choose a location. Place 3 progress tokens on that location.

flavor: "Go not to the Elves for counsel, for they will say both no and yes." <cite>Frodo Baggins, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Gildor Inglorion
text: Action: Exhaust Gildor Inglorion to look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Switch one of those cards with a card from your hand. Then, return the 3 cards to the top of your deck, in any order.

flavor:
"The wide world is all about you: you can fence yourselves in, but you cannot for ever fence it out."
<cite>Gildor, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Gildor's Counsel
text: Play during the Quest phase, before characters are committed to the Quest. Action: Reveal 1 less card from the encounter deck this phase. (To a minimum of 1.)

flavor:
The Road goes ever on and on
Down from the door where it began.
Now far ahead the road has gone,
And I must follow, if I can.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Song of Travel
text:
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains a [spirit] resource icon.

name: The Hills of Emyn Muil
text:
Setup: Search the encounter deck for Amon Hen and Amon Lhaw, and add them to the staging area. The shuffle the encounter deck.

Forced: If there are no location cards in the staging area, the first treachery card revealed during the quest phase gains surge.

Players cannot defeat this stage unless there are no Emyn Muil locations in play, and they have collected at least 20 victory points.

name: Amon Hen
text:
X is double the number of players in the game.

While Amon Hen is the active location, players cannot play events.

name: Amon Lhaw
text:
X is double the number of players in the game.
While Amon Lhaw is the active location, treat all attachments as if their printed text boxes were blank.

name: The East Wall of Rohan
text: While The East Wall of Rohan is the active location, non-Rohan characters cost 2 additional matching resources to play.

name: The North Stair
text: Forced: After traveling to The North Stair, move the top card of the encounter discard pile to the staging area. Resolve any "when revealed" effects on that card.

name: Rauros Falls
text: While Rauros Falls is the active location, all characters must commit to the current quest during the quest phase.

name: The Shores of Nen Hithoel
text: Travel: The first player must discard 1 event card from his hand to travel to this location.

name: The Outer Ridge
text: While The Outer Ridge is the active location, each location in the staging area gets +1 Threat.

name: The Highlands
text: Travel: In order to travel to The Highlands, the players must reveal the top card of the encounter deck, and add it to the staging area.

name: Impassable Chasm
text: When Revealed: If there is an active location, remove all progress tokens from that location and return it to the staging area. If no location is moved by this effect, this card gains surge.

name: Rockslide
text: When Revealed: Deal 2 damage to each character committed to this quest.

name: Slick Footing
text: When Revealed: Remove 1 progress token from each location in play. Then, discard the top card of each player's deck for each progress token removed by this effect.

name: Orc Horse Thieves
text:
Doomed 2.
Orc Horse Thieves get +1 ATK for each location in the staging area.

flavor: "...in Gondor we must trust to such weapons as we have." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Boromir
text: Action: Raise your threat by 1 to ready Boromir. (Limit once per phase.) Action: Discard Boromir to deal 2 damage to each enemy engaged with a single player.

flavor: "If simple folk are free from care and fear, simple they will be, and we must be secret to keep them so. That has been the task of my kindred, while the years have lengthened and the grass has grown." <cite>Strider, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Dúnedain Watcher
text: Response: Discard Dúnedain Watcher from play to cancel the shadow effects of a card just triggered.

name: Dúnedain Cache
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains ranged. Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dúnedain Cache to another hero.

name: Vassal of the Windlord
text: Ranged.Vassal of the Windlord cannot have restricted attachments. Forced: After an attack in which Vassal of the Windlord attacked resolves, discard Vassal of the Windlord from play.

flavor:
Old fat spider spinning in a tree!
Old fat spider can't see me!
Attercop! Attercop!
Won't you stop. Stop your spinning and look for me!
<cite>Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Song of Mocking
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust Song of Mocking to choose another hero. Until the end of the phase, attached hero takes all damage assigned to the chosen hero.

flavor: "Buy my lord sends word that we must set ourselves in readiness: orders may come for a sudden move." <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Elfhelm
text: While Elfhelm is ready, he gains: "Response: After your threat is raised as the result of questing unsuccessfully, or by an encounter or quest card effect, reduce your threat by 1."

flavor: "But we must ride more warily; for war is abroad, and the Rohirrim, the Horse-lords, do not sleep, even if it seems so from afar." <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: We Do Not Sleep
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, Rohan characters do not exhaust to commit to quests.

flavor: "The Wood-elves tracked him first, an easy task for them, for his trail was still fresh then." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Rings</cite>
name: Silvan Tracker
text: Response: After a Silvan character readies during the refresh phase, heal 1 damage from that character.

flavor: 'And I put as fast a hitch over the stump as any one could have done, in the Shire or out of it.' <cite>Sam, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Fast Hitch
text: Attach to a Hobbit character. Action: Exhaust Fast Hitch to ready attached character.

flavor: We go, we go, we go to war, to hew the stone and break the door. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Song of Battle
text:
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains a [tactics] resource icon.

name: Into the Marshes
text: Setup: Search the encounter deck for Gollum, and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck, then reveal 1 card per player from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.

name: The Capture
text:
Forced: After this stage is defeated, the first player chooses a player. That player must pass an Escape test, dealing 1 card from the encounter deck for each resource token on Gollum, to capture him. If Gollum is not captured at this time, reset the quest deck to stage 1B
If this final Escape test is passed, the players have captured Gollum and won the game.

name: Gollum
text:
If Gollum ever has 8 or more resource tokens on him, shuffle him back into the encounter deck.
Forced: At the end of the quest phase, the party must make an escape test, dealing 1 card per player from the encounter deck. If this test is failed, place 2 resource tokens on Gollum.

name: A Wisp of Pale Sheen
text:
When Revealed: Place 2 resource tokens on Gollum. Any player may exhaust a [Lore] hero to reduce this effect to 1 resource token.
Escape: 4

name: Nightfall
text:
When Revealed: The first player makes an escape test, dealing 2 cards from the encounter deck. If this test is failed, place 1 resource token on Gollum and raise each player's threat by 2.
Escape: 2

name: Through the Mist
text:
When Revealed: The first player makes an escape test counting [Attack] instead of [Willpower], dealing 2 cards from the encounter deck. If this test is failed, place 1 resource token on Gollum and raise each player's threat by 1.
Escape: 3

name: The Lights of the Dead
text:
When Revealed: Each player must make an escape test, dealing 2 cards from the encounter deck for each test. Each player that fails this test places 1 resource token on Gollum, an draises his threat by 1.
Escape 5.

name: Giant Marsh Worm
text:
Forced: Remove 2 damage from Giant Marsh Worm at the end of each round.
Escape: 2

name: Impassable Bog
text:
When Revealed: Place 1 resource token on Gollum for each location card in the staging area.

Escape: 2

Victory: 7

name: The Heart of the Marshes
text:
While The Heart of the Marshes is the active location, all cards dealt from the encounter deck for escape tests get +1 Escape. (Cards recieve this bonus even if they do not have a printed escape value.)
Escape: 1

name: Fens and Mires
text:
Forced: After the players travel to this location, place 1 resource token on Gollum.
Escape: 2

flavor: "You have not heard of Dáin and the dwarves of the Iron Hills?" <cite>Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Dáin Ironfoot
text: While Dáin Ironfoot is ready, Dwarf characters get +1 [attack] and +1 [willpower].

name: Dúnedain Signal
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains sentinel. Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dúnedain Signal to another hero.

flavor: "Dawn take you all, and be stone to you!" <cite>Gandalf, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Dawn Take You All
text: Play after shadow cards have been dealt, before any attacks have resolved. Combat Action: Each player may choose and discard 1 facedown shadow card from an enemy with which he is engaged.

name: Eagles of the Misty Mountains
text: Eagles of the Misty Mountains cannot have restricted attachments. Eagles of the Misty Mountains gets +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] for each facedown attachment it has. Response: After another Eagle character leaves play, you may attach that card facedown to Eagles of the Misty Mountains.

flavor: "I would bear you, whither you will, even were you made of stone." <cite>Gwaihir, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Support of the Eagles
text: Attach to a [tactics] hero. Action: Exhaust Support of the Eagles to choose an Eagle ally. Until the end of the phase, attached hero adds that ally's [attack] or [defense] (choose 1) to its own.

flavor:
The dark world was rushing by, and the wind sang loudly in his ears.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: West Road Traveller
text: Response: After you play West Road Traveller from your hand, switch the active location with any other location in the staging area.

flavor: With astonishing speed and skill they checked their steeds, wheeled, and came charging round. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Astonishing Speed
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, all Rohan characters get +2 [willpower]

name: Mirkwood Runner
text:
While Mirkwood Runner is attacking alone, the defending enemy does not count its [defense].
"...let a ploughman plough, but choose an otter for swimming, and for running light over grass and leaf or over snow-an Elf."
–Legolas, The Fellowship of the Ring

flavor: 'Where sight fails the earth may bring us rumour,' said Aragorn. 'The land must groan under their hated feet.' <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Rumour from the Earth
text: Action: Look at the top card of the encounter deck. Then, you may pay 1 [lore] resource to return Rumour from the Earth to your hand.

flavor: The wizard's face remained grave and attentive, and only a flicker in his deep eyes showed that he was startled and indeed alarmed. 'It has been called that before,' he said, 'but not by you.' <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Shadow of the Past
text: Action: Move the top card of the encounter discard pile to the top of the encounter deck.

name: Through the Forest
text: Setup: Search the encounter deck for Gollum. Choose a player to guard Gollum at the start of the game, and place Gollum in front of that player. Then shuffle the encounter deck. Reveal 1 card per player from the encounter deck, and add it to the staging area.

name: Escape Attempt
text:
The player guarding Gollum cannot commit characters to this quest (unless he is the only player remaining in the game).
If the players quest unsuccessfully, Gollum escapes and the players have lost the game.

name: To the Elvin King's Halls
text: The player guarding Gollum cannot play cards from his hand.

name: Ambush
text:
Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, all enemies in play engage the player guarding Gollum.
Players cannot defeat this stage if there are any enemies in play. If players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Gollum
text:
Damage from undefended attacks against you must be dealt to Gollum. If Gollum is destroyed, or if the player guarding Gollum is eliminated, the players have lost the game.
Forced: At the end of each round, raise the threat of the player guarding Gollum by 3. Then, that player may choose a new player to guard Gollum.

name: The Spider's Ring
text: While The Spider's Ring is the active location, the player guarding Gollum cannot change.

name: Dry Watercourse
text: While Dry Watercourse is the active location, all treachery card effects that target the player guarding Gollum also target each other player.

name: Woodman's Glade
text:
Travel: The player guarding Gollum must exhaust a hero he controls to travel to Woodman's Glade.
Response: After exploring Woodman's Glade, reduce the threat of each player not guarding Gollum by 2

name: Wood Elf Path
text: Response: After the players travel to Wood Elf Path, the player guarding Gollum may choose a new player to guard him.

name: Gollum's Anguish
text: When Revealed: Raise the threat of the player guarding Gollum by 8. That player must choose a new player to guard Gollum, if able.

name: Gollum's Bite
text: When Revealed: Deal 4 damage to a hero controlled by the player guarding Gollum. That player must choose a new player to guard Gollum, if able.

name: Wasted Provisions
text: When Revealed: Discard the top 10 cards from the deck of the player guarding Gollum. That player must choose a new player to guard Gollum, if able.

name: Mirkwood Bats
text:
Surge.
Forced: After Mirkwood Bats engages a player, deal 1 damage to each character controlled by the player guarding Gollum.

name: Attercop, Attercop
text: Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, Attercop, Attercop automatically engages the player guarding Gollum, regardless of his threat.

flavor:
It was a dwarf with a blue beard tucked into a golden belt, and very bright eyes under his dark-green hood.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Dwalin
text: Response: After Dwalin attacks and destroys an Orc enemy, lower your threat by 2.

flavor: "And winter comes after autumn." <cite>Bifur, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Bifur
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from a hero's resource pool to add 1 resource to Bifur's resource pool. Any player may trigger this ability. (Limit once per round.)

name: Narvi's Belt
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Action: Exhaust Narvi's Belt to give attached hero a [leadership], [lore], [tactics] or [spirit] icon until the end of the phase.

flavor:
A king he was on carven throne
In many-pillared halls of stone
With golden roof and silver floor,
And runes of power upon the door.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Durin's Song
text: Action: Choose a Dwarf hero. That hero gets +2 [willpower], +2 [attack], and +2 [defense] until the end of the round.

name: Ever Onward
text: Response: After players quest unsuccessfully, choose a player. That player does not raise his threat.

flavor: With cries of "Moria!" and "Dain, Dain!" the dwarves of the Iron Hills plunged in... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Veteran of Nanduhirion
text: Veteran of Nanduhirion enters play with 1 damage on it.

flavor: "We make good armour and keen swords, but we cannot again make mail or blade to match those that were made before the dragon came." <cite>Gloin, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Dwarrowdelf Axe
text: Restricted. Attach to a Dwarf character. Attached character gets +1 [attack] Response: After attached character attacks, deal 1 damage to the defending enemy.

name: Khazâd! Khazâd!
text: Action: Choose a Dwarf character. Until the end of the phase, that character gets +3 [attack].

name: Zigil Miner
text: Action: Exhaust Zigil Miner and name a number to discard the top 2 cards of your deck. If at least one of those cards has cost equal to the named number, choose a hero you control. For each card that matches the named number, add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

name: Untroubled by Darkness
text: Action: Each Dwarf character gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase. (+2 [willpower] instead if the active location is an Underground or Dark location.)

name: Erebor Record Keeper
text: Erebor Record Keeper cannot attack or defend. Action: Exhaust Erebor Record Keeper and pay 1 [lore] resource to choose and ready a Dwarf character.

name: Ancestral Knowledge
text: Action: Exhaust a Dwarf character to place 2 progress tokens on the active location. (4 progress tokens instead if it is an Underground or Mountain location.)

name: Boots from Erebor
text: Attach to a Dwarf or Hobbit character. Limit 1 Boots from Erebor per character. Attached character gets +1 hit point.

name: Patrol Leader
text: Forced: Before patrol Leader is dealt damage, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card is an enemy, cancel the damage.

name: Signs of Conflict
text: Doomed 2. Surge.

name: East-gate
text:
Immune to card effects.
Players cannot optionally engage enemies and no engagement checks are made.
Forced: After East-gate leaves play as an explored location, add First Hall to the staging area.

Victory 1.

name: First Hall
text:
Travel: Each player must raise his threat by 3 to travel here.
Forced: After First Hall leaves play as an explored location, add Bridge of Khazad-dum to the staging area.

Victory 1.

name: Bridge of Khazad-dum
text:
While Bridge of Khazad-dum is the active location, players cannot play cards.

Victory 2.

name: Stairs of Nain
text: Travel: The first player must exhaust 1 character he controls to travel here.

name: Cave-troll
text:
For each excess point of combat damage dealt by Cave-troll (damage that is dealt beyond the remaining hit points of the character damaged by its attack) you must damage another character you control.
Victory 2.

name: Orc Horn Blower
text:
Surge.
When Revealed. Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.

name: Hidden Threat
text: When Revealed: Each player must raise his threat by 1 for each enemy in the staging area. Then, The last player discards an attachment he controls.

name: Upper Hall
text: Doomed 2.

name: Book of Mazarbul
text:
Restricted.
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective. Then, attach Book of Mazarbul to that hero. (If detached, return Book of Mazarbul to the staging area.)
Attached hero cannot attack and does not exhaust to commit to a quest.

name: The Nameless Fear
text:
Immune to player card effects. The Nameless Fear cannot engage or be engaged.
X is the number of victory points in the victory display.

name: New Devilry
text: When Revealed: If the players are not on stage 1, shuffle the current quest card into the quest deck, then reveal a new quest card. Otherwise, New Devilry gains surge.

name: Shadow of Fear
text: When Revealed: The first player attaches Shadow of Fear to one of his heroes. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero cannot exhaust or ready and its text box is treated as if it were blank. Action: Pay 3 resources from attached hero's pool to discard this card.")

name: A Foe Beyond
text: When Revealed: The last player deals damage equal to The Nameless Fear's [Attack] to a hero he controls. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Abandoned Tools
text:
Guarded. Restricted.
Action: Exhaust a her to claim this objective if it has no encounters attached. Then, attach Abandoned Tools to that hero. (If detached, return Abandoned Tools to the staging area.)

name: Chieftain of the Pit
text: When Revealed: Chieftain of the Pit gets +3 [Attack] until the end of the round.

name: Goblin Spearman
text: Goblin Spearman gets +2 [Attack] if its attack is undefended.

name: Goblin Archer
text:
Players cannot optionally engage Goblin Archer.
Characters with ranged are eligible to attack Goblin Archer while it is in the staging area.
Forced: After an enemy is revealed from the encounter deck, the first player must deal 1 damage to 1 character he controls.

name: Undisturbed Bones
text: When Revealed: Each player must deal X damage to 1 ally he controls. X is the number of allies he controls.

name: Plundered Armoury
text:
While Plundered Armoury is in the staging area, enemies get +1 [Attack].
Response: After Plundered Armoury leaves play as an explored location, each player may attach a Weapon or Armour attachment from his hand to 1 character he controls.

name: Goblin Follower
text: When Revealed: Goblin Follower engages the last player.

name: Branching Paths
text:
While Branching Paths is in the staging area each Dark location gets +1 [Threat].
Forced: After Branching Paths leaves play as an explored location, look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Players must choose 1 of those to reveal and add to the staging area, moving the other 2 to the bottom of the deck.

name: Lightless Passage
text: Travel: Players must exhaust a Cave Torch to travel here.

name: Zigil Mineshaft
text: Action: Raise each player's threat by 1 to place 1 progress token on Zigil Mineshaft.

name: Many Roads
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Shuffle all locations in the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

name: Burning Low
text: When Revealed: Each enemy and location currently in the staging area gets +1 [Threat] until the end of the phase. (+3 [Threat] instead if it is a Dark location.) Players may exhaust a Cave Torch to cancel this effect.

name: Cave Torch
text:
Attach to a hero. Restricted.
Action: Exhaust Cave Torch to place up to 3 progress tokens on a Dark location.
Forced: After Cave Torch exhausts, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is an enemy, add it to the staging area.

name: Great Cave-troll
text:
Immune to ranged damage.
No attachments can be played on Great Cave-troll.

Victory 3.

name: Orc Drummer
text: While Orc Drummer is in the staging area, each enemy gets +X [Threat]. X is the number of players in the game.

name: Stray Goblin
text: X is the number of players in the game.

name: Chance Encounter
text: When Revealed: Put the top enemy in the encounter discard pile into play, engaged with the first player. If this effect put no enemies into play, Chance Encounter gains surge.

name: Massing in the Deep
text:
Doomed 1.
When Revealed: Reveal X additional cards from the encounter deck and add them to the staging area. X is the number of players in the game.

name: The Mountains' Roots
text: X is the number of players in the game.

name: Cave In
text: When Revealed: Remove all progress tokens from the current quest card and active location. If Cave In removed no progress tokens, it gains surge.

name: Crumbling Ruin
text: When Revealed: Each player must exhaust a character and discard the top card of his deck, if able. If the printed cost of the discarded card is equal to or higher than the remaining hit points of the exhausted character, discard the exhausted character.

name: Dark and Dreadful
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each exhausted character. (2 damage instead if the active location is a Dark location.)

name: Sudden Pitfall
text: When Revealed: The first player must discard 1 questing character he controls, if able. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Dreadful Gap
text:
When Revealed: Immediately travel to Dreadful Gap. If another location is currently active, return it to the staging area.
X is the number of characters in play.
Victory 3.

name: Fouled Well
text: When Revealed: Each player may choose and discard 1 card at random from his hand. If all players did not discard 1 card, Fouled Well gains surge.

name: Black Uruks
text: When Revealed: The first player must choose and discard an attachment from a questing character, if able.

name: Mountain Warg
text: If Mountain Warg is dealt a shadow card with no effect, return Mountain Warg to the staging area after it attacks.

name: Bitter Wind
text: When Revealed: The first player must discard 3 resources from each hero he controls.

name: Knees of the Mountain
text: While Knees of the Mountain is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: After an enemy engages a player, it gets +1 [Attack] until the end of the round."

name: Turbulent Waters
text: While Turbulent Waters is the active location, players cannot optionally engage enemies.

name: Warg Lair
text:
When Revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 copy of Mountain Warg and add it to the staging area, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Response: After Warg Lair leaves play as an explored location, each player draws 1 card.

name: Goblin Scout
text: Each player with a threat of 25 or higher cannot optionally engage Goblin Scout.

name: Goblin Swordsman
text: Goblin Swordsman gets +2 [Attack] if its attack is undefended.

name: Watchful Eyes
text: When Revealed: The first player attaches Watchful Eyes to one of his heroes. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Forced: If attached hero is exhausted at the end of the combat phase, reveal 1 card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.")

name: Goblin Tunnels
text: While Goblin Tunnels is in the staing area, it gains "Forced: After a Goblin is revealed from the encounter deck, remove a progress token from the current quest card."

name: Entering the Mines
text:
Setup: Search the encounter deck for East-gate and Cave Torch. Put East-gate into play as the active location, and have the first player attach Cave Torch to a hero of his choice. Set First Hall and Bridge of Khazad-dum aside, out of play. Shuffle the encounter deck.

When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card per player, and add it to the staging area.

Players cannot advance to the next stage of the scenario unless Bridge of Khazad-dum is in their victory display.

name: Goblin Patrol
text:
When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 enemy of his choice, and add it to the staging area. One choice must be Patrol Leader, if able.
Forced: After an enemy is revealed from the encounter deck, discard it instead of adding it to the staging area.
If there are no enemies in play, immediately advance to the next stage of the scenario. (Players can also advance by placing 11 progress tokens on Goblin Patrol.)

name: A Way Up
text:
Heroes do not collect resources during the resource phase.
If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Search for the Chamber
text:
Setup: Search the encounter deck for Book of Mazarbul, and have the first player attach it to a hero of his choice. Shuffle the encounter deck.

When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card per player, and add it to the staging area.

name: The Fate of Balin
text:
When Revealed: Remove Book of Mazarbul from the game.
Forced: At the end of the staging step, reveal the top X cards of the encounter deck, adding all enemies to the staging area. Discard the other revealed cards without resolving them. X is the number of players.
If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: A Presence in the Dark
text:
Setup: Prepare the quest deck. Add The Nameless Fear to the staging area. Remove all copies of A Foe Beyond from the encounter deck. Then, shuffle 1 copy of A Foe Beyond per player back into the encounter deck.

When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card per player, and add it to the staging area. Then, add A Presence in the Dark to your victory display.

name: Search for an Exit - Heading Down
text:
While Search for an exit is the active quest card, only flip it to side 2B at the beginning of the staging step.

Forced: If Heading Up is in the player's victory display at the end of any quest phase, shuffle Heading Up back into the quest deck.
Players may bypass this quest card at the end of the combat phase.

Victory 1.

name: Search for an Exit - Heading Up
text:
While Search for an exit is the active quest card, only flip it to side 2B at the beginning of the staging step.

Forced: If Heading Down is in the player's victory display at the end of any quest phase, shuffle Heading Down back into the quest deck.
Players may bypass this quest card at the end of the combat phase.
Victory 1.

name: Search for an Exit - A Wrong Turn
text:
While Search for an exit is the active quest card, only flip it to side 2B at the beginning of the staging step.

When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card per player, and add it to the staging area.

Players may bypass this quest card at the end of the combat phase.
Victory 2.

name: Search for an Exit - Narrow Paths
text:
While Search for an exit is the active quest card, only flip it to side 2B at the beginning of the staging step.

When Revealed: Each player chooses 1 questing character he controls. Each questing character not chosen does not count its [Willpower] until the end of the turn.
Forced: After placing the 1st progress token on Narrow Paths, search the encounter deck and discard pile for Abandoned Tools and add it to the staging area, if able.

Players may bypass this quest card at the end of the combat phase.
Victory 1.

illustrator: Cristi Balanescu and Stacey Dianna Clark
name: Search for an Exit - Hasty Council
text:
While Search for an exit is the active quest card, only flip it to side 2B at the beginning of the staging step.

When Revealed: Shuffle all copies of A Foe Beyond from the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck. Reveal the top 2 cards of the quest deck. Choose 1 to become the active quest (flipped to side 2B) and put the other on the bottom of the quest deck. Then, add Hasty Council to your victory display.
Victory 2.

name: Search for an Exit - Blocked by Shadow
text:
While Search for an exit is the active quest card, only flip it to side 2B at the beginning of the staging step.

When Revealed: The first player chooses 1 of the following
- Each player discards 1 card from the top of the encounter deck. If the card is a treachery card, the discarding player is eliminated from the game.
- Reveals the next quest card, putting Blocked by Shadow on the bottom of the quest deck.

Players may bypass this quest card at the end of the combat phase.
If the players defeat this stage, they escape and win the game.

name: Search for an Exit - Escape from Darkness
text:
While Search for an exit is the active quest card, only flip it to side 2B at the beginning of the staging step.

Abandoned Tools gains: "Refresh Action: Exhaust attached hero to put a progress token on Escape from Darkness."

Players may bypass this quest card at the end of the combat phase.
Progress tokens cannot be placed on Escape from Darkness except by Abandoned Tools. If the players defeat this stage, they escape and win the game.

flavor:
"We will not turn back."
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Elrohir
text: While Elladan is in play, Elrohir gets +2 [defense]. Response: After Elrohir is declared as a defender, pay 1 resource from his resource pool to ready him.

name: Taking Initiative
text: Action: Discard the top card of your deck. If the discarded card's printed cost is equal to or higher than the number of characters you control, draw 2 cards and deal 2 damage to any enemy.

name: Timely Aid
