text: Secrecy 3. Action: Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck and put 1 revealed ally into play, if able. Shuffle all other revealed cards back into your deck.

name: Unseen Strike
text: Action: Choose a character you control. Until the end of the phase, that character gets +3 [attack] while attacking an enemy with a higher engagement cost than your threat.

name: Keeping Count
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gets +1 [attack] for each resource token on another copy of Keeping Count that is above the current number of resource tokens on this card. Forced: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, place 1 resource token on this card.

flavor: "Get up lazy-bones..." <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Bofur
text: Quest Action: Spend 1 [spirit] resource to put Bofur into play from your hand, exhausted and committed to a quest. If you quest successfully this phase and Bofur is still in play, return him to your hand.

name: Renewed Friendship
text: Response: After another player plays an attachment on a hero you control, you may (choose 1): ready 1 of that player's heroes, have that player draw 1 card, or lower that player's threat by 2.

flavor: "They made their first camp on the western side of the great southern spur, which ended in a height called Ravenhill." <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Ravenhill Scout
text: Action: Exhaust Ravenhill Scout to move up to 2 progress tokens from 1 location to another location.

name: Needful to Know
text: Secrecy 2. Action: Raise your threat by 1 to look at the top card of the encounter deck. Then, reduce your threat by X, where X is the threat of that card.

name: Good Meal
text: Attach to a Hobbit hero. Action: Discard Good Meal to lower the cost of the next event you play this round that matches attached hero's sphere by 2.

name: Up the Pass
text:
Setup: Add Caradhras to the staging area. Remove all copies of Snowstorm from the encounter deck and set them aside, out of play. Put Arwen Undomiel into play under the control of the first player.

When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player, and add it to the staging area.

name: Snowdrifts
text:
When Revealed: Shuffle 1 more copy of Snowstorm into the encounter deck than the number of players in the game.

Forced: After placing the 11th progress token on Snowdrifts, discard any active location. Caradhras becomes the active location.

name: The Mountains' Peaks
text:
When Revealed: Shuffle all copies of Snowstorm in the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

Characters are discarded from play if their [Willpower] is ever 0.

Players cannot defeat this stage unlress they have 5 victory points. If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Arwen Undomiel
text:
The first player gains control of Arwen Undomiel, as an ally.
Response: After Arwen Undomiel exhausts, choose a hero. Add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.
If Arwen Undomiel leaves play, the players are defeated.

name: Caradhras
text:
While Caradhras is the active location, questing characters get -1 [Willpower].
Players cannot travel to Caradhras except by quest card effects.

Victory 3.

name: Fanuidhol
text:
While Fanuidhol is the active loction, heroes must spend 1 resource from their resource pool to count their [Willpower] during the quest phase.

Victory 2.

name: Celebdil
text:
While Celebdil is the active location, remove 2 progress tokens from it at the end of each round.

Victory 2.

name: The Dimrill Stair
text:
Travel: Reshuffle all locations in the discard pile and victory display back into the encounter deck. If you reshuffled at least two locations, reduce each player's threat by 11 and discard all copies of Freezing Cold from play.

Victory 1.

name: Rocky Crags
text: Travel: Each player must deal 2 damage to 1 character he controls to travel here.

name: Fell Voices
text: When Revealed: Return the top 2 Snow cards in the encounter discard pile to the top of the encounter deck. If this effect returned less than 2 Snow treachery cards, Fell Voices gains surge.

name: Fallen Stones
text: When Revealed: The first player (choose 1): removes all progress tokens from play, or reveals 2 cards from the encounter deck and adds them to the staging area.

name: Snowstorm
text: When Revealed: Each questing character gets -1 [Willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: Freezing Cold
text: When Revealed: The first player attaches this card to a hero he controls. Counts as a Condition Attachment with the text: "Attached hero gets -2 [Willpower] and cannot commit to a quest. If attached hero has more than 1 copy of Freezing Cold attached, discard attached hero from play."

name: Avalanche
text: When Revealed: Exhaust each ready character and if it is the quest phase commit them to the quest.

name: Mountain Goblin
text: Mountain Goblin gets +1 [Attack] for each Mountain location in the staging area.

name: Mountain Troll
text: Mountain Troll gets +1 [Attack] for each Mountain location in the staging area.

name: Snow Warg
text:
Allies cannot defend while Snow Warg is attacking.
Forced: When Snow Warg attacks, deal 1 damage to the defending character, if able.

flavor:
"Yes, the Dead ride behind."
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Elladan
text: While Elrohir is in play, Elladan gets +2 [attack]. Response: After Elladan is declared as an attacker, pay 1 resource from his resource pool to ready him.

flavor:
They roamed at will southwards, and eastwards even as far as the Misty Mountains; but they were no few and rarely seen.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Dúnedain Wanderer
text: Ranged. Sentinel. Secrecy 3.

flavor:
'The road that I speak of leads to the Mines of Moria,' said Gandalf. Only Gimli lifted up his head; a smouldering fire was in his eyes.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Lure of Moria
text: Action: Ready all Dwarf characters.

name: Rivendell Blade
text: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan character. Restricted. When attached character attacks an enemy, that enemy gets -2 [defense] until the end of the phase.

name: Hail of Stones
text: Action: Exhaust X characters to deal X damage to an enemy in the staging area.

name: Rider of the Mark
text: Action: Spend 1 [spirit] resource to give control of Rider of the Mark to another player. (Limit once per round.) Response: After Rider of the Mark changes control, discard a shadow card dealt to an enemy you are engaged with.

name: Song of Eärendil
text: Attach to a [spirit] hero. Response: After Song of Eärendil enters play, draw 1 card. Response: After another player raises his threat, raise your threat by 1 to reduce that player's threat by 1.

name: Bombur
text: Action: Exhaust Bombur to choose a location. That location gets -1 [threat] until the end of the phase. (That location does not contribute its [threat] instead if it is an Underground location.)

name: Out of the Wild
text: Secrecy 2. Action: Search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for any 1 non-objective card worth no victory points and add it to your victory display. Shuffle the encounter deck. Add Out of the Wild to the victory display.

flavor:
'He is dead then,', said Frodo. 'I feared it was so.'
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: The End Comes
text: Response: After a Dwarf character leaves play, shuffle the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

name: Along the Misty Mountains
text: Setup: Put Arwen Undomiel into play under the control of the first player. Shuffle the encounter deck. Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player, and add them to the staging area.

name: Orc Outpost
text: When Revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for Goblin Gate and add it to the staging area, if able. Then, if there is no active location, Goblin Gate becomes the active location.

name: Approaching Rivendell
text:
When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player, and add it to the staging area.
Characters cannot be healed.
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Arwen Undomiel
text:
The first player gains control of Arwen Undomiel, as an ally.
Response: After Arwen Undomiel exhausts, choose a hero. Add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.
If Arwen Undomiel leaves play, the players are defeated.

name: Ruined Road
text: Response: After you travel to Ruined Road, the first player places 2 progress tokens on it or readies 1 hero he controls.

name: Goblin Gate
text: While Goblin Gate is the active location, the first enemy revealed from the encounter deck each round gains ambush. If that enemy engages a player, it makes an immediate attack (deal and resolve a shadow card).

name: Pathless Country
text: Forced: After at least 1 progress token is placed on Pathless Country, remove 1 progress token from it.

name: Barren Hills
text: While Barren Hills is the active location, ignore ambush.

name: Sleeping Sentry
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each exhausted character. Then, exhaust all ready characters.

name: Followed by Night
text: When Revealed: The first player (choose 1): deals 1 damage to all allies in play and Followed by Night gains surge, or all enemies engaged with players make an immediate attack, if able.

name: Orc Ambush
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: All Orc enemies in the staging area engage teh first player. If there are no Orc enemies in the staging area, return all Orc enemies in the encounter discard pile to the staging area, if able.

name: Goblin Taskmaster
text:
Ambush (After this enemy enters play, each player makes an engagement check against it.)
Forced: After Goblin Taskmaster engages a player, that player deals 2 damage to 1 character he controls.

name: Orc Raiders
text:
Ambush (After this enemy enters play, each player makes an engagement check against it.)
Forced: After Orc Raiders engages a player, that player discards 2 attachments he controls, if able.

name: Crebain
text:
Surge.
While Crebain is in the staging area, encounter card effects cannot be canceled.

name: Wild Bear
text:
Ambush (After this enemy enters play, each player makes an engagement check against it.)
Forced: After Wild Bear engages a player, it makes an immediate attack.

flavor:
"I am older than I look, I might prove useful."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Aragorn
text: Sentinel. Refresh Action: Reduce your threat to your starting threat level. (Limit once per game.)

flavor:
"We have not the time or the tools to bury our comrade fitly, or to raise a mound up over him. A cairn we might build."
<cite>Legolas, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Grave Cairn
text: Response: After a character leaves play, add its [attack] to another character's [attack] until the end of the round.

flavor:
"For the Sword that was Broken is the Sword of Elendil that broke beneath him when he fell."
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Sword that was Broken
text:
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains a [leadership] resource icon.
If attached hero is Aragorn, each character you control gets +1 [willpower].

name: Watcher of the Bruinen
text: Sentinel. Watcher of the Bruinen does not exhaust to defend. Forced: After Watcher of the Bruinen defends, either discard it from play or discard 1 card from your hand.

name: Rivendell Bow
text: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan character, or to Aragorn. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gains ranged. If attached character has the printed ranged keyword, it gets +1 [attack] during a ranged attack.

flavor:
...in whom it was said that the likeness of Lúthien had come on earth again...for she was the Evenstar of her people.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Arwen Undómiel
text: Response: After Arwen Undómiel exhausts, choose a character. That character gains sentinel and gets +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

flavor:
"Believe rather that it is so ordered that we, who sit here, and none others, must now find counsel for the peril of the world."
<cite>Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Elrond's Counsel
text: Action: If you control a unique Noldor character, give another character +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase and lower your threat by 3.

flavor:
"I suppose we haven't lost more than two days by my short cut through the Forest!"
<cite>Frodo, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Short Cut
text: Response: After a location enters play, exhaust a Hobbit character to shuffle that location back into the encounter deck. Then, reveal 1 card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.

name: Legacy of Durin
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Response: After you play a Dwarf character from your hand, draw 1 card.

name: Resourceful
text:
Secrecy 3.
Attach to a hero you control.
Attached hero collects 1 additional resource during the resource phase each round.

name: To the West-door
text:
Setup: Remove The Watcher and Doors of Durin from the encounter deck and set them aside, out of play.
When Revealed: Reveal cards from the top of the encounter deck and add them to the staging area until there is at least X [Threat] in the staging area. X is twice the number of players in the game.

name: The Seething Lake
text:
When Revealed: Add The Watcher to the staging area. Doors of Durin becomes the active location, moving any previous active location to the staging area. Shuffle all Tentacle cards in the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

If the players have at least 3 victory points and defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Doors of Durin
text:
Progress tokens that would be placed on Doors of Durin are instead placed on the current quest card.

Action: Each player may discard any number of cards from his hand. Then, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the first letter of the encounter card's title matches that of one of the discarded player cards, add Doors of Durin to your victory display. (Limit once per round.)

Victory 3.

name: Stair Falls
text: Travel: The first player must exhaust 2 characters to travel here.

name: Perilous Swamp
text: No more than 1 progress token can be placed on Perilous Swamp each round.

name: Makeshift Passage
text: Forced: After you travel to Makeshift Passage, place 2 progress tokens on the current quest card, bypassing any active location.

name: Stagnant Creek
text: When Revealed: Discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card is a Tentacle enemy, add that card to the staging area and raise each player's threat by 5.

name: Ill Purpose
text: When Revealed: All enemies in the staging area engage the player with the highest threat. Then, each player raises his threat by the total [Threat] of all cards in the staging area.

name: Disturbed Waters
text: Doomed 5.

name: The Watcher
text:
Regenerate 2. While there is another Tentacle enemy in play, The Watcher cannot be optionally engaged.
If The Watcher is in the staging area at the end of the combat phase, each player must deal 3 damage to 1 character he controls.

Victory 3.

name: Grasping Tentacle
text: Forced: When Grasping Tentacle is attacked, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card has a shadow effect or is a Tentacle enemy, attach this card to an attacking character as a Tentacle attachment with the text: "Attached character's [Attack] and [Defense] are reduced to 0."

name: Thrashing Tentacle
text: Forced: When Thrashing Tentacle is attacked, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card has a shadow effect or is a Tentacle enemy, deal the damage from the attack to 1 character an attacking player controls (ignoring defense).

name: Striking Tentacle
text: Forced: When Striking Tentacle attacks, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card has a shadow effect or is a Tentacle enemy, this attack is considered undefended.

flavor: "Yet in doubt a man of worth will trust to his own wisdom." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Háma
text: Response: After Háma is declared as an attacker, return a [tactics] event from your discard pile to your hand. Then, choose and discard 1 card from your hand. (Limit 3 times per game for the group.)

name: Wrapped!
text: When Revealed: The first player attaches Wrapped! to a hero he controls. (Counts as a Tentacle attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero cannot exhaust or ready. At the end of the round, discard attached hero from play. Combat Action: Exhaust a hero you control without a Tentacle attachment to discard Wrapped!.")

flavor:
Beside Glorfindel there were several other counsellors of Elrond's household, of whom Erestor was the chief...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Erestor
text: Action: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand to draw 1 card. (Limit once per round.)

name: Fresh Tracks
text: Response: After an enemy is added to the staging area, deal 1 damage to that enemy. Players ignore that enemy while making engagement checks this round.

name: Erebor Battle Master
text: Erebor Battle Master gets +1 [attack] for each other Dwarf ally you control.

flavor:
"And all the arrows of all the hunters in the world would be in vain..."
<cite>Gimli, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Ring Mail
text: Attach to a Dwarf or Hobbit character. Restricted. Attached character gets +1 hit point and +1 [defense].

name: Out of Sight
text: Secrecy 3. Action: Enemies engaged with you cannot attack you this phase.

flavor:
'This is more to my liking,' said the dwarf, stomping on the stones. 'Ever my heart rises as we draw near the mountains.'
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Ever My Heart Rises
text: Attach a Dwarf character. Response: After you travel to a Mountain or Underground location, ready attached character and reduce your threat by 1.

flavor: "But for long years we healers have only sought to patch the rents made by the men of swords." <cite>Return of the King</cite>
name: Warden of Healing
text: Action: Exhaust Warden of Healing to heal 1 damage on up to 2 different characters. Then, you may pay 2 [lore] resources to ready Warden of Healing.

flavor: "Picking up a faggot he held it aloft for a moment, and then with a word of command, naur an edraith ammen! he thrust the end of his staff into the midst of it. At once a great spout of green and blue flame sprang out, and the wood flared and sputtered." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Word of Command
text: Action: Exhaust an Istari character to search your deck for 1 card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

flavor:
"I listened because I couldn't help myself, if you know what I mean. Lor bless me, sir, but I do love tales of that sort."
<cite>Sam Gamgee, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Love of Tales
text: Attach to a [lore] hero. Limit 1 per hero. Response: After a Song card is played, exhaust Love of Tales to add 1 resource to attached hero's resource pool.

name: Journey in the Black Pit
text:
Setup: The first player attaches Cave Torch to a hero of his choice.
When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until you discard X locations, where X is one less than the number of players in the game (minimum of 1). Add those locations to the staging area, and shuffle the other discarded cards back into the encounter deck.
Each location gets +1 [Threat]. If the players quest unsuccessfully, trigger all "Lost:" effects in play.

name: Continuing Eastward
text:
When Revealed: The first player makes a locate test. If this test is failed, reveal cards from the encounter deck equal to the number of players in the game and add them to the staging area. Then, trigger all "Lost:" effects in play.
If the players quest unsuccessfully, trigger all "Lost:" effects in play.
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Durin's Greaves
text:
When Revealed: The first player attaches Durin's Greaves to a hero of his choice as an attachment.
Attached hero gains +1 [Defense]

name: Abandoned Mine
text:
Lost: Return the top 2 Goblin enemies in the encounter discard pile to the staging area, if able.

PASS

name: Dwarven Forge
text:
Lost: Each player must choose and discard 1 card from his hand.

PASS

name: Silent Caverns
text:
Lost: Exhaust all characters.

PASS

name: Twisting Passage
text:
Forced: Before placing progress tokens on Twisting Passage, the first player must make a locate test. If this test is failed, do not place any progress tokens on Twisting Passage and trigger all "Lost:" effects in play.

PASS

name: Fatigue
text: When Revealed: Each player must exhaust 1 character he controls, if able. Then, if any player controls no unexhausted characters, Fatigue gains surge.

name: Foul Air
text: When Revealed: The first player makes a locate test. If this test is failed, deal 2 damage to all characters and trigger all "Lost:" effects in play.

name: Gathering Ground
text:
When Revealed: Attach this card to a location in the staging area with the highest combined threat and remaining quest points. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Each enemy revealed from the encounter deck gains surge.")

PASS

name: Vast and Intricate
text: When Revealed: The first player makes a locate test. If this test is failed, raise each player's threat by 7, remove all progress tokens from play, and trigger all "Lost:" effects in play.

name: Cave Spider
text:
When Revealed: The first player draws 1 card. Then, that player must choose and discard 4 cards from his hand, if able.
Forced: After Cave Spider engages a player, that player must choose and discard 1 card from his hand, if able.

name: Goblin Sneak
text: Forced: After Goblin Sneak engages a player, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If it is a treachery card, Goblin Sneak engages the next player, if able.

name: Goblin Warlord
text: Lost: Each player must choose and discard 1 ally he controls from play, if able.

name: Rock Adder
text: Rock Adder cannot be attacked unless it has dealt at least 1 damage this round.

flavor:
Glorfindel was tall and straight; his hair was of shining gold, his face fair and young and fearless and full of joy; his eyes were bright and keen, and has voice like music; on his brow sat wisdom, and in his hand was strength.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Glorfindel
text: Forced: After Glorfindel exhausts to commit to a quest, raise your threat by 1.

name: Longbeard Elder
text: Response: After Longbeard Elder commits to a quest, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is a location, place 1 progress token on the current quest. Otherwise, Longbeard Elder gets -1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

flavor:
"However it may prove, one must tread the path that need chooses!"
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Path of Need
text:
Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a location.
Heroes do not exhaust to attack, defend, or commit to a quest while attached location is the active location.

name: Trollshaw Scout
text: Ranged. Trollshaw Scout does not exhaust to attack. Forced: After Trollshaw Scout attacks, either discard it from play or discard 1 card from your hand.

flavor: "Beside them Gimli stood with his stout legs apart, wielding his dwarf-axe." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Heavy Stroke
text: Response: After a Dwarf deals X damage to an enemy during combat, deal an additional X damage to that enemy. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Imladris Stargazer
text: Action: Exhaust Imladris Stargazer to choose a player. That player looks at the top 5 cards of his deck and then returns them to the top of his deck in any order.

flavor:
"... those who have dwelt in the blassed realm live at once in both worlds, and against both the Seen and Unseen they have great power."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Light of Valinor
text: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan hero. Attached hero does not exhaust to commit to a quest.

flavor:
"These are Daeron's Runes, such as were used of old in Moria..."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Daeron's Runes
text: Action: Draw 2 cards. Then, discard 1 card from your hand.

name: Healing Herbs
text: Attach to a [lore] hero hero. Action: Discard Healing Herbs and exhaust attached hero to heal all damage on 1 character.

flavor: Suddenly into view below came a white horse, gleaming in the shadows, running swiftly. In the dusk its headstall flickered and flashed as if it were studded with gems like living stars. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Asfaloth
text: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan hero. Action: Exhaust Asfaloth to place 1 progress token on any location. (2 tokens instead if attached hero is Glorfindel.)

name: The Dripping Walls
text:
Setup: Place Foundations of Stone encounter set aside, out of play. The first player attaches Cave Torch to a hero of his choice.

When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player, and add it to the staging area.

name: The Water's Edge
text: Forced: After a player commits characters to the quest, he must discard the top 2 cards of his deck.

name: Washed Away!
text: When Revealed: Discard all Item, Armor, Weapon, Light cards and all encounter deck cards from play, Shuffle all enemy and treachery cards in the encounter discard pile together with the Foundations of Stone encounter set. This deck becomes the new encounter deck. remove all other encounter deck cards from the game. Then, starting with the first player, each player draws a random stage 4 quest card. Remove all other stage 4 quest cards from the game.

name: Below the Mines - Sheltered Rocks
text:
When Revealed: Create your own staging area. Reveal 2 cards from the encounter deck and add them to your staging area.
Forced: After the 17th progress token is placed on The Endless Caves, join another player at the beginning of the travel phase. If you cannot join another player, all players continue on to stage 5 together.

name: Below the Mines - The Endless Caves
text:
When Revealed: Create your own staging area. Discard all resources from your heroes.
Forced: After the 17th progress token is placed on The Endless Caves, join another player at the beginning of the travel phase. If you cannot join another player, all players continue on to stage 5 together.

name: Below the Mines - The Shivering Bank
text:
When Revealed: Create your own staging area. Discard your hand. Reveal 2 cards from the encounter deck and add them to your staging area.
Forced: After the 7th progress token is placed on The Shivering Bank, join another player at the beginning of the travel phase. If you cannot join another player, all players continue on to stage 5 together.

name: Below the Mines - Old One Lair
text:
When Revealed: Create you own staging area. Reveal 4 cards from the encounter deck and add them to your staging area.
Forced: After the 5th progress token is placed on Old One Lair, join another player at the beginning of the travel phase. If you cannot join another player, all players continue on to stage 5 together.

name: Out of the Depths
text:
When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player, and add it to the staging area.
Each player cannot commit more allies to the quest than the number of heroes he is also committing to the quest.
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Durin's Axe
text:
Surge. Restricted.
Attached hero gets +3 [Attack]. If attached hero is a Dwarf, it gets +1 [Willpower].
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective. Then, attach Durin's Axe to that hero as an attachment.

name: Durin's Helm
text:
Surge.
Attached hero gets +1 [Defense]. If attached hero is a Dwarf,it gets +2 hit points.
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective. Then, attach Durin's Helm to that hero as an attachment.

name: Drowned Treasury
text:
If Drowned Treasury is the active location at the end of the quest phase, each player must discard 1 character he controls.

Response: After Drowned Treasury leaves play as an explored location, each player may draw 2 cards or claim 1 objective in play.

name: Mithril Lode
text:
Doomed 1.
While Mithril Lode is the active location, it gains: "Refresh Action: Exhaust a character you control to place X progress tokens on the current quest card, bypassing any active location. X is the exhausted character's [Willpower]. (Limit once per round.)"

name: Deep Deep Dark
text:
Doomed 1. Surge.
When Revealed: Attach 1 card from the top of the first player's deck to each Nameless enemy in play, if able.

name: Lost and Alone
text: When Revealed: Each player chooses and shuffles a hero he controls into his deck. When he draws that hero, he puts it into play.

name: Nameless Thing
text:
Forced: After Nameless Thing engages a player, attach the top 2 cards of that player's deck to it.

X is the printed cost of all attached cards on this card. If there are no cards attached, X is 3.

Victory 1.

name: Elder Nameless Thing
text:
Forced: After Elder Nameless Thing engages a player, attach the top 3 cards of that player's deck to it.
X is the printed cost of all attached cards on this card. If there are no cards attached, X is 4.

Victory 3.

name: Moria Bats
text:
Only characters with ranged can attack or defend against Moria Bats.
While Moria Bats is engaged with a player, it gets +1 [Attack] for each other enemy engaged with that player.

flavor:
"But you do not stand alone."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Elrond
text: You may spend resources from Elrond's resource pool to pay for [spirit], [leadership], and [tactics] allies. Response: After a character is healed by another card effect, heal 1 damage on it.

flavor: "You should see the stone-paved roads of many colours! And the halls and cavernous streets under the earth with arches carved like trees; and the terraces and towers upon the Mountain's sides! Then you would see that we have not been idle." <cite>Glóin, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: We Are Not Idle
text: Action: Exhaust X Dwarf heroes to add X resources to a hero's resource pool and draw 1 card.

flavor:
"We will seek the hidden door together. And we will come through. In the ruins of of the Dwarves, a dwarf's head will be less easy to bewilder than Elves or Men or Hobbits."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Hardy Leadership
text: Attach to a [leadership] hero. Each Dwarf gets +1 hit point.

flavor:
"We live now upon an island amid perils, and our hands are more often upon thr bowstring than upon the harp."
<cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Hands Upon the Bow
text: Action: Exhaust a character you control with ranged to immediately declare it as an attacker (and resolve its attack) against an enemy in the staging area. It gets +1 [attack] during this attack.

name: O Elbereth! Gilthonial!
text: Secrecy 4. Response: After a non-unique enemy attacks you, put that enemy on the bottom of the encounter deck. If your threat is lower than that enemy's engagement cost, set your threat equal to the engagement cost of that enemy.

name: Miruvor
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Miruvor to (choose two): ready attached hero, add 1 resource to attached hero's resource pool, attached hero gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round, or put Miruvor on the top of your deck.

name: Master of the Forge
text: Action: Exhaust Master of the Forge to search the top 5 cards of your deck for any 1 attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

flavor:
"Here you will hear many songs and tales-if you can keep awake. But except on high days it usually stands empty and quiet. and people come here who wish for peace, and thought. There is always a fire here, all the year round, but there is little other light."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Peace, and Thought
text: Refresh Action: Exhaust 2 heroes to draw 5 cards.

name: Risk Some Light
text: Secrecy 3. Action: Look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. You may select 1 card and move it to the bottom of the encounter deck. Return any unselected cards to the top of the encounter deck, in any order.

flavor: ...mightiest of the Three. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Vilya
text: Attach to Elrond. He gains a [spirit] resource icon. Action: Exhaust Elrond and Vilya to reveal the top card of your deck. You can immediately play or put into play the revealed card for no cost, if able. Otherwise, move the revealed card to the bottom of your deck.

name: Nearing the Gate
text:
Setup: Remove Dark Pit from the encounter deck and place it aside, out of play. Add Durin's Bane to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

When Revealed: Reduce each player's threat to 0. Reveal X cards from the encounter deck, where X is one less than the number of players in the game, and add them to the staging area.

name: The Rear Guard
text:
Forced: If at least 1 hero committed to the quest this round, place 4 progress tokens on The Rear Guard (bypassing any active location) at the end of the quest phase.
If Durin's Bane has 0 hit points, advance to the next stage of the scenario immediately.

name: Last Lord of Moria
text:
When Revealed: Durin's Bane makes an immediate attack on the first player. Add Dark Pit to the staging area.
Players cannot win the game while Durin's Bane is in play. If Durin's Bane leaves play by the effect on Dark Pit, the players have won the game.

name: Dark Pit
text: While Dark Pit is the active location it gains: "Refresh Action: Exhaust X characters (maximum 3) you control to discard the top X cards of your deck. If all discarded cards have a higher combined printed cost than the remaining hit points of Durin's Bane, discard Durin's Bane from play."

name: Second Hall
text: While Second Hall is the active location, it gains: "Forced: after a character leaves play, reveal 1 card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area."

name: Second Deep
text: While Durin's Bane has no damage on it, progress tokens cannot be placed on Second Deep.

name: Fires in the Deep
text: When Revealed: Each player must discard 1 ally he controls, if able. If Fires in the Deep discarded no allies, it gains surge.

name: Counter-Spell
text: When Revealed: Attach Counter-spell to Durin's Bane. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: When a player plays an event, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is a treachery card, cancel the effects of the event, discard the event player's hand, and discard Counter-spell from play.")

name: Inner Flame
text: When Revealed: Durin's Bane gets +3 [Attack] until the end of the round. The first player may remove 1 questing hero he controls from the quest to cancel this effect.

name: Inner Shadow
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Heal 5 damage from Durin's Bane, if able. The first player may remove 1 questing hero he controls from the quest to cancel this effect.

name: Whip Lash
text: When Revealed: Each player must discard 1 attachment he controls, if able.

name: Leaping Flame
text: When Revealed: Durin's Bane makes an immediate attack against the first player (deal and resolve a shadow card).

name: Durin's Bane
text:
Regenerate 3. Indestructible. Players cannot play attachments on Durin's Bane.

During's Bane cannot leave the staging area, is considered to be engaged with each player whose threat is 1 or greater, and attacks each of those players in turn during the combat phase (deal and discard a new shadow card each attack).

name: Ranging Goblin
text:
When Revealed: Each player must deal 1 damage to a hero he controls.
Forced: After a character leaves play, shuffle Ranging Goblin and the top card in the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

name: Fiery Sword
text: When Revealed: Attach Fiery Sword to Durin's Bane as a Weapon attachment with the text: "Attached enemy gets +3 [Attack]."

name: Many Thonged Whip
text: When Revealed: Attach Many Thonged Whip to Durin's Bane as a Weapon attachment with the text: "Forced: When Durin's Bane attacks, the defending player must discard 1 card at random from his hand."

flavor: "It is over-late to send for aid when you are already besiged." <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Beregond
text: Sentinel. Lower the cost to play Weapon and Armor attachments on Beregond by 2.

flavor: "By our valour the wild fold of the East are still restrained, and the terror of Morgul kept at bay..." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Boromir
text: While Boromir has at least 1 resource in his resource pool, Gondor allies get +1 [attack].

flavor: For the people of the City used horses very little and they were seldom seen in their streets, save only those ridden by the errand-riders of their lord. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Errand-rider
text: Action: Exhaust Errand-rider to move 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero you control to another hero's resource pool.

name: Citadel Custodian
text: Lower the cost to play Citadel Custodian by 1 for each Gondor ally in play.

flavor: "These are the Rohirrim, as we name them, masters of horses... and have ever proved true to us, aiding us at need, and guarding our northern marches and the Gap of Rohan." <cite>Faramir, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Mutual Accord
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, each Gondor card in play gains the Rohan trait, and each Rohan card in play gains the Gondor trait.

flavor: Kings made tombs more splendid than houses of the living, and counted old names in the rolls of their descent dearer than the names of sons. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Wealth of Gondor
text: Action: Choose a Gondor hero. Add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

flavor: "And the Enemy must pay dearly for the crossing of the River." <cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Defender of Rammas

flavor: ...seven walls of stone so strong and old that it seemed to have been not builded by carven by giants out of the bones of the earth. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Behind Strong Walls
text: Action: Ready a defending Gondor character. That character gets +1 [defense] until the end of the phase.

name: Spear of the Citadel
text: Restricted. Attach to a [tactics] character. Limit 1 per character. Response: After attached character is declared as a defender, deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.

name: Damrod
text: Action: Discard Damrod from play to lower your threat by 1 for each enemy in the staging area.

flavor: "The beacons of Gondor are alight, calling for aid." <cite>Gandalf, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Light the Beacons
text: Action: All characters get +2 [defense] and do not exhaust to defend until the end of the round.

name: A Watchful Peace
text: Response: After a location worth no victory points leaves play as an explored location, return it to the top of the encounter deck.

flavor: "Believe not that in the land of Gondor the blood of Numenor is spent, nor all its pride and dignity forgotten." <cite>Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Blood of Númenor
text: Attach to a Gondor or Dúnedain hero. Action: Spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to give attached hero +1 [defense] for each resource in its resource pool until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

flavor: From Lamedon, a few grim hillmen without a captain. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Hunter of Lamedon
text: Response: After you play Hunter of Lamedon from your hand, reveal the top card of your deck. If it is an Outlands card, add it to your hand. Otherwise, discard it.

flavor: Green gauntlets covered their hands, and their faces were hooded and masked with green, except for their eyes, which were very keen and bright. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Ithilien Tracker
text: Action: Exhaust Ithilien Tracker to lower the [threat] of the next enemy added to the staging area to 0 until the end of the phase.

flavor: "If Cirith Ungol is named, old men and masters of lore will blanch and fall silent." <cite>Faramir, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Master of Lore
text: Action: Exhaust Master of Lore to name a card type. Lower the cost for you to play the next [lore] card of that type by 1 until the end of the phase (to a minimum of 1).

name: Ranger Spikes
text:
Play Ranger Spikes into the staging area unattached.
If unattached, attach Ranger Spikes to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.
Players do not make engagement checks against attached enemy. Attached enemy gets -2 [threat].

name: Envoy of Pelargir
text: Response: After Envoy of Pelargir enters play, add 1 resource to a Gondor or Noble hero's resource pool.

name: Alcaron's Scroll
text:
If unattached, return Alcaron's Scroll to the staging area and it gains: "Action: Exhaust a hero to attack Alcaron's Scroll to that hero."
Forced: When the hero with Alcaron's Scroll attached is damaged by an enemy attack, attach Alcaron's Scroll to that enemy.

name: Harbor Thug
text: Forced: When the player whose hero has Alcaron's Scroll attached raises his threat, Harbor Thug engages that player.

name: The Leaping Fish
text:
If Alcaron's Scroll is attached to a hero, The Leaping Fish gains: "Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase discard X cards from the top of the encounter deck where X is the number of players in the game. Add each enemy discarded by this effect to the staging area."
Victory 3.

name: Pelargir Docks
text: While Pelargir Docks is the active location, enemies get +1 [Attack] and +1 [Defense].

name: Harbor Storehouse
text: Forced: Each time a location is discarded from the top of the encounter deck, raise each player's threat by 1.

name: Collateral Damage
text: When Revealed: Discard 2 cards from the top of the encounter deck. Discard an additional 2 cards for each copy of Collateral Damage in the discard pile. Then, raise each player's threat by 2 for each location discarded by this effect.

name: Celador
text:
While Celador is in the staging area, he is committed to the current quest.
Forced: After players quest unsuccessfully or a character leaves play, deal 1 damage to Celador.
If Celador leaves play, remove him from the game.

name: Ithilien Guardian
text:
While Ithilien Guardian is in the staging area, he is committed to the current quest.
When Revealed: Add Ithilien Guardian to the staging area and Ithilien Guardian gains surge.

name: Southron Company
text: Southron Company gets +2 [Threat] and +2 [Attack] while the current quest card has the battle or siege keyword.

name: Ithilien Road
text: While Ithilien Road is the active location, the engagement cost of each enemy in the staging area is 0.

name: Blocking Wargs
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each character committed to the quest. (If the current quest has the battle or siege keyword, shuffle this card back into the encounter deck.)

name: Orc Scramblers
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each Battleground location in play, if able.

name: Battering Ram
text:
Doomed 2.
When Revealed: If the active location is a Battleground, deal 3 damage to it.

name: Siege Raft
text: When Revealed: Deal 2 damage to the lowest [Threat] Battleground location in play, if able.

name: The Citadel
text:
If The Citadel has 11 or more damage, remove it from the game (do not collect its victory points).
Response: After The Citadel leaves play as an explored location, remove stage 4 from the quest deck, if able.
Victory 3.

name: The Approach
text:
If the Approach has 7 or more damage, remove it from the game (do not collect its victory points).
Response: After The Approach leaves play as an explored location, remove stage 3 from the quest deck, if able.
Victory 2.

name: The Banks
text:
If The Banks has 3 or more damage, remove it from the game (do not collect its victory points).
Response: After The Banks leaves play as an explored location, remove stage 2 from the quest deck, if able.
Victory 1.

name: Orc Assault
text: When Revealed: Each character gets -2 [Attack] and -2 [Defense] until the end of the round.

name: Pickpocket
text: Forced: When Pickpocket attacks, the defending player discards 1 resource from one of his heroes' resource pools and 1 card at random from his hand.

name: City Street
text:
Surge.
While City Street is in the staging area, players cannot travel to a location that does not have the title City Street.

name: Market Square
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Travel: Each player must spend 1 resource from one of his heroes' resource pools to travel here.

name: Lost in the City
text: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 City location and add it to the staging area, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Umbar Assassin
text: When Revealed: Attach this card to the hero with the highest threat cost without a copy of Local Trouble attached. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "When attached hero exhausts, readies, or triggers an ability, raise its controller's threat by 1.")

name: Local Trouble
text:
Archery 2.
Forced: When Umbar Assassin engages a player, that player must deal 3 damage to a hero he controls. (Discard that hero instead if Umbar Assassin was not optionally engaged.)

name: Zealous Traitor
text: Forced: When Zealous Traitor engages a player, that player must deal 1 damage to each ally he controls. (2 damage instead if Zealous Traitor was not optionally engaged.)

name: Lossarnach Bandit
text: Forced: When Lossarnach Bandit engages a player, that player discards 1 resource from each of his heroes' resource pools. (2 resources instead if Lossarnach Bandit was not optionally engaged.)

name: Lurking in Shadows
text: When Revealed: Return all Brigand enemies engaged with players to the staging area. If this effect returned no Brigand enemies to the staging area, Lurking in Shadows gains surge.

name: Overgrown Trail
text: Action: Exhaust a Ranger character to place 3 progress tokens on Overgrown Trail.

name: Lost Companion
text: Immune to player card effects.

name: Lost Companion
text: When Revealed: Each player removes 1 character he controls from the quest, if able. Then, if any player has no characters committed to the quest, remove all characters from the quest.

name: Morgul Spider
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, Morgul Spider gets +1 [Attack] for each character not currently committed to a quest.

name: Forest Bat
text: When Revealed: The first player deals 2 damage to a questing hero and removes that hero from the quest.

name: Watcher in the Wood
text: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by the number of questing characters. (If the current quest has the battle or siege keyword, Watcher in the Wood gains surge.)

name: Southron Mercenaries
text:
Archery X.
X is the number of players in the game.

name: Haradrim Elite
text: Forced: When Haradrim Elite enters play, it makes an immediate attack from the staging area against the first player.

name: Mûmak
text:
No attachments can be attached to Mumak.
Mumak cannot take more than 3 damage each round.

name: Southron Support
text:
Doomed 3.
When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 Harad enemy and add it to the staging area, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Lieutenant of Mordor
text:
Allies cannot defend against Lieutenant of Mordor.
When Revealed: Resolove the "when revealed" effect on the topmost treachery card in the encounter discard pile, if able. This effect cannot be canceled.
Victory 3.

name: Orc Arbalesters
text:
Archery X.
X is the number of different resource icons ([Leadership], [Tactics], [Spirit], or [Lore]) on heroes in play.

name: Orc Vanguard
text: While Orc Vanguard is in the staging area, resources cannot be spent from the resource pools of heroes who have a [Leadership], [Spirit], or [Lore] resource icon.

name: Orc War Camp
text: If an Orc enemy is in play, progress tokens cannot be placed on Orc War Camp while it is in the staging area.

name: The Master's Malice
text: When Revealed: Each player chooses 1 sphere of influence ([Leadership], [Tactics], [Spirit], or [Lore]). Each character a player controls that does not belong to his chosen sphere takes 3 damage.

name: The Power of Mordor
text:
Doomed 3.
When Revealed: Count the number of encounter cards in the staging area and shuffle them into the encounter deck. Then, reveal an equal number of cards from the encounter deck and add them to the staging area. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Orc Rabble
text: When Revealed: Each player discards the top card of his deck. Until the end of the phase, raise the total [Threat] in the staging area by X, where X is the total cost of all cards discarded by this effect.

name: Orc Rabble
text: Forced: When Orc Rabble is dealt a shadow card, it gets +2 [Attack] until the end of the phase.

name: Orc Arsonist
text: Forced: When Orc Arsonist engages a player, deal 1 shadow card to each enemy engaged with that player.

name: The Leaping Fish
text:
Setup: Search the encounter deck for The Leaping Fish and Alcaron's Scroll. Make The Leaping Fish the active location and attach Alcaron's Scroll to a hero.

Battle. (Characters use their [Attack] instead of [Willpower] when questing.)

When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck for a copy of Harbor Thug and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Fighting in the Streets
text:
Battle. (Characters use their [Attack] instead of [Willpower] when questing.)

The players cannot advance to the next stage unless Alcaron's Scroll is attached to a hero.

When Revealed: Attach Alcaron's Scroll to the highest engagement cost enemy in play, if able. Otherwise, add Alcaron's Scroll to the staging area.

name: Escape to the Quays
text:
When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 enemy and adds it to the staging area.

Enemies cannot be optionally engaged.

Forced: The first enemy revealed from the encounter deck each round makes an immediate attack against the player who controls Alcaron's Scroll from the staging area.

The players cannot defeat this stage unless Alcaron's Scroll is attached to a hero. If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Ambush in Ithilien
text:
Setup: Add Celador to the staging area. Search the encounter deck for a copy of Ithilien Road and make it the active location. Each player must search the encounter deck for a copy of Southron Company and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Battle. (Characters use [Attack] instead of [Willpower] when questing.)

If the players complete this stage with Celador in the staging area, advance to stage 3A (bypassing stage 2).

name: Southron Counter-attack
text:
Siege. (Characters use [Defense] instead of [Willpower] when questing.)
Archery X.
X is the number of players in the game.
After this stage is completed advance to stage 4A (bypassing stage 3).

name: The Hidden Way
text:
When Revealed: The first player takes control of all Ranger objectives in the staging area.
Enemies do not make engagement checks and cannot be optionally engaged.

name: Approaching Cair Andros
text:
If any player's threat is 37 or higher, Approaching Cair Andros gains siege.
Forced: At the end of each round, raise each player's threat by 2.
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: The Defense
text:
Setup: Add The Approach, The Citadel, and The Banks to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Siege (Characters quest using [Defense] instead of [Willpower].)

Players must deal damage from undefended attacks to the lowest [Threat] Battleground location in play. If there are no Battleground locations in play, immediately advance to the next stage.

name: Reinforcing the Banks
text: Reveal 1 additional card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area during the staging step each round.

name: Breakthrough at the Approach
text:
Battle. (Characters quest using [Attack] instead of [Willpower].)

Forced: After the players quest unsuccessfully, instead of raising threat, each player must choose and discard 1 character he controls.

name: Breakthrough at the Citadel
text:
Siege (Characters quest using [Defense] instead of [Willpower].)

Breakthrough at the Citadel adds 5 [Threat] to the staging area.

name: The Last Battle
text:
Siege. (Characters quest using [Defense] instead of [Willpower].)
When Revealed: Reveal 1 card per player from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.
If the players have collected 4 or more victory points, The Last Battle gains battle and loses siege.
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

flavor: Hirluin the Fair of the Green Hills from Pinnath Gelin... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Hirluin the Fair
text: Ranged. You may use resources from Hirluin the Fair's resource pool to pay for Outlands ally cards of any sphere.

flavor: ... grim-faced they were, and shorter and somewhat swarthier than any men that Pippin had yet seen in Gondor. <cite> The Return of the King</cite>
name: Warrior of Lossarnach
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 [defense].

flavor: "Nay, my friends, I am the lawful master of the Stone, and I had both the right and the strength to use it..." <cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Gaining Strength
text: Action: Discard 2 resources from your hero's resource pool to add 3 resources to that hero's resource pool.

flavor: ...foremost on the field rode the swan-knights of Dol Amroth with their Prince and his blue banner at their head. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Knights of the Swan
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 [attack].

flavor:
There flowered a White Tree, and that was for Gondor...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Gondorian Shield
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gains +1 [defense]. (+2 [defense] instead if attached hero has the Gondor trait.)

flavor:
We heard of the horns in the hills ringing,
the swords shining in the South-kingdom.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Ethir Swordsman
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 [willpower].

name: Ring of Barahir
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +1 hit point for each Artifact attachment attached to it. If attached hero is Aragorn, he also gains a [lore] resource icon.

flavor: From the Anfalas, the Langstrand far away, a long line of men of many sorts, hunters and herdsmen and men of little villages... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Anfalas Herdsman
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 hit point.

flavor: "Let none now reject the counsels of Gandalf, whose long labours against Sauron come at last to their test." <cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Mithrandir's Advice
text: Action: Draw 1 card for each hero you control with a printed [lore] resource icon.

flavor: The townlands were rich, with wide tilth and many orchards, and homesteads there were with oast and garner, fold and byre, and many rills rippling through the green from the highlands down to the Anduin. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: A Good Harvest
text: Action: Name a sphere. Until the end of the phase, you can spend resources of any sphere when paying for cards that belong to the named sphere.

name: Conspiracy
text:
Setup: Create the underworld deck. Remove Roots of Mindolluin from the encounter deck and set it aside, out of play. Shuffle all Villain cards and randomly set one aside, out of play, without looking at it. Remove the others from the game. Repeat this with all Plot cards.

When Revealed: Search the encounter deck for The Fourth Star and make it the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Forced: After the active location leaves play as an explored location, place 1 resource token on this quest.
If there are 4 or more resource tokens on Conspiracy, advance to the next stage.

name: The Grand Design
text:
When Revealed: Reveal the set aside Plot card and add it to the staging area.
When Revealed: Make Roots of Mindolluin the active location, returning any other active location to the staging area.
Forced: After the active location leaves play as an explored location place 1 resource token on this quest.
If there are 4 or more resource tokens on The Grand Design, advance to the next stage.

name: The Confrontation
text:
When Revealed: Reveal the set aside Villain card and add it to the staging area.
When Revealed: Shuffle the underworld deck into the encounter deck.
The players cannot defeat this stage while a Villain is in play. If this stage is defeated, the players have won the game.

name: Underworld Dissident
text: Underworld Dissident gets +1 [Attack] for each Underworld location in play.

name: Daughter of Beruthiel
text:
Daughter of Beruthiel cannot be optionally engaged.
Forced: After Daughter of Beruthiel attacks, return her to the staging area. The engaged player may raise his threat by 4 to prevent this effect.

name: The Hand of Castamir
text:
Forced: After The Hand of Castamir attacks, reveal the top card of the encounter deck, resolve its effects, and discard it.
Forced: After a treachery card is revealed from the encounter deck, The Hand of Castamir makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Telemnar's Bane
text:
Forced: When Telemnar's Bane attacks, discard the top 3 cards of each player's deck.
Forced: After a player plays an event card, Telemnar's Bane makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Sewers
text:
Underworld 1.
When Revealed: Place the top card of the underworld deck facedown underneath the active location, if able.

name: Roots of Mindolluin
text:
Underworld 1.
Each location in the staging area gets +2 quest points.

name: Storehouse
text: Underworld 1.

name: Houses of the Dead
text:
Underworld 2.
Forced: After Houses of the Dead becomes the active location, exhaust all characters.

name: The Fourth Star
text:
Underworld X.
X is the number of players in the game.
Response: When The Fourth Star leaves play as an explored location, each player may draw 1 card.

name: Unwelcome Discovery
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the underworld deck and add it to the staging area. If it is a Clue card, discard it instead.

name: Knife in the Back
text: When Revealed: Randomly select 1 ally controlled by the first player, if able. The first player deals X damage to one of his heroes, where X is that ally's [Attack]. Then discard that ally. If no ally is discarded by this effect, A Knife in the Back gains surge.

name: False Lead
text: When Revealed: End the quest phase without resolving the quest.

name: A Scrap of History
text:
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective, add it to the victory display, and place 1 resource token on the current quest.

Victory 1.

name: Secret Map
text:
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective and attach it to that hero.
Action: If attached to a hero, add Secret Map to the victory display to place 3 progress tokens on the active location.
Victory 1.

name: A Prisoner
text:
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective, add it to the victory display, and place 2 resource tokens on the current quest.

Victory 1.

name: Unholy Alliance
text:
Reveal 1 additional card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area during the staging step each round.
If a hero is destroyed by an enemy attack, the players have lost the game.

name: Up in Flames
text:
Forced: At the end of the round, place 1 resource token on Up in Flames and discard the top X cards of each player's deck. X is the number of resource tokens on Up in Flames.
If any player has no cards in his deck, the players have lost the game.

name: Poisoned Counsels
text: At the end of each round, raise each player's threat by 2.

flavor:
"...the Elves feared and distrusted the world outside..."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Mirlonde
text: Each hero you control with a printed [lore] resource icon gets -1 threat cost.

flavor: "Forlong!" men shouted. "True heart, true friend!" <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Forlong
text: While you control Outlands allies that belong to 4 different spheres, ready Forlong at the beginning of each phase.

flavor: And so the companies came and were hailed and cheered and passed through the Gate, men of the Outlands marching to defend the City of Gondor in a dark hour... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Strength of Arms
text: Play only if each hero you control has a printed [leadership] resource icon. Action: Ready each ally in play.

flavor: He slew many of them and the rest fled. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Mighty Prowess
text: Attach to a [tactics] hero hero. Limit 1 per hero. Response: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, deal 1 damage to another enemy that shares a Trait with the enemy just destroyed.

name: Trained for War
text: Play only if each hero you control has the printed [tactics] resource icon. Action: Until the end of the phase, if the current quest does not have Siege, it gains Battle.

flavor:
"The Elves have their own labours and their own sorrows..."
<cite>Gildor, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Silvan Refugee
text: Forced: After a character leaves play, discard Silvan Refugee from play.

flavor: "Courage will now be your best defense against the storm that is at hand..." <cite>Gandalf, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Against the Shadow
text: Play only if each hero you control has the printed [spirit] resource icon. Action: Until the end of the phase, [spirit] characters use their [willpower] instead of [defense].

flavor: For the Elves of the High Kindred had not yet forsaken Middle-earth, and they dwelt still at that time at the Grey Havens...<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Harbor Master
text: Response: After a card effect adds any number of resources to the resource pool of a hero you control, Harbor Master gains +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

flavor: Suddenly he halted and listened. Had he heard a whistle or not? Or was it the call of some strange bird? <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Advance Warning
text: Play only if each hero you control has a printed [lore] resource icon. Action: Until the end of the phase, enemies do not make engagement checks.

flavor: The watchmen cried aloud, and all men in the City stood to arms. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: White Tower Watchman
text: If each hero you control belongs to the same sphere of influence, you may assign damage from undefended enemy attacks to White Tower Watchman instead of a hero you control.

name: The Pursuit
text:
Setup: Search the encounter deck for Dru-buri-Dru and set him aside, out of play. Shuffle the encounter deck.
When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player and add it to the staging area.

name: An Untimely End
text: Archery damage must be assigned to allies, if able.

name: The Passage Out
text:
When Revealed: Add Dru-buri-Dru to the staging area.
Siege. (Characters use their [Defense] instead of [Willpower] when questing.)
Characters use their [Willpower] instead of [Attack] when attacking enemies. If an enemy would be damaged this way, place progress tokens on it instead of damage tokens. When an enemy has progress equal to its hit points, add it to the victory display and place those progress tokens on the quest.
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Dru-buri-Dru
text:
Allies cannot defend against Dru-buri-Dru.
While Dru-buri-Dru is in the victory display, characters get +1 [Willpower] and +1 [Defense].
Unless Dru-buri-Dru is in the victory display, the players cannot win.

name: Drúadan Drummer
text: Each Wose enemy in the staging area gets +2 [Threat]

name: Druadan Elite
text:
Archery 2. Prowl X.
X is the number of players in the game.

name: Drúadan Hunter
text:
Prowl 1. Archery X.
X is the number of heroes in play with no resources in their resource pool.

name: Druadan Thief
text: Surge. Prowl 1.

name: Ancestral Clearing
text:
The cost to play each player card is increased by 1.
Travel: Exhaust a hero to travel here.

name: Garden of Poisons
text:
Heroes cannot gain resources from card effects.
Travel: Each player must pay 1 resource to travel here.

name: Glade of Cleansing
text:
Each Wose enemy gains archery 1.
X is equal to the total archery value of the highest archery Wose enemy in play.

name: Men in the Dark
text: When Revealed: Each hero must pay 1 resource or take 1 damage. If no hero takes damage from this effect, Men in the Dark gains surge.

name: Stars in Sky
text:
Prowl 2.
When Revealed: Each questing hero must pay 1 resource or it is removed from the quest.

name: Leaves on Tree
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Each player must pay 1 resource for each attachment he controls of discard all attachments he controls.

flavor: "There must be someone with intelligence in the party." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Pippin
text: If each hero you control has the Hobbit trait, Pippin gains: "Response: After an enemy engages you, raise your threat by 3 to return it to the staging area. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot engage you."

flavor: "Denethor is of another sort, proud and subtile, a man of far greater lineage and power, though he is not called a king." <cite>Gandalf, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Denethor
text:
Denethor gets -1 [willpower] for each damaged hero you control.
Discard Denethor if his [willpower] is 0 or less.

flavor: "The Captains of the Outlands are expected up the South Road ere sundown. Come with us and you will see." <cite>Bergil, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Lord of Morthond
text: Attach to a Gondor or Outlands hero. If each hero you control has a printed [leadership] resource icon, Lord of Morthond gains: "Response: After you play a [lore], [spirit], or [tactics] ally, draw 1 card."

name: Book of Eldacar
text: Attach to a [tactics] hero. Reduce the cost to play Book of Eldacar by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [tactics] resource icon. Action: Discard Book of Eldacar to play any [tactics] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

flavor: At last, less than a mile from the City, a more ordered mass of men came into view, marching not running, still holding together. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Gondorian Discipline
text: Response: Cancel up to 2 points of damage just dealt to a Gondor character.

name: Minas Tirith Lampwright
text: Response: After an encounter card with surge is revealed, discard Minas Tirith Lampwright to name enemy, location, or treachery. If the next encounter card revealed is the named type, discard it without resolving its effects.

name: Small Target
text: Response: After a Hobbit hero you control exhausts to defend an attack, choose another enemy engaged with you and reveal the attacking enemy's shadow card. If that shadow card has no shadow effect, resolve this enemy's attack against the chosen enemy. If that shadow card has a shadow effect, resolve this attack as normal.

name: Ithilien Archer
text: Ranged. Response: After Ithilien Archer attacks and damages an enemy, return that enemy to the staging area.

name: Ithilien Pit
text:
Play Ithilien Pit into the staging area unattached.
If unattached, attach Ithilien Pit to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.
Any character may choose attached enemy as the target of an attack.

flavor:
They possessed from the first the art of disappearing swiftly and silently, when large folk whom they do not wish to meet come blundering by...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Hobbit-sense
text: Play only if each of your heroes is a Hobbit. Combat Action: Enemies engaged with you do not attack this round. You cannot declare attacks this round.

name: Savagery of the Orcs
text:
Setup: Set Ghulat aside, out of play. Put Lord Alcaron into play. Make Burning Farmhouse the active location. Add the Rescued Villagers and Dead Villagers objectives to the staging area. Then, shuffle the encounter deck and reveal 1 encounter card per player and add it to the staging area.

Villagers 5.
When progress would be placed on Savagery of the Orcs, move an equal number of villager tokens from this quest onto Rescued Villagers instead.
If there are no villager tokens on Savagery of the Orcs, advance to the next stage.

name: Protect the Villagers
text:
When Revealed: Add Ghulat to the staging area.
If an attack goes undefended, discard X villager tokens from Rescued Villagers instead of damaging a hero. X is the amount of damage that would have been dealt.

When the players defeat this stage, end the game. Compare the number of tokens on Rescued Villagers to the number of tokens on Dead Villagers.

name: Rescued Villagers
text:
If a location leaves play as an explored location, move any villager tokens from that location to Rescued VIllagers.

At the end of the game, if there are more villager tokens here than damage tokens on Dead Villagers, the players have won.

name: Dead Villagers
text:
If a villager token is discarded from a location, objective, or quest stage, place a damage token on Dead Villagers.

At the end of the game, if there are more damage tokens here than villager tokens on Rescued Villagers, the players have lost.

name: Lord Alcaron
text:
The first player gains control of Lord Alcaron.
Response: After a villager token is discarded, exhaust Lord Alcaron to place that villager token on a location instead.
If Lord Alcaron leaves play, the players have lost the game.

name: Ghulat
text:
X is the number of damage tokens on Dead Villagers.
Forced: When Ghulat attacks, place 1 damage token on Dead Villagers.
While Ghulat is in play, the game cannot end.
Victory 2.

name: Marauding Orc
text: Forced: After Marauding Orc attacks and destroys a character, place 1 damage token on Dead Villagers.

name: Orc Ravager
text: When Revealed: Discard 1 villager token from the active location. If no Villager token is discarded by this effect, Orc Ravager gains surge.

name: Craven Eagle
text: When Revealed: Discard the character with the fewest remaining hit points. That character's controller may discard 3 cards at random from his hand to prevent this effect.

name: Burning Farmhouse
text:
Villagers 4.
Forced: At the end of the round, discard 1 villager token from Burning Farmhouse.

Victory 1.

name: Gondorian Hamlet
text:
Villagers 3.
While Gondorian Hamlet is in the staging area it gains: "Forced: After a treachery card is revealed from the encounter deck, discard 1 villager token from Gondorian Hamlet."

Victory 1.

name: Secluded Farmhouse
text:
Villagers 2.
Travel: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck and add it to the staging area to travel here.

Victory 1.

name: Burnt Homestead
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by the number of damage tokens on Dead Villagers.

name: Trapped Inside
text:
Doomed 2.
When Revealed: Discard 1 villager token from the active location for each player in the game. If no villager tokens were removed by this effect. Trapped Inside gains surge.

name: Panicked!
text: When Revealed: Each player must take a villager token from Rescued VIllagers and place it on a location in the staging area, if able. If no villager tokens were placed on a location by this effect, Panicked! gains surge.

flavor: "The road may pass, but they shall not! Not while Faramir is Captain." <cite>Mablung, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Faramir
text:
Ranged.
Faramir gets +1 [attack] for each enemy in the staging area.

flavor:
The Morthond Valye made a great bay that beat up against the sheer southern faces of the mountains.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Sword of Morthond
text: Attach to a Gondor ally. Attached ally gains the Outlands trait.

flavor:
Death in the morning and at day's ending
lords took and lowly. Long now they sleep
under grass in Gondor by the Great River.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Men of the West
text: Action: Return X Outlands allies from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Knight of Minas Tirith
text: If each of your heroes has a printed [tactics] hero resource icon, Knight of Minas Tirith Tirith gains: "Response: After Knight of Minas Tirith enters play, choose an enemy in the staging area. Engage that enemy and exhaust Knight of Minas Tirith to declare it as attacker (and resolve its attack) against that enemy."

name: Gondorian Fire
text: Attach to a Gondor or Dúnedain hero. Action: Spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to give attached hero +1 [attack] for each resource in its resource pool until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

flavor:
"It is forty leagues and two from Pelargir to the landings at the Harlond..."
<cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Pelargir Shipwright
text: Pelargir Shipwright gets +1 [willpower] for each hero you control with a printed [spirit] hero resource icon.

name: Map of Earnil
text: Attach to a [spirit] hero. Reduce the cost to play Map of Earnil by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [spirit] resource icon. Action: Discard Map of Earnil to play any [spirit] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

flavor:
Two had great bows, almost of their own height, and great quivers of long green-feathered arrows.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Ranger Bow
text: Restricted. Attach to a Ranger character. Action: Exhaust Ranger Bow and attached character to deal 1 damage to an enemy in the staging area.

flavor: "For coming unbidden to this play death is our law." <cite>Anborn, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Forest Patrol
text: Play only if you control at least 1 Ranger character. Action: Deal 3 damage to an enemy with at least 1 Trap card attached to it.

name: Palantir
text: Attach to a Noble hero. Planning Action: Exhaust Palantir and attached hero to name a card type and look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. For each of those cards that matches the named type, draw a card. For each of those cards that does not match the named type, raise your threat by 2.

name: Retake the City
text:
Setup: Each player chooses 1 enemy and 1 unique location and add them to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Player card effects cannot place progress tokens on locations in the staging area.

Forced: When an Osgiliath location leaves play as an explored location, the first player takes control of that location.

If the players control all Osgiliath locations in play at the end of the round, they have won the game.

name: Uruk Lieutenant
text: When Revealed: Add the topmost Orc enemy from the encounter discard pile to the staging area.

name: Uruk Soldier
text: Forced: After Uruk Soldier attacks and destroys a character, that character's controller returns a location he controls to the staging area, if able.

name: Southron Phalanx
text: While engaged with a player, Southron Phalanx gets +1 [Attack] for each location that player controls.

name: Southron Commander
text: When Revealed: Southron Commander makes an immediate attack from the staging area against each player who controls at least 1 location.

name: West Gate
text:
Action: If there is no active location, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Osgiliath location, reveal it and add it to the staging area. Then, make West Gate the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Forced: After the player who controls West Gate lets an attack go undefended, return West Gate to the staging area.

name: The King's Library
text:
Travel: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck and add it to the staging area to travel here.

Forced: After the player who controls The King's Library lets an attack go undefended, return The King's Library to the staging area.

name: Ancient Harbor
text:
The players cannot travel here.

Combat Action: Exhaust a hero to place 1 progress token on Ancient Harbor.

Forced: After the player who controls Ancient Harbor lets an attack go undefended, return Ancient Harbor to the staging area.

name: The Old Bridge
text:
The players cannot travel here.
Planning Action: Spend 2 resources to place 1 progress token on The Old Bridge. (1 resource instead if there is another Osgiliath location in the staging area.)

Forced: After the player who controls The Old Bridge lets an attack go undefended, return The Old Bridge to the staging area.

name: West Quarter
text: While West Quarter is the active location, the current quest gains siege. (Characters quest using [Defense] instead of [Willpower].)

name: East Quarter
text: While East Quarter is the active location, the current quest gains battle. (Characters quest using [Attack] instead of [Willpower].)

name: Ruined Square
text:
Surge.

Response: After an enemy is defeated, place 1 progress token on Ruined Square.

Forced: If a player controls Ruined Square when a character leaves play, return Ruined Square to the staging area.

name: Ruined Tower
text:
Travel: If there is 1 active location, exhaust a character to travel here. (There are now 2 active locations.)

Forced: After the player who controls Ruined Tower loses control of a location, return Ruined Tower to the staging area.

name: Pinned Down
text: When Revealed: Add X to the archery total this round. X is the number of locations the players control. If the players control less than 4 locations, Pinned Down gains surge.

name: Street Fighting
text: When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an Osgiliath location is discarded. The first player may exhaust a hero to take control of that location. Otherwise, add that location to the staging area. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Counter-attack
text:
Surge.

When Revealed: Each player must return the location he controls with the highest [Threat] to the staging area, or raise his threat by the total [Threat] of all locations he controls.

flavor:
...there is no purpose higher in the world as it now stands than the good of Gondor...
<cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Caldara
text: Action: Discard Caldara to put 1 [spirit] ally from your discard pile into play for each other hero you control with a printed [spirit] resource icon. (Limit once per game.)

flavor:
As he spoke he struck a small silver gong that stood near his footstool, and at once servants came forward.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Squire of the Citadel
text: Response: After Squire of the Citadel leaves play, add 1 resource to a Gondor hero's resource pool.

name: Tome of Atanatar
text: Attach to a [leadership] hero. Reduce the cost to play Tome of Atanatar by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [leadership] resource icon. Action: Discard Tome of Atanatar to play any [leadership] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

name: Guthlaf
text: If there is at least 1 Rohan hero in play, lower the cost to play Guthlaf by 1. If there is at least 1 Gondor hero in play, Guthlaf gains sentinel.

flavor:
..we have this honour: ever we bear the brunt of the chief hatred of the Dark Lord, for that hatred comes down out of the of the depths of time and over the deeps of the Sea.
<cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: The Hammer-stroke
text: Encounter Action: Engage each enemy in play.

name: Emery
text: Action: Discard the top 3 card of your deck to put Emery into play from your hand, under any player's control. Then, if any of the discarded cards have the [tactics], [lore] or [leadership] sphere, discard Emery.

flavor:
"For deep in the hears of all my kindred lies the sea-longing, which it is perilous to stir"
<cite>Legolas, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Children of the Sea
