text: Action: Choose a Silvan or Noldor ally you control. That ally gets +2 [willpower] until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase, shuffle that ally into its owner's deck if it is still in play.

flavor:
"I sent my keenest huntsmen to seek him, but he slipped them, and they had no sight of him till now, save Anborn."
<cite>Faramir, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Anborn
text: Action: Exhaust Anborn to return 1 Trap card from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Poisoned Stakes
text:
Play Poisoned Stakes into the staging area unattached.
If unattached, attach Poisoned Stakes to the next eligble enemy that enters the staging area.
At the end of each round, deal 2 damage to attached enemy.

flavor:
Gimli the Dwarf alone wore openly a short shirt of steel-rings, for dwarves make light of burdens...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Well-Equipped
text: Action: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck. You may attach 1 attachment card discarded by this effect to an eligible Dwarf character in play.

name: The Ambush
text:
Setup: Add The Crossroads and Black Númenorean to the staging area. Put the Faramir and Lord Alcaron objective allies into play. Shuffle the encounter deck and reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player and add it to the staging area.

At the beginning of the quest phase, each player takes 1 hidden card. At the beginning of the combat phase, each player must turn each of his hidden cards faceup or take 1 hidden card.

name: Captured!
text:
When Revealed: Place Faramir and Lord Alcaron under Captured! (they are in play but the players cannot gain control of them). Each player turns each of his hidden cards faceup.

Battle. (Characters use their [Attack] instead of [Willpower] when questing.)
At the beginning of the quest phase, each player takes 1 hidden card.
If a player has 5 hidden cards, he must turn them faceup.
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Black Númenorean
text:
X is the total number of hidden cards in the game.
Forced: At the end of the round, each player must raise his threat by 1 for each hidden card in his play area.
Victory 3.

name: Orc Ambusher
text: Forced: After Orc Ambusher engages you, discard 1 non-objective ally you control, if able.

name: Brutal Uruk
text: Forced: After Brutal Uruk attacks and destroys a character, that character's controller turns all hidden cards in his play area faceup. Deal a shadow card to each enemy turned faceup by this effect and resolve their attacks as normal.

name: Evil Crow
text: Forced: When Evil Crow engages a player, that player takes 1 hidden card.

name: The Cross-roads
text:
The current quest card gains siege.
X is equal to the number of players in the game.
Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.
Victory 3.

name: Southern Road
text: Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

name: Western Road
text:
Western Road gets +5 quest points while it is in the staging area.
Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

name: Northern Road
text: Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

name: Eastern Road
text:
Eastern Road gets +5 quest points while it is in the staging area.
Travel: The first player must take 2 hidden cards to travel here.

name: The Dark Woods
text:
Archery X.
X is the number of players in the game.
Forced: After The Dark Woods leaves play as an explored location, the first player discards 1 hidden card.

name: Lying in Wait
text: When Revealed: The first player turns each hidden card in his play area faceup. Resolve the "When Revealed" effects of each encounter card turned faceup by this effect. If a location is turned faceup, add it to the staging area.

name: Mordor Looms
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Each player takes 1 hidden card.

name: Conflict at the Crossroads
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the phase, Orc enemies engaged with players add their [Threat] to the staging area. If no Orc enemies are engaged with players, Conflict at the Crossroads gains surge.

name: Faramir
text:
The first player gains control of Faramir.
Combat Action: Exhaust Faramir to turn a hidden card faceup. If that card is an enemy, deal 3 damage to it.
If Faramir leaves play, the players have lost the game.

name: Lord Alcaron
text:
The first player gains control of Lord Alcaron.
Action: Exhaust Lord Alcaron to return an enemy engaged with you to the staging area.
If Lord Alcaron leaves play, the players have lost the game.

flavor: 'To me! To me!' cried Théoden. 'Up Eorlingas! Fear no darkness!' <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Théoden
text:
Sentinel.
Each [tactics] hero with a printed [tactics] resource icon gets +1 [willpower].

name: Pelargir Ship Captain
text: Response: After Pelargir Ship Captain enters play, move 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero you control to another hero's resource pool.

flavor: "...still the lords of Gondor have keener sight than lesser men..." <cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Visionary Leadership
text: Attach to a Gondor hero. While attached hero has at least 1 resource in its resource pool, Gondor characters get +1 [willpower].

flavor: Right through the press drove Théoden Thengel's son, and his spear was shivered as he threw down thier chieftan. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Spear of the Mark
text: Restricted. Attach to a Rohan character. Attached character gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if attacking an enemy in the staging area).

flavor: "Oaths ye have taken: now fulfill them all, to lord and land and league of friendship!" <cite>Théoden, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Forth Eorlingas!
text: Combat Action: Each Rohan hero can be declared as an attacker against enemies in the staging area this phase.

flavor: ...fresh horses were always in readiness to bear his errand-riders to Rohan in the Noth... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Steed of the Mark
text: Attach to a Gondor or Rohan hero. Response: after attached hero commits to a quest, spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to ready attached hero.

flavor:
An Elven-maid there was of old.
A shining star by day:
Her mantle white was hemmed with hold,
Her shoes of silver-grey.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Lay of Nimrodel
text: Action: Choose a [spirit] hero. Until the end of the phase, that hero gets +1 [willpower] for each resource in its resource pool.

name: Ered Nimrais Prospector
text: Response: After Ered Nimrais Prospector enters play, discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Then, choose and shuffle 1 card from your discard pile back into your deck.

name: Scroll of Isildur
text: Attach to a [lore] hero. Reduce the cost to play Scroll of Isildur by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [lore] resource icon. Action: Discard Scroll of Isildur to play any [lore] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

flavor:
...there was a good deal of food jumbled carlessly on shelves and on the ground, among an untidy litter of plunder...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Hidden Cache
text: Response: After Hidden Cache is discarded from your deck, add 2 resources to the resource pool of a hero you control. Action: Spend 1 resource to draw 1 card.

name: The Rearguard
text:
Setup: Set aside Lord Alcaron, Nazgûl of Minas Morgul, and The White Bridge. Add To the Tower, Murzag, and 1 copy of Morgul Vale to the staging area.
Murzag cannot leave play unless destroyed. If Murzag is defeated, advance to the next stage.

name: The Betrayal
text:
When Revealed: Add Lord Alcaron to the staging area.
Lord Alcaron cannot leave play unless destroyed. If Lord Alcaron is defeated, advance to the next stage.

name: The Morgul Rider
text:
When Revealed: Add Nazgûl of Minas Morgul and The White Bridge to the staging area.
When Revealed: Reveal 1 card per player from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.
Nazgûl of Minas Morgul cannot leave play unless destroyed.
If Nazgûl of Minas Morgul is defeated, the players have won the game.

name: To the Tower
text:
To the Tower cannot leave the staging area.
Remove Faramir from the game.
If 10 or more progress tokens are on To the Tower, the players have lost the game.

name: Morgul Bodyguard
text: Any damage that would be dealt to a Captain enemy is dealt to 1 Morgul Bodyguard instead.

name: Morgul Sorcerer
text: Forced: After any number of progress tokens are placed on To the Tower, deal Morgul Sorcerer a shadow card.

name: Morgul Tracker
text: Forced: When Morgul Tracker is optionally engaged, place 1 progress token on To the Tower.

name: Murzag
text: Forced: After Murzag attacks, reveal the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is an enemy, put it into play engaged with the defending player.

name: Lord Alcaron
text:
Forced: When Lord Alcaron attacks, place 1 progress token on To the Tower.
Forced: When Lord Alcaron is dealt a shadow card with no shadow effect, he makes an additional attack after this one (deal and resolve another shadow card).

name: Nazgûl of Minas Morgul
text:
Nazgûl of Minas Morgul cannot have attachments.
Reduce any amount of damage dealt to Nazgûl of Minas Morgul to 1.

name: Morgul Road
text: Response: After Morgul Road leaves play as an explored location, the first player may remove 1 progress token from To the Tower or deal 1 damage to an enemy in play.

name: Morgul Vale
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, place 1 progress token on To the Tower.
text: Forced: At the end of the round, each player returns 1 enemy engaged with him to the staging area.

name: The White Bridge
text: X is the number of progress tokens on To the Tower.

name: Impenetrable Fog
text: When Revealed: The first player places 3 progress tokens on To the Tower or reveals X additional cards from the encounter deck and adds them to the staging area. X is the number of players in the game.

name: Sleepless Malice
text:
Doomed 2.
When Revealed: Each player must discard 3 random cards from his hand or place 1 progress token on To The Tower.

name: Terror Drives Them
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Place 1 progress token on To the Tower.

name: The Dead City Looms
text: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by the number of progress tokens on To the Tower. If there are no progress tokens on To the Tower, The Dead City Looms gains surge.

flavor: "I am named Éomer son of Éomund, and am called the Third Marshal of Riddermark." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Éomer
text: Response: After a character leaves play, Éomer gets +2 [attack] until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

flavor: "Let your counsellor Gríma keep all things till your return – and I pray that we may see it, though no wise man will deem it hopeful." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Gríma
text: Action: Lower the cost of the next card you play from your hand this round by 1. That card gains Doomed 1. (Limit once per round.)

name: Saruman
text: Doomed 3. At the end of the round, discard Saruman from play. Response: After Saruman enters play, choose a non-unique enemy or location in the staging area. While Saruman is in play, the chosen enemy or location is considered to be out of play.

flavor: "...the keepers of the gate were on the watch for me and told me that Saruman awaited me." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Orthanc Guard
text: Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, ready Orthanc Guard.

flavor: "I have an urgent errand," he said. "My news is evil." <cite>Radagast, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Isengard Messenger
text: Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, Isengard Messenger gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round. (Limit twice per round.)

flavor: "Erkenbrand of Westfold has drawn off those men he could gather towards his fastness at Helm's Deep. The rest are scattered." <cite>Rider of Rohan, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Westfold Outrider
text: Action: Discard Westfold Outrider to choose an enemy not engaged with you. Engage the chosen enemy.

flavor: "They love their horses next to their kin." <cite>Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Westfold Horse-breeder
text: Response: After Westfold Horse-breeder enters play, search the top 10 cards of your deck for a Mount attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

flavor: Their horses were of great stature, strong and clean-limbed... <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Rohan Warhorse
text: Attach to a [tactics] or Rohan hero. Restricted. Response: After attached hero participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, exhaust Rohan Warhorse to ready attached hero.

flavor: ...one of them uncovered a small lamp that gave out a slender silver beam. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Silver Lamp
text:
Attach to a [spirit] hero.
While attached hero is ready, shadow cards dealt to enemies engaged with you are dealt face up. (Shadow card effects are still resolved when resolving enemy attacks.)

flavor: "He has the Key of Orthanc" <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Keys of Orthanc
text: Attach to a hero. Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, exhaust Keys of Orthanc to add 1 resource to attached hero's resource pool.

flavor: "...in the midst of that valley is a tower of stone called Orthanc. It was not made by Saruman, but by the Men of Númenor long ago: and it is very tall and has many secrets..." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Legacy of Númenor
text: Doomed 4. Action: Add 1 resource to each hero's resource pool.

flavor: "His knowledge is deep, but his pride has grown with it..." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Deep Knowledge
text: Doomed 2. Action: Each player draws 2 cards.

flavor: ...it was a delight to hear the voice speaking, all that it said seemed wise and reasonable... <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: The Wizards's Voice
text: Doomed 3. Action: Each player chooses 1 enemy engaged with him. Until the end of the phase, each chosen enemy cannot attack the player that chose it.

flavor: "But Saruman has long studied the arts of the Enemy himself, and thus we have often been able to forestall him." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Power of Orthanc
text: Doomed 2. Action: Each player may choose and discard a Condition attachment from play.

flavor: "...alone it could do nothing but see small images of things far off and days remote." <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: The Seeing-stone
text: Doomed 1. Action: Search your deck for a card with the Doomed keyword and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

name: Gríma
text:
If free of encounters, the first player gains control of Gríma.
Action: Exhaust Gríma to draw a card.
If Gríma leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: The Islet
text:
Immune to player card effects.
While The Islet is the active location, each Dunland enemy in play gets +1 [Threat].
Victory 1.

name: Fords of Isen
text:
While Fords of Isen is in the staging area, players cannot gain resources from card effects.
Forced: After Fords of Isen becomes the active location, each player with fewer than 5 cards in his hand draws cards until he has 5 in his hand.

name: The King's Road
text:
While any player has 3 or more cards in hand, The King's Road gets +3 quest points.
While any player has 5 or more cards in hand, The King's Road gains: "When faced with the option to travel, the players must travel to The King's Road, if able."

name: Gap of Rohan
text: While Gap of Rohan is in the staging area, Dunland enemies get +1 [Attack].

name: Pillaging and Burning
text: When Revealed: Each player draws a card. Each player raises his threat by 1 for each card in his hand.

name: Down from the Hills
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: Either remove 1 time counter from the current quest, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Dunland enemy, reveal it, and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. If any player has 5 or more cards in hand, this effect cannot be canceled.

name: Ill Tidings
text: When Revealed: The first player draws this card into his hand. Ill Tidings cannot leave that player's hand. Then, if the first player has 5 or more cards in his hand, Ill Tidings gains surge.

name: Mugash
text:
Cannot have attachments.
Forced: After Mugash is defeated, the first player attaches him to a hero he controls and exhausts that hero. (Counts as a Captive attachment with the text: "Attached hero cannot ready. If attached hero leaves play, the players lose the game.")

name: Mugash's Guard
text:
While a player controls a hero with Mugash attached, Mugash's Guard engages that player.
Forced: After Mugash's Guard destroys a character, if Mugash is attached to a hero, return Mugash to the staging area.
Victory 3.

name: Methedras Orc
text: Forced: When Methedras Orc attacks, the defending player shuffles 1 random card from his hand into his out-of-play deck.

name: Methedras
text:
While Methedras is the active location, each location in the staging area gets +1 [Threat].
Forced: When Methedras leaves play as an explored location, each player Searches 3.

name: Orc Cave
text:
Forced: After Orc Cave leaves play as an explored location, the first player Searches 5.
Travel: Discard the top X cards of the encounter deck to travel here. X is the number of players in the game. Add each Orc enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

name: Mugash's Lair
text: Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, reveal the top card of each player's out-of-play deck. Add each revealed enemy to the staging area and discard the rest.

name: Orc Territory
text: When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a location and adds it to the staging area. If the total [Threat] in the staging area is less than the total [Willpower] of all characters committed to the quest, each Orc enemy engaged with a player makes an immediate attack.

name: Mugash
text:
Guarded.
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective when it is free of encounters. Attach Mugash to that hero.
Forced: After attached hero takes damage, return Mugash to the top of the encounter deck.

name: Edge of Fangorn
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Travel: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Huorn enemy and add it to the staging area to travel here (2 Huorn enemies instead if there are 3 or more players in the game).
Victory 1.

name: Dark-Hearted Huorn
text:
Hinder. Cannot have attachments.
Forced: At the beginning of each resource phase, the engaged player must raise his threat by 2.

name: Angry Huorn
text:
Hinder. Cannot have attachments.
Forced: At the beginning of each resource phase, Angry Huorn attacks the engaged player.

name: Deadly Huorn
text:
Hinder. Cannot have attachments.
Forced: At the beginning of each resource phase, the engaged player must deal 3 damage to a character he controls.

name: Heart of Fangorn
text:
While Heart of Fangorn is in the staging area, each player cannot refresh more than 5 characters during the refresh phase.
.

name: The Forest's Malice
text: When Revealed: Each Huorn enemy engaged with a player makes an immediate attack. If no attack was made as a result of this effect, each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Huorn enemy and put it into play engaged with him. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Orc Skirmisher
text: Forced: After Orc Skirmisher engages a player, that player must either deal 3 damage to a character he controls, or remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Orc Hunter
text: When Revealed: Either reveal an additional encounter card, or remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Orc Hound
text:
Surge.
Forced: After Orc Hound engages a player, that player must exhaust a character he controls.

name: Orc Hunting Party
text: When Revealed: Deal each Orc enemy in play a shadow card. Each Orc enemy gets -15 engagement cost until the end of the round. If there are no Orc enemies in the staging area, Orc Hunting Party gains surge.

name: Dunland Prowler
text: While any player has 3 or more cards in hand, Dunland Prowler gains surge. While any player has 5 or more cards in hand, Dunland Powler gets +1 Threat.

name: Dunlending Bandit
text: While engaged with a player, Dunlending Bandit gets +1 [Attack] for each card in that player's hand.

name: Dunland Raider
text: Forced: After Dunland Raider engages a player, that player must deal X damage divided among characters he controls where X equals the number of cards in his hand.

name: Old Hatreds
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Attach to the current quest.
(Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, raise his threat by 1.")

name: Dunland Tribesman
text:
When Revealed: Each player draws a card.

Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, Dunland Tribesman gets +1 [Threat] until the end of the round.

name: Dunland Chieftain
text: Forced: After Dunland Chieftain engages a player, discard X cards from the top of the encounter deck where X is the number of cards in the engages player's hand. Put the topmost Dunland enemy discarded this way into play engaged with that player.

name: Dunland Berserker
text: Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards. Dunland Berserker makes an immediate attack.

name: Wild Men of Dunland
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Attach to the current quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, that player deals 1 damage to a character he controls.")

name: Ancient Forest
text: While Ancient Forest is in the staging area, each Forest location in the staging area gets +1 [Threat] and +3 quest points. This ability does not stack with other copies of Ancient Forest.

name: Tangled Woods
text: While Tangled Woods is in the staging area, each Forest location in plays gains: "Travel: Exhaust a hero to travel here." This ability does not stack with other copies of Tangled Woods.

name: Turned Around
text: When Revealed: Either remove 1 time counter from a card in play, or return the active location to the staging area.

name: Prowling Wolf
text: While engaged with a player, Prowling Wolf gets +1 [Attack] for each location in the staging area.

name: Broken Lands
text: While Broken Lands is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on locations in the staging area.

name: Take Cover!
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Either deal 1 damage to each exhausted character, or remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Low on Provisions
text: When Revealed: Each player must assign X damage among characters he controls, where X is the number of characters he controls.

name: Off Track
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Attach to a location in play. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per location. Attached location gets +2 quest points and Gain: 'Forced: Remove an additional time counter from the current quest at the end of each refresh phase, if able.'")

name: In Need of Rest
text: When Revealed: Remove a hero from the quest and attach In Need of Rest to that hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Forced: After a time counter is removed from the current quest, attached hero takes 1 damage.")

name: Fight at the Fords
text:
Setup: Add The Islet to the staging area and attach Gríma to that location. Each player searches the encounter deck for 1 different Dunland enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Time 5. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, discard Gríma from play.

The players cannot advance unless the first player controls Gríma.

name: Dunlending Attack
text:
When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 different Dunland enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, each player assigns X damage among characters he controls where X is the number of cards in his hand. Place 2 time counters on this stage.

name: Hold the Fords
text:
When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 different Dunland enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, discard the top X cards from the encounter deck. X is the number of cards in the first player's hand. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area. Put 3 time counters on this stage.

While there is at least 1 enemy in play, the players cannot defeat this stage. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Orders from Orthanc
text:
Setup: Each player removes the top 20 cards of his deck and places them aside, as an out-of-play deck. The first player takes Mugash plus 1 Mugash's Guard for each other player in the game and randomly shuffles one facedown into each player's out-of-play deck. Place any remaining copies of Mugash's Guard aside, out of play.

When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck for a Mountain location and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Then, advance to stage 2.

name: Searching for Mugash
text:
Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed for this stage, shuffle the discard pile into the encounter deck and reveal 2 encounter cards per player. Place 2 time counters on this stage.

Response: After questing successfully, cancel all progress that would be placed on this stage. Then, place 1 time counter on this stage. Or, if Mugash is in play, advance to stage 3.

name: The Wizard's Prize
text:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, return Mugash to the staging area and reveal X encounter cards. X is the number of players in the game minus 1. Place 3 time counters on this stage.

Progress cannot be placed on this stage unless Mugash is attached to a hero.

If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Into the Woods
text:
Setup: Add Edge of Fangorn to the staging area and attach Mugash to that location. Shuffle the encounter deck. Reveal X additional encounter cards where X equals the number of players in the game minus 1.

Time 4. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, shuffle Mugash into the encounter deck and advance to stage 3.

The players cannot advance to stage 2 unless Mugash is attached to a hero.

name: Escape from Fangorn
text:
When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Huorn enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Time 4. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, shuffle Mugash into the encounter deck and advance to stage 3A.

The players cannot defeat this stage unless Mugash is attached to a hero.

If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: The Angry Forest
text:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck. Each player must choose an enemy or objective in the discard pile, reveal it and add it to the staging area. Place 3 time counters on this stage.

Forced: After placing progress here, if there is at least 6 progress on this stage and Mugash is attached to a hero, advance to stage 2A.

flavor: "...the lord of the Galadhrim is accounted wisest of the Elves of Middle-earth, and a giver of gifts beyond the power of kings." <cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Celeborn
text: Response: After a Silvan ally enters play, that ally gets +1 [willpower] +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

flavor: "...I shall lead you well..." <cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Naith Guide
text: Response: After Naith Guide enters play, choose a hero. That hero does not exhaust to quest this round.

flavor: A marching host of Elves had come up silently... <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Swift and Silent
text: Action: Ready a hero you control. Then, if your threat is 20 or less and this is the first time you played a copy of Swift and Silent this round, return this card to your hand instead of discarding it.

name: Firefoot
text: Attach to a [tactics] or Rohan hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if attached hero is Éomer). Response: After attached hero attacks alone, exhaust Firefoot to choose a non-unique enemy engaged with you. Excess damage dealt by this attack is assigned to the chosen enemy.

flavor: "That spear-thrust would have skewered a wild boar!" <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Close Call
text: Doomed X. Response: Cancel X damage just dealt to a hero.

name: Blue Mountain Trader
text: Action: Choose another player. That player gains control of Blue Mountain Trader. Then, that player moves 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero he controls to the resource pool of a hero you control, or Blue Mountain Trader is discarded. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
...for into darkness fell his star
in Mordor where the shadows are.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: The Fall of Gil-Galad
text: Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a hero. Response: When attached hero is destroyed, add The Fall of Gil-Galad to the victory display to reduce your threat by X, where X is the attached hero's threat cost.

flavor: All had swords at their sides... <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Ithilien Lookout
text: Secrecy 2. Response: After Ithilien Lookout enters play, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If it is an enemy, you may discard it.

flavor: No folk could they see, nor hear any feet upon the paths; but there were many voices, about them, and in the air above. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: The Tree People
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Silvan ally. Put that ally into play and shuffle the other cards back into your deck. You can only play 1 copy of The Tree People each phase.

flavor:
"I it was who first summoned the White Council."
<cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: The White Council
text: X is the number of players in the game. Action: Starting with the first player, each player chooses 1 different option: ready a hero he controls, add 1 resource to the resource pool of a hero he controls, draw 1 card, or shuffle 1 card from his discard pile into his deck.

name: The Road to Tharbad
text:
Setup: Set Chief Turch and Munuv Dûv Ravine aside, out of play. Make Old South Road the active location. Each player searches the encounter deck for a Boar Clan enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, each player discards his hand and draws 2 cards. Place 2 time counters on this stage.

name: A Well Laid Trap
text:
When Revealed: Make Munuv Dûv Ravine the active location (returning any previous active location to the staging area). Each player discards each Item and each Mount attachment he controls. Each player chooses 1 ally he controls and discards each other ally he controls.

When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Boar Clan enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck. Each player shuffles his discard pile into his draw deck and draws 1 card.
Forced: At the end of the combat phase, advance to stage 3A.

name: No Way Out
text:
When Revealed: Put Chief Turch into play, engaged with the first player.

Time X. X is 5 times the number of players in the game.
If a hero is destroyed at this stage, the players lose the game.
Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, the players make engagement checks. Then, each engaged enemy makes an attack. If no heroes are destroyed by these attacks, the players win the game.

name: Chief Turch
text:
Cannot have attachments. Cannot leave play. Chief Turch engages the first player.
Forced: After an enemy engages a player, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Munuv Dûv Ravine
text: Dunland enemies get +1 [Attack] and +1 [Defense].

name: Old South Road
text: Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Boar Clan Stalker
text:
Boar Clan Stalker gets +1 Û and +1 Ú for each resource token on it (limit +4).
Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards, put a resource token on Boar Clan Stalker.

name: Boar Clan Warrior
text: Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards, deal Boar Clan Warrior a shadow card.

name: Hithaeglir foothills
text:
Surge.
X is the number of resource tokens on this card.
Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, place 1 resource token here.

name: Hills of Dunland
text:
While Hills of Dunland is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card is a Dunland enemy, put it into play engaged with that player. This ability does not stack with other copies of Hills of Dunland.”
Travel: Each player draws a card to travel here.

name: Plains of Enedwaith
text: While Plains of Enedwaith is the active location, players do not draw a card during the resource phase.

name: Hithaeglir Stream
text: While Hithaeglir Stream is the active location, players draw 2 cards during the resource phase instead of 1.

name: Frenzied Attack
text: When Revealed: Each player draws a card. Each player discards each ally from his hand. If no allies are discarded this way, Frenzied Attack gains surge.

name: Dunlending Ambush
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Attach to the active location. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Limit 1 per location. Forced: After attached location is explored, each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Dunland enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.”)

flavor: "Where now are the Dúnedain, Elessar, Elessar? Why do thy kinsfolk wander afar?" <cite>Galadriel, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Idraen
text: Response: After a location is explored, ready Idraen.

flavor: "Elrond is sending Elves, and they will get in touch with the Rangers, and maybe with Thranduil's folk in Mirkwood." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Rivendell Scout
text: Secrecy 2.

flavor: "The three of us could not challenge a hundred, so we went ahead and spoke with feigned voices, leading them on into the wood." <cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Feigned Voices
text: Combat Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.

flavor: ...the Company set out again, guided now by Haldir and his brother Rúmil. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Rúmil
text: Ranged. Response: After you play Rúmil from your hand, choose an enemy engaged with a player. Deal X damage to that enemy where X is the number of ranged characters you control.

flavor: ...they were tall and and clad in grey mail, and from their shoulders hung long white cloaks. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Elven Mail
text: Restricted. Attach to a Noldor or Silvan character. Attached character gets +2 hit points and gains sentinel.

flavor: ...others had gone west, and with the help of Aragorn and the Rangers had searched the lands far down the Greyflood... <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Greyflood Wanderer
text: You may give Greyflood Wanderer doomed 2 when you play from your hand. If you do, it gains: "Response: After you play Greyflood Wanderer, place 1 progress token on each location in play."

flavor: "I have had a hard life and a long: and the leagues that lie between here and Gondor are a small part in the count of my journeys." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Warden of Arnor
text: Attach to a Scout hero. While attached character is committed to the quest, place 1 progress on the first location revealed by the encounter deck each round.

flavor: "But we have heard rumours of your coming, for the messengers of Elrond passed by Lórien on the way home up the Dimrill Stair. <cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Message from Elrond
text: Action: Choose a player. That player may choose 1 card from his hand and add it to another player's hand. At the end of the round, if the chosen card is in that player's hand or in play, shuffle it into its owner's deck.

flavor: ...the woodland folk were altogether noiseless in their movements. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Noiseless Movement
text: Action: Choose an enemy in the staging area. That enemy does not make engagement checks this round. Then, if your threat is 20 or less and this is the first time you played a copy of Noiseless Movement this round, return this card to your hand instead of discarding it.

flavor: Each cloak was fastened about the neck with a brooch like a green leaf veined with silver. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Leaf Brooch
text:
Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero.
The first event card you play each round that matches attached hero's printed sphere gains secrecy 1.

flavor:
1A 

1B
name: The Trials Begin
text:
1A Setup: Set aside all 3 Guardian enemies, all 3 Key objectives, all 3 Barrow Locations, and Hallowed Circle.

1B When Revealed: The players advance to a stage 2A quest of their choice.

flavor:
2A

2B
name: The Trial of Strength

flavor:
2A

2B
name: The Trial of Perseverance

flavor:
2A

2B
name: The Trial of Intuition

flavor:
3A

3B
name: The Antlered Crown
Boar's Guardian
text:
Cannot have non-Key attachments.
Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from Boar’s Guardian, the engaged player must discard an ally he controls. Place 2 time counters on Boar’s Guardian.

name: Wolf's Guardian
text:
Cannot have non-Key attachments.
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from Wolf’s Guardian, it makes an immediate attack against the engaged player. Place 3 time counters on Wolf’s Guardian.

name: Raven's Guardian
text:
Cannot have non-Key attachments.
ime 4. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from Raven’s Guardian, deal 1 damage to each character controlled by the engaged player. Place 4 time counters on Raven’s Guardian.

name: Key of the Boar
text:
If unattached, the first player must claim Key of the Boar and attach it to a hero he controls.
If Key of the Boar is discarded, add it to the staging area.

name: Key of the Wolf
text:
If unattached, the first player must claim Key of the Wolf and attach it to a hero he controls.
If Key of the Wolf is discarded, add it to the staging area.

name: Key of the Raven
text:
If unattached, the first player must claim Key of the Raven and attach it to a hero he controls.
If Key of the Raven is discarded, add it to the staging area.

name: Hill Barrow
text:
Forced: When a Guardian enemy attacks,
deal it 1 additional shadow card.

name: Cave Barrow
text: The players, as a group, cannot have more than 5 allies in play. (If there are more than 5 allies in play, discard allies until only 5 remain.)

name: Stone Barrow
text:
Forced: After a Guardian enemy attacks,
raise each player’s threat by X, where X is that enemy’s [Threat].

name: Hallowed Circle
text:
Immune to player card effects. X is the number of players in the game.
Travel: The players must exhaust 3 Key objectives.
Forced: After the players travel here, each engaged Guardian enemy makes an immediate attack.

name: Spirit of the Wild
text: Cannot have attachments. Spirit of the Wild gets +1 [Threat] and +1 [Attack] for each Key objective the players control.

name: Cursed Forest
text: Travel: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Spirit enemy and add it to the staging area.

name: Grim Foothills
text:
Doomed 2.
X is the number of players in the game.
While Grim Foothills is in the staging area, progress must be placed on Grim Foothills before it can be placed on the active location.

name: Curse of the Wild Men
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each non-unique character in play. If the players control 3 Key objectives, Curse of the Wild Men gains surge.

name: The Guardian's Fury
text: When Revealed: Each Guardian enemy makes an attack. If there are no Guardian enemies in play, reveal a random Guardian enemy from the victory display, and add it to the staging area.

name: Wild Tenacity
text: When Revealed: Remove X time counters from each enemy in play with the time keyword, where X is the number of players.

flavor: "We allow no strangers to spy out the secrets of the Naith..." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Haldir of Lórien
text: Ranged. Combat Action: If you have not engaged an enemy this round, exhaust Haldir of Lórien to declare him as an attacker (and resolve his attack) against an enemy not engaged with you. Limit once per round.

flavor: "Send the heralds forth! Let them summon all who dwell nigh!" <cite>Théoden, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Herald of Anórien
text: You may give Herald of Anórien doomed 2 when you play it from your hand. If you do, it gains: "Response: After you play Herald of Anórien, choose a player. That player may put into play 1 ally from his hand with a printed cost 2 or lower."

flavor:
"I sang of leaves, of leaves of gold, and
leaves of gold there grew:
Of wind I sang, a wind there came and in the
branches blew." <cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: O Lórien!
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust O Lórien! to lower the cost of the next Silvan ally played this phase by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

flavor: "The North Wind blows, but we shall outfly it." <cite>Gwaihir, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Gwaihir
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After Gwaihir enters play, search your discard pile for an Eagle ally and put it into play under your control. At the end of the round, if that ally is still in play, add it to your hand.

flavor: The marauding orcs had been waylaid and almost all destroyed; the remnant had fled westward towards the mountains, and were being pursued. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Pursuing the Enemy
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose a player. Deal 1 damage to each enemy engaged with that player.

flavor: But the courage that had been awakened in him was now too strong: he could not leave his friends so easily. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Courage Awakened
text: Action: Choose a hero. That hero gets +2 [willpower] until the end of the phase. Then, if your threat is 20 or less and this is the first time you played a copy of Courage Awakened this round, return this card to your hand instead of discarding it.

flavor: Suddenly he was aware of himself again. Frodo, neither the Voice nor the Eye; free to choose, and with one remaining instant in which to do so. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Free to Choose
text: Response: After your threat is raised by an encounter card effect, reduce your threat by an equal amount.

flavor: ...the language was that of Elven-song and spoke of things little known on Middle-earth. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Galadhrim Minstrel
text: Response: After Galadhrim Minstrel enters play, search the top five cards of your deck for an event card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

flavor: "...it is more strengthing than any food made by Men, and it is more pleasant than cram, by all accounts. <cite>Lórien Elf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Lembas
text: Play only if you control a Noldor or Silvan hero. Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Lembas to ready attached hero and heal 3 damage from it.

flavor: "We have been keeping watch on the rivers, ever since we saw a great troop of Orcs going North toward Moria..." <cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Defender of the Naith
text: Sentinel. Response: After a Silvan ally you control leaves play, ready Defender of the Naith.

flavor:
1A

1B
name: Double Dealings

flavor:
1A

1B
name: Escape from Tharbad
Nalir
text:
The first player gains control of Nalir.
Forced: At the beginning of the refresh phase, raise your threat by 1 for each player in the game.
If Nalir leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: The Empty Mug
text:
Players cannot reduce their threat.
While The Empty Mug is in the victory display, the current quest gains “Forced: After a player card effect reduces a player’s threat, remove it from the game.”

name: Bellach
text:
X is the number of players in the game.
Orc and Creature enemies get –30 engagement cost and +1 [Threat].
Forced: When Bellach is destroyed, shuffle him into the encounter deck.

name: The Crossing at Tharbad
text:
Immune to player card effects. Cannot leave the staging area.
The Crossing at Tharbad gets +2 quest points for each player in the game.
When The Crossing at Tharbad is explored, the players win the game.

name: Spy from Mordor
text: Forced: When Spy From Mordor attacks, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Bellach's Marauder
text: While Bellach’s Marauder is engaged with a player, it gains: “Forced: After a time counter is removed from the current quest, deal Bellach’s Marauder 2 shadow cards.”

name: Streets of Tharbad
text:
Progress cannot be placed on Streets of Tharbad while it is in the staging area.
While Streets of Tharbad is the active location, enemies get –20 engagement cost.

name: Tharbad Hideout
text:
Surge.
While Tharbad Hideout is the active location, time counters cannot be removed from the current quest.
Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, place 1 progress on Tharbad Hideout.

name: Ruins of the Second Age
text:
While Ruins of the Second Age is in the staging area, City locations get +1 [Threat].
While Ruins of the Second Age is the active location, deal engaged enemies 1 additional shadow card at the beginning of the combat phase.

name: Seedy Inn
text: Travel: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Spy enemy and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Hidden Alleway
text:
Travel: Raise each player’s threat by X to travel here. X is the number of enemies in play.
Forced: After traveling to Hidden Alleyway, add 1 time counter to the current quest.

name: Decrepit Rooftops
text:
While Decrepit Rooftops is the active location, enemies get +1 [Threat] and do not make engagement checks.
Forced: After traveling to Decrepit Rooftops, return all engaged enemies to the staging area.

name: Constant Tail
text:
When Revealed: Return all engaged enemies to the staging area. Then, the first player either removes 1 time counter from the current quest or each Spy enemy in the staging area gets
+2 [Threat] until the end of the phase.

name: Conspicuous Lot
text: When Revealed: Each player raises his threat by 1 for each ally he controls. Then, if any player’s threat is 20 or less, this card gains surge.

name: Cornedered
text: When Revealed: The first player either removes 1 time counter from the current quest or each enemy gets –20 engagement cost and +1 [Attack] until the end of the round.

name: Get That Dwarf !
text: When Revealed: The enemy in the staging area with the highest [Attack] engages the first player and makes an immediate attack against Nalir. If there are no enemies in the staging area, Get That Dwarf! gains surge.

flavor:
But the Captains of the West were well warned by their scouts, skilled men from Henneth Annûn led by Mablung...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Mablung
text: Response: After you engage an enemy, add 1 resource to Mablung's resource pool. (Limit once per phase.)

flavor:
"Come! I will lead you now!"
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Follow Me!
text: Action: Take control of the first player token and draw 1 card.

flavor: There was nothing now to be done but to tighten the belts round their empty stomachs, and hoist their empty sacks and packs... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Tighten Our Belts
text: Refresh Action: Choose a player. Each hero that player controls that did not spend any resources this round gains 1 resource. Only 1 copy of Tighten Our Belts can be played by the players each round.

flavor: "...they say that you breathe so loud that they could shoot you in the dark." <cite>Legolas, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Galadhon Archer
text: Ranged. Response: After Galadhon Archer enters play, deal 1 damage to an enemy not engaged with you.

flavor: ...longer and stronger than the bows of Mirkwood, and strung with a string of elf-hair. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Bow of the Galadhrim
text: Restricted. Attach to a Silvan character with the ranged keyword. Attached character gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if attacking an enemy not engaged with you.)

flavor: In two days going they rowed right up the Long Lake and passed out into the River Running... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Celduin Traveler
text: Secrecy 2. Response: After Celduin Traveler enters play, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If it is a location, you may discard it.

flavor:
"...we dare not by our own trust endanger our land. We live now upon an island amid many perils..." 
<cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Island Amid Perils
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to reduce your threat by X where X is the printed cost of the ally returned to your hand.

name: Mirkwood Pioneer
text: You may give Mirkwood Pioneer doomed 1 when you play it from your hand. If you do, it gains: "Response: After you play Mirkwood Pioneer, choose a card in the staging area. Until the end of the round, the chosen card does not contribute its [threat]."

flavor:
"Wingfoot I name you. This deed of the three friends should be sung in many a hall. Forty leagues and five you have measured ere the forth day is ended!"
<cite>Éomer, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Wingfoot
text: Attach to a Ranger hero. Response: After attached hero commits to a quest. name enemy, location or treachery. If a card of the named type is revealed during this quest phase, exhaust Wingfoot to ready attached hero.

flavor:
"...if by life or death I can save you, I will."
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Defender of the West
text:
Attach to a non-objective unique ally in play.
The first player gains control of attached ally.
Damage from undefended attacks against you may be assigned to attached ally.

name: Fleeing from Tharbad
text:
Setup: The first player takes control of Nalir. Set the Ancient Marsh-dweller aside, out of play. Each player searches the encounter deck for a different location and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

When Revealed: Advance to a random stage 2A.

name: Through the Marsh - No End in Sight
text:
When Revealed: Raise each player’s threat by 1.

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 2a at random. Return this stage to the quest deck.

Player card effects cannot be used to gain resources or draw cards.

Forced: When the players defeat this stage, advance to a random stage 3A.

name: Through the Marsh - A Weary Passage
text:
When Revealed: Raise each player’s threat by 1.

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 2a at random. Return this stage to the quest deck.

In order to commit characters to the quest, a player must first discard a card at random from his hand.

Forced: When the players defeat this stage, advance to a random stage 3A.

name: Through the Marsh - A Forgotten Land
text:
When Revealed: Raise each player’s threat by 1.

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 2a at random. Return this stage to the quest deck.

Each player cannot play more than 1 card each round.

Forced: When the players defeat this stage, advance to a random stage 3A.

name: Lost in the Swanfleet - Impassible Marshlands
text:
When Revealed: Raise each player’s threat by 1. Add Ancient Marsh-dweller to the staging area (from out of play or engaged with a player) and heal all damage from it.

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 3a at random. Return this stage to the quest deck.

Each location in play gets +1 $.

name: Lost in the Swanfleet - A Treacherous Swamp
text:
When Revealed: Raise each player’s threat by 1. Add Ancient Marsh-dweller to the staging area (from out of play or engaged with a player) and heal all damage from it.

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 3a at random. Return this stage to the quest deck.

Each player cannot ready more than 5 characters during the refresh phase.

name: Lost in the Swanfleet - Creatures of a Forgotten Age
text:
When Revealed: Raise each player’s threat by 1. Add Ancient Marsh-dweller to the staging area (from out of play or engaged with a player) and heal all damage from it.

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 3a at random. Return this stage to the quest deck.

Each enemy in the staging area gets -20 engagement cost.

name: Out of the Swamp
text:
When Revealed: Add Ancient Marsh-dweller to the staging area (from out of play or engaged with a player) and heal all damage from it. Then, Ancient Marsh-dweller makes an attack against each player in player order.

Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, Ancient Marsh-dweller makes an attack against each player in order. Place 2 time counters on this stage.

When Ancient Marsh-dweller is defeated, the players win the game.

name: Nalir
text:
The first player gains control of Nalir.
Forced: At the beginning of the refresh phase, raise your threat by 1 for each player in the game.
If Nalir leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Ancient Marsh-dweller
text:
Cannot have attachments.
Ancient Marsh-dweller gets +1 $ and +1 Û for each resource token on it.
Forced: After any number of time counters are removed from the current quest, place a resource token here.

name: Giant Swamp Adder
text:
Cannot have attachments.
Forced: After any number of time counters are removed from the current quest, Giant Swamp Adder attacks the engaged player.

name: Neekerbreekers
text: Forced: After any number of time counters are removed from the current quest, the engaged player must deal 2 damage to an ally he controls.

name: Fen of Reeds
text: While Fen of Reeds is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After the players advance to a quest stage, each player must exhaust a character he controls.”

name: Finger of Glanduin
text: While Finger of Glanduin is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: At the end of each round, remove 1 progress from each location in play.”

name: Hidden Eyot
text:
Response: After Hidden Eyot leaves play as an explored location, place 2 time counters on the current quest.
Travel: Each player must exhaust a character he controls to travel here.

name: Sinking Bog
text: While Sinking Bog is in the staging area, each character gets -1 Ò, -1 Û, and -1 Ú for each Item attached to it. This ability does not stack with other copies of Sinking Bog.

name: Shifting Marshland
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Remnants of Elder Days
text: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Creature enemy and put it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Galadriel
text: Galadriel cannot quest, attack, or defend. Allies you control do not exhaust to commit to the quest during the round they enter play. Action: Exhaust Galadriel to choose a player. That player reduces his threat by 1 and draws 1 card. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
"...in my turn I bore it, and so did each eldest son of our house, far back into the vanished years before the failing of the kings..."
<cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Heir of Mardil
text: Attach to a Noble hero. Response: After attached hero gains any number of resources from a card effect, exhaust Heir of Mardil to ready attached hero.

flavor: "Orophin has now gone in haste back to our dwellings to warn our people." <cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Orophin
text: Ranged. Response: After Orophin enters play, return a Silvan ally from your discard pile to your hand.

flavor: "Does he think that men sleep without watch all night?" <cite>Faramir, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Henneth Annûn Guard
text: You may give Henneth Annûn Guard doomed 1 when you play it from your hand. If you do, it gains: "Response: After you play Henneth Annûn Guard, choose a character. Until the end of the round, that character gets +2 [defense] and gains sentinel."

flavor: "Arise, arise, riders of Théoden!" <cite>Théoden, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Charge of the Rohirrim
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, each Rohan character with a Mount attachment gets +3 [attack].

flavor: Her maidens stood silent about her, and a while she looked upon her guests. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Galadriel's Handmaiden
text: Response: After Galadriel's Handmaiden enters play, choose a player. That player reduces his threat by 1.

flavor:
"What you will see, if you leave the Mirror free to work, I cannot tell. For it shows things that were, things that are, things that yet may be."
<cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Mirror of Galadriel
text:
Attach to Galadriel.
Exhaust Mirror of Galadriel to search the top 10 cards of your deck for a card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the rest back into your deck. Then, discard a random card from your hand.

flavor: There were songs about the hunt of the Ents for the Entwives sung among Elves and Men from Mirkwood to Gondor. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Wandering Ent
text:
Cannot have restricted attachments.
Enters play exhausted.

flavor: It was hard to say what colour they were: grey with the hue of twilight under the trees they seemed to be; and yet if they were moved, or set in another light, they were green as shadowed leaves... <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Cloak of Lórien
text: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan character. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gets +1 [defense] (+2 [defense] instead if the active location has the Forest trait).

flavor: "The is Nenya, the Ring of Adamant, and I am its keeper." <cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Nenya
text: Attach to Galadriel. She gains a [lore] resource icon. Quest Action: Exhaust Nenya and Galadriel to add her [willpower] to another character's [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: The Ruins of Ost-in-Edhil
text:
Setup: Add Bellach, The Orcs’ Search, and The Secret Chamber to the staging area. Attach Celebrimbor’s Mould to The Secret Chamber. Each player adds a different Ost-in-Edhil location to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, trigger each Scour effect currently in play. Place 3 time counters on this stage.
Bellach is immune to player card effects and cannot be engaged.
The players cannot advance unless Celebrimbor’s Mould is attached to a hero.

name: The Enemy’s Servant
text:
When Revealed: Trigger each Scour effect currently in play. Bellach makes an attack against the player who controls Celebrimbor’s Mould. Then, attach Celebrimbor’s Mould to Bellach.

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, trigger each Scour effect currently in play. Place 3 time counters on this stage.
Unless there is at least 12 progress on this stage, Bellach is immune to player card effects and cannot be engaged.
The players cannot defeat this stage unless Celebrimbor’s Mould is attached to a hero. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Bellach
text:
X is the number of cards underneath The Orcs’ Search.
Scour: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Orc enemy and add it to the staging area.

name: The Orcs’ Search
text:
When a location has damage equal to its printed quest points, place it facedown under The Orcs’ Search.
Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, raise each player’s threat by 1 for each card underneath The Orcs’ Search.

name: The Secret Chamber
text:
X is the number of players in the game. Immune to player card effects.
Travel: Remove 3 progress from the current quest to travel here.
If The Secret Chamber is placed under The Orc’s Search, the players lose the game.

name: Celebrimbor’s Mould
text:
If Celebrimbor’s Mould is free of encounters, the first player claims it and attaches it to a hero he controls.
If the attached hero leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Bellach’s Scout
text:
When Revealed: Either deal 3 damage to the active location, or reveal an additional encounter card.
Scour: Place 1 damage on the active location.

name: Prowling Orc
text:
Forced: After Prowling Orc attacks, place 1 damage on the active location.
Scour: Prowling Orc engages the player with the highest threat and makes an immediate attack.

name: Ruined Plaza
text: Forced: After Ruined Plaza enters the staging area, place 1 damage here.

name: Collapsed Tower
text:
Surge.
Scour: Return this location to the staging area and place 2 damage here.

name: Ancient Foundation
text:
Scour: Assign X damage among locations in play. X is the number of locations in play. This ability does not stack with other copies of Ancient Foundation.
Travel: Place 1 damage on this location to travel here.

name: City Remains
text: Forced: After placing any amount of progress here, trigger the topmost Scour effect in the discard pile, if able.

name: Discovered!
text: When Revealed: Either trigger each Scour effect currently in play, or each player places a random card from his hand facedown underneath The Orcs’ Search.

name: Desecrated Ruins
text: When Revealed: Place 3 damage on the active location. If there is no active location, Desecrated Ruins gains surge.

name: Spies from Mordor
text: When Revealed: Each player must exhaust X characters he controls. X is the number of cards underneath The Orcs’ Search. If no characters are exhausted this way, Spies from Mordor gains surge.

flavor: Down from the hills leaped Erkenbrand, lord of Westfold. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Erkenbrand
text: Sentinel. While Erkenbrand is defending, he gains: "Response: Deal 1 damage to Erkenbrand to cancel a shadow effect just triggered."

flavor: They now learned to their joy that Erkenbrand had left many men to hold Helm's Gate, and more had since escaped thither. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Warden of Helm's Deep
text: Sentinel.

flavor:
Out of doubt, out of dark to the day's rising
I came singing in the sun, sword unsheathing.
<cite>Éomer, The Return of the King</cite>
name: The Day's Rising
text: Attach to a hero with sentinel. Response: After attached hero defends against an attack and takes no damage while defending that attack, exhaust The Day's Rising to add 1 resource to the attached hero's resource pool.

flavor: "Boromir it was that drove the enemy at last back from this western shore..." <cite>Beregond, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Captain of Gondor
text: Attach to a Warrior hero. Response: After you optionally engage an enemy, exhaust Captain of Gondor to give attached hero +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

flavor: "...a man that hacks once at an Ent never gets a chance of a second blow." <cite>Merry, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Booming Ent
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. Booming Ent gets +1 [attack] for each damaged Ent character you control.

flavor: Like thunder they broke upon the enemy... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Ride Them Down
text: Quest Action: Choose a non-unique enemy in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, progress that would be placed on the quest from questing successfully is instead assigned as damage to the chosen enemy. (Progress must still be placed on any active location first.)

flavor: At that moment he caught a flash of white and silver coming from the North, like a small star down on the dusky fields. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Shadows Give Way
text: You must use resources from 3 different heroes' pools to pay for this card. Action: Discard each shadow card from each enemy in play.

flavor: "Don't be hasty, that is my motto." <cite>Treebeard, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Don't Be Hasty!
text: Response: When an encounter card is revealed but before resolving any of that card's keywords or "when revealed" effects, choose a character committed to the quest. Ready that character and remove it from the quest.

flavor: For a moment Frodo stood near the brink and let the water flow over his tired feet. It was cold but its touch was clean, and as he went on and it mounted to his knees, he felt that the strain of travel and all weariness was washed from his limbs. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Waters of Nimrodel
text: Doomed 3. Action: Heal all damage on each character in play.

name: Treebeard
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Treebeard enters play exhausted and collects 1 resource each resource phase. These resources can be used to pay for Ent cards played from your hand. Action: Pay 2 resources from Treebeard's pool to ready an Ent character.

name: Battle for Dunland
text:
Setup: The first player takes control of Chief Turch. Set Raven Chief and Raven Chief’s Camp aside, out of play. Reveal 1 copy of Dunland Battlefield and make it the active location. Reveal 1 copy of Raven War-camp and add it to the staging area. Create the Raven deck (see insert) and set it next to the quest deck. Each player chooses 1 different enemy from the Raven deck and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck and the Raven deck.

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, remove 1 time counter from each location in play. Place 3 time counters on this stage.

name: The Raven Clan
text:
When Revealed: Shuffle the Raven deck discard pile into the Raven deck. Then, starting with the first player, each player takes the top card of the Raven deck and adds it to the staging area.

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, reveal the top card of the Raven deck and add it to the staging area. Place 3 time counters on this stage.
Each location in the staging area gets +2 quest points.

name: The Last Stage
text:
When Revealed: Add Raven Chief and Raven Chief’s Camp to the staging area. Take the top X cards from the Raven deck and add them to the staging area. X is the number of players minus 1.

Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, each engaged enemy makes an attack. Place 2 time counters on this stage.
At the end of the round, if Raven Chief is in the victory display, the players win the game.

name: Chief Turch
text:
The first player gains control of Chief Turch.
Immune to player card effects. Chief Turch does not exhaust to defend.
If Chief Turch leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Raven Chief
text:
Cannot have attachments. While Raven Chief’s Camp is in play, Raven Chief cannot be damaged.
Forced: When Raven Chief attacks, remove 1 time counter from the active location, if able.

name: Raven Chief’s Camp
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this location, exhaust each damaged character. Place 3 time counters on this location.

name: Raven Warrior
text: Forced: After Raven Warrior engages a player, remove X time counters from locations in play. X is the number of cards in the engaged player’s hand.

name: Raven Skirmisher
text: When Revealed: Either remove 1 time counter from the active location, or reveal an additional encounter card.

name: Raven War-camp
text: Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this location, starting with the first player, each player draws the top card of the Raven deck and puts it into play engaged with him.

name: Raven Village
text: Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this location, reveal the top card of the Raven deck and add it to the staging area.

name: Dunland Battlefield
text: Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this location, each player assigns X damage among characters he controls where X is the number of cards in his hand.

name: Raven Country
text: Time 4. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this location, each player raises his threat by the number of cards in his hand.

name: Raising the Cry
text: When Revealed: Remove 1 time counter from each location in play. Place X time counters on each location in play with no time counters on it. X is the “Time X” value on that location. If there are no locations in the staging area, Raising the Cry gains surge.

name: Fierce Folk
text:
Doomed 3.
When Revealed: Each player draws 3 cards. Until the end of the round, players cannot play events.

name: Driven Back
text: When Revealed: Remove all progress from each location in play. Increase the total [Threat] in the staging area by 1 for each progress removed this way. If no progress was removed by this effect, Driven Back gains surge.

flavor: "I serve no man," said Aragorn; "but the servants of Sauron I pursue into whatever land they may go." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Aragorn
text: Each enemy engaged with you gets -1 [defense]. Response: After Aragorn participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, choose an enemy not engaged with you and engage that enemy.

flavor: "Little do they know of our long labour for the safekeeping of their borders, and yet I grudge it not." <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Halbarad
text:
While you are engaged with any enemy, Halbarad does not exhaust to commit to a quest.
You may optionally engage 1 additional enemy during the encounter phase.

flavor: "Rangers use runes, and they come here sometimes." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Weather Hills Watchman
text: Response: After Weather Hills Watchman enters play, search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Signal card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Dúnedain Hunter
text: Forced: After Dúnedain Hunter enters play, search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a non-unique enemy and put it into play engaged with you. If no enemy enters play by this effect, discard Dúnedain Hunter. Shuffle the encounter deck.

flavor: "Lonely men are we, Rangers of the wild, hunters but hunters ever of the servants of the Enemy..." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Sarn Ford Sentry
text: Response: After Sarn Ford Sentry enters play, draw 1 card for each enemy engaged with you.

flavor: Rangers passed at times beyond the hills, but they were few and did not stay. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Warden of Annúminas
text: Warden of Annúminas gets +1 [willpower] for each enemy engaged with you.

flavor: "We rode as swiftly as we might when your summons came." <cite>Halbarad, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Ranger Summons
text: Play only if you control a Dúnedain hero. Planning Action: Shuffle 1 of your set aside Ranger of the North allies with the encounter keyword into the encounter deck. Then, remove Ranger Summons from the game.

flavor: "Many evil things there are that your strong walls and bright swords do not stay." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Tireless Hunters
text: Play only before the resolving enemy attacks step. Combat Action: Choose an enemy not engaged with you. Engage that enemy. Then, discard a shadow card from that enemy, if able.

flavor: "At last!" said Aragorn. "Here are the tracks that we seek!" <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Expert Trackers
text: Response: After you engage an enemy, exhaust a Scout or Ranger character to place X progress tokens on a location. X is the engaged enemy's printed [threat].

flavor: "But my home, such as I have, is in the North. For here the heirs of Valandil have ever dwelt in long line unbroken from father unto son for many generations." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Heir of Valandil
text: Attach to a Dúnedain hero. Planning Action: Exhaust Heir of Valandil to reduce the cost of the next Dúnedain ally you play this phase by 1 for each enemy engaged with you.

flavor: "...it is a healing plant that the Men of the West brought to Middle-earth. Athelas they named it..." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Athelas
text: Attach to a Dúnedain or Healer character. Action: Discard Athelas and exhaust attached character to heal all damage on a character. You may discard a Condition attachment from that character.

flavor: "If simple folk are free from care and fear, simple they will be, and we must be secret to keep them so." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Secret Vigil
text: Attach to an enemy. Limit 1 per enemy. Attached enemy gets -1 [threat]. Response: When attached enemy is destroyed, reduce each player's threat by the attached enemy's printed [threat].

flavor: ...each cloak was pinned upon the left shoulder by a brooch of silver shaped like a rayed star. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Star Brooch
text: Attach to a Dúnedain or Noldor hero. Limit 1 per hero. While you are engaged with an enemy, attached hero gets +1 [willpower] and cannot have its [willpower] reduced.

flavor: Aragorn halted and examined the tracks closely. <cite>The Tower Towers</cite>
name: Gather Information
text: Limit 1 per deck. Response: After this stage is defeated, each player may search his deck for 1 card and add it to his hand. Each player shuffles his deck.

name: Ranger of the North
text: Encounter. Surge. Ranged. Sentinel. When Revealed: The first player chooses a player to take control of Ranger of the North. Then, either deal 2 damage to an enemy or place 2 progress tokens on a location.

name: Iârion
text:
X is the number of quest stages in play.
The first player gains control of Iârion.
Response: After a side quest is revealed from the encounter deck, ready Iârion.
If Iârion leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Orc War Party
text:
Cannot have attachments.
While Orc War Party is in the staging area, enemies in the staging area cannot take damage.
The players cannot win the game while Orc War Party is in play.

name: Chetwood Forest
text: Travel: One player chooses and engages an enemy in the staging area.

name: Borders of Bree-land
text: While Borders of Bree-land is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, return 1 enemy engaged with a player to the staging area.”

name: Outlying Homestead
text:
Doomed 1.
While Outlying Homestead is in the staging area, players cannot reduce their threat.
Travel: Reveal a card from the encounter deck.

name: Sudden Assault
text: When Revealed: If the total [Willpower] of characters committed to the quest is greater than the total [Threat] in the staging area, each enemy in the staging area makes an immediate attack against the first player. If no attack is made this way, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Orc War Party and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Surprising Speed
text: When Revealed: Each player returns 1 enemy engaged with him to the staging area. If no enemy was returned to the staging area this way, Surprising Speed gains surge and doomed 1.

name: Orc Rearguard
text:
Some of the Orcs have broken from the war party to hinder your pursuit. Until you deal with them, it will be difficult to continue your chase...
No more than 3 progress tokens can be placed on the current quest each round.
While Orc Rearguard is the current quest it gains: “Forced: At the end of the staging step, reveal 1 encounter card.”

name: Rescue Iârion
text:
While scouting ahead, Iârion is ambushed by several Orcs. The Ranger is knocked unconscious and dragged away by the Orcs. You must rescue him!
Time 4. When Revealed: The first player loses control of Iârion and places him facedown underneath this stage. When this stage is defeated, the first player takes control of Iârion.
Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, discard Iârion.

name: Cornered Orc
text: Forced: After Cornered Orc engages a player, it makes an immediate attack.

name: Amon Forn
text:
Immune to player card effects.
While Amon Forn is the active location, it gains: “Forced: After an Orc enemy is added to the staging area, it makes an immediate attack against the first player.”
The players cannot win while Amon Forn is in play.

name: Weathered Hilltop
text:
Weathered Hilltop gets +1 [Threat] for each resource token on it.
Forced: After a Weather treachery is revealed from the encounter deck, place 1 resource token here.

name: Exposed Ridge
text: While Exposed Ridge is the active location it gains: “Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, each player deals 1 damage to a character he controls.”

name: Sheltered Valley
text:
While Sheltered Valley is the active location it gains: “Response: When Sheltered Valley is explored, heal all damage from 1 character.”
Travel: Remove 1 resource token from the Mission objective.

name: Concealed Orc-camp
text:
While Concealed Orc-camp is the active location it gains: “Response: When Concealed Orc-camp is explored, place 1 resource token on the Mission objective.”
Travel: The first player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an Orc enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Ice Storm
text: When Revealed: Each player assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is the number of quest stages in play. Then, exhaust each damaged character.

name: Thaurdir
text:
Indestructible. Cannot have attachments.
Forced: After a treachery card with the Sorcery trait is revealed from the encounter deck, Thaurdir heals 3 damage and makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Thaurdir’s Damned
text: Forced: After Thaurdir’s Damned engages you, discard the top 2 cards of your deck and assign X damage among characters you control. X is the combined printed cost of the discarded cards.

name: Baleful Shade
text: Forced: When Baleful Shade attacks, the defending player discards the top card of his deck. If the discarded card is an ally, Baleful Shade gets +2 [Attack] for this attack.

name: Broken Battlements
text:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from Broken Battlements, each player discards the top 5 cards of his deck and places 1 time counter here.
Travel: Each player discards the top card of his deck.

name: Norbury Tombs
text:
While Norbury Tombs is the active location, it gains: “Response: When Norbury Tomb is explored, each player shuffles the top 5 cards of his discard pile back into his deck.”
Travel: Return the topmost enemy in the discard pile to the staging area.

name: Fornost Square
text:
Fornost Square gets +1 [Threat] for each resource token on it.
Forced: After the first player discards any number of cards from the top of his deck, place 1 resource token here.

name: Haunted Keep
