While Troll Camp is in the staging area, Troll enemies get +1 [Threat] for each player in the game.
While Troll Camp is in play, Bilbo Baggins gains: "Action: Exhaust Bilbo Baggins and spend 1 [Baggins] resource to remove 1 sack card from a character. Bilbo Baggins may trigger this effect even with a Sack card attached to him."

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Troll Cave
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Players cannot travel to Troll Cave unless Bilbo Baggins has the Troll Key attached and the first player spends 5 [Baggins] resources. (2 [Baggins] resources instead if Bilbo Baggins has the Troll Purse attached.)
Victory 2.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Hobbit-lands
text: Response: After placing 1 or more progress tokens on Hobbit-lands, the first player draws 1 card.

name: Dreary Hills
text:
Forced: After placing 1 or more progress tokens on Dreary Hills, each player must discard 1 card at random from his hand.
Response: After Dreary Hills leaves play as an explored location, Bilbo Baggins gains 1 resource.

name: Lone-Lands
text:
Forced: After placing 1 or more progress tokens on Lone-Lands, each player removes 1 resource token from one of his hero's resource pools, if able.
Response: After Lone-Lands leaves play as an explored location, Bilbo Baggins gains 1 resource.

name: Cave Entrance
text: While Cave Entrance is in the staging area, it gains "Forced: At the end of the round, place the top X cards of the encounter discard pile on the bottom of the encounter deck. X is the number of players in the game."

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Troll Purse
text:
If Troll Purse is discarded, resolve its "When Revealed" effect, if able.
When Revealed: Attach to a Troll enemy.
Response: After attached Troll enemy is destroyed, the first player may spend 1 [Baggins] resource to claim this objective and attach it to Bilbo Baggins.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Troll Key
text:
If Troll Key is discarded, resolve its "When Revealed" effect if able.
When Revealed: Attach to a Troll enemy.
Response: After attached Troll enemy takes damage as the result of an attack, the first player may exhaust Bilbo Baggins to claim this objective and attach it to him.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Smelly Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to the ally (excluding Gandalf) with the highest printed cost without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend, commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Strong Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to the character (excluding Gandalf) with the highest printed [Attack] without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend, commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Tough Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to the character (excluding Gandalf) with the highest printed [Defense] without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend, commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Large Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to the character (excluding Gandalf) with the highest printed hit points without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend, commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Deep Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to the character (excluding Gandalf) with the highest printed [Willpower] without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend, commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Foul Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to the character (excluding Gandalf) with the most attachments without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Worn Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to hero with the most resources without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend, commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Lots or None at All
text: When Revealed: If there is a Troll enemy in the staging area, Sack 1. If there are no Troll enemies in the staging area, this card gains Doomed 2.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Nice Pickle
text:
Doomed 1.
When Revealed: Place the top X cards of the encounter discard pile on the bottom of the encounter deck. X is equal to twice the number of players in the game.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Roast 'Em or Boil 'Em?
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each ally. (2 damage instead if there is a Troll enemy in the staging area.)

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Hungry Troll
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses a Troll enemy in the staging area and engages that enemy. If there are no Troll enemies in the staging area, this card gains Surge.

name: No Campfire
text:
Doomed 1.
When Revealed: Each player must choose one: increase his threat by 4, or reveal an additional encounter card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.

name: Wind-Whipped Rain
text: When Revealed: Discard all non-treasure, non-objective attachments in play.

name: More Like A Grocer
text: When Revealed: Discard all [Baggins] resources.

name: Goblin Axeman
text: Goblin Axeman gets +1 [Attack] for each Cave location in play.

name: Goblin Miners
text: Goblin Miners gets +1 [Defense] for each Cave location in play.

name: Goblin Runners
text: Surge.

name: Goblin Driver
text: When Revealed: The first player exhausts 1 character he controls.

name: Stone-Giant
text:
While at least one Stone-Giant is in the staging area, the Galloping Boulders card gains surge.
Forced: After Stone-Giant engages a player, that player chooses and discards 1 ally he controls.

name: Goblin Bent-Swords
text: If The Great Goblin is in the victory display, this card gains surge.

name: The Great Goblin
text:
Forced: After The Great Goblin attacks, discard X cards from the encounter deck where X is the number of players in the game. Add each Goblin enemy discarded by this effect to the staging area.

Victory 3.

name: The Goblins' Caves
text: While The Goblins' Caves is the active location, Goblin enemies get +1 [Threat].

name: Front Porch
text:
While Front Porch is the active location, players cannot attack Goblin enemies.
Action: The first player may spend 2 [Baggins] resources to treat Front Porch's printed text box as if it were blank until the end of the round.

name: Great Cavern Room
text:
While Great Cavern Room is the active location, it gains: "Forced: After a player engages a Goblin enemy, he must deal 1 damage to a character he controls."
Forced: When faced with the option to travel, if The Great Goblin is in the victory display the players must travel to Great Cavern Room if able.

name: Overhanging Rock
text: While Overhanging Rock is the active location, it gains: "Action: spend 1 [Baggins] resource to look at the top 2 cards of your deck. Add 1 of those to your hand and discard the other."

name: The High Pass
text:
X is the number of players in the game.
Forced: At the end of the round, remove X progress tokens from the current quest.

name: Grip, Grab! Pinch, Nab!
text: When Revealed: Starting with the first player, each player must choose 1 Goblin enemy from the discard pile and add it to the staging area.

name: Chaos in the Cavern
text: When Revealed: All engaged enemies return to the staging area. Then, each Goblin enemy gets +1 [Threat] until the end of the phase.

name: Galloping Boulders
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses a questing character. That character takes 3 damage and is removed from the quest.

name: Guffawing of Giants
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses 1 Stone-giant in the staging area. At the end of the quest phase, that Stone-giant engages the player with the highest threat. If there are no Stone-giant cards in the staging area, search the encounter deck for 1 Stone-giant and add it to the staging area.

name: Gollum
text: Forced: After the first player answers a riddle and fails to find at least 1 match, Gollum attacks Bilbo Baggins. (Do not deal a shadow card for this attack.)

name: Great Gray Wolf
text:
Forced: If Great Grey wolf is dealt a shadow card with a riddle, return all Creature enemies to the staging area at the end of the combat phase.

Riddle: The first player names a card type, sphere and cost, shuffles his deck, then discards the top 3 cards. For each of those cards that matches all three items, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

name: Wild Wargs
text:
Forced: If Wild Wargs is dealt a shadow card with a riddle, it gets +2 [Attack].
Riddle: The first player names a card type, shuffles his deck, and discards the top 2 cards. For each of those cards that matches, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

name: The Wargs' Glade
text:
Forced: After a character takes damage from an attack made by a Creature enemy, remove 1 progress token from the current quest.
Riddle: The first player names a sphere, shuffles his deck, and discards the top card. For each of those cards that matches, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

name: Lake in the Cavern
text:
X is twice the number of players in the game.
Players cannot travel here.
Immune to player card effects.
Forced: After players advance to stage 3, remove Lake in the Cavern from the game.

name: Bilbo's Magic Ring
text:
Attach to Bilbo Baggins.
Action: When answering a riddle, spend 1 [Baggins] resource to discard an additional player card from the top of your deck.
Action: Exhaust Bilbo's Magic Ring and raise each player's threat by 2 to add 1 [Baggins] resource to Bilbo Baggins' resource pool.

name: Come Down Little Bird
text:
When Revealed: Starting with the first player, each player must search the encounter deck and encounter discard pile for 1 Creature enemy and put it into play engaged with him. Then, shuffle the encounter deck.
Riddle: The first player names a card type and cost, shuffles his deck, then discards the top 3 cards. For each of those cards that matches both items, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

name: It Likes Riddles
text:
When Revealed: The first player must choose to answer the riddle on this card. If he finds at least 1 match, discard cards from the encounter deck until another card with a riddle is discarded. Then, answer that riddle.
Riddle: The first player names a cost, shuffles his deck, then discards the top 2 cards. For each of those cards that matches, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

name: Hiding In The Trees
text:
When Revealed: Characters get -1 [Willpower] and cannot attack until the end of the round.
Riddle: The first player names a card type and sphere, shuffles his deck, then discards the top 3 cards. For each of those cards that matches both items, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

name: What's In My Pocket
text:
When Revealed: The first player must choose to answer the riddle on this card. This effect cannot be canceled.
Riddle: The first player names a sphere and cost, shuffles his deck, then discards the top 2 cards. For each of those cards that matches both items, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

name: Not Fair! Not Fair!
text: When Revealed: The first player names a card type and then discards the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. For each of those cards that does not match the named type, remove 1 progress token from stage 2. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Bilbo Baggins
text: The first player gains control of Bilbo Baggins. Bilbo Baggins cannot gain resources from player card effects. If Bilbo Baggins leaves play, the players lose the game.

flavor: "I am Thorin son of Thrain son of Thror, King under the Mountain!" <cite>Thorin, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Thorin Oakenshield
text: If you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, add 1 additional resource to Thorin Oakenshield's pool when you collect resources during the resource phase.

flavor: "Nori, at your service." <cite>Nori, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Nori
text: Response: After you play a Dwarf character from your hand, reduce your threat by 1.

flavor: "He could write well and speedily, and often used the Elvish characters." <cite>Gimli, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Ori
text: If you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, draw 1 additional card at the beginning of the resource phase.

flavor:
The roar of his voice was like drums and guns; and he tossed wolves and goblins from his path like straws and feathers.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Beorn
text:
Sentinel. Cannot have attachments.
Immune to player card effects.
Beorn does not exhaust to defend.

name: Fili
text: Response: After you play Fili from your hand during the planning phase, search your deck for Kili and put him into play under your control. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Kili
text: Response: After you play Kili from your hand during the planning phase, search your deck for Fili and put him into play under your control. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Bofur
text: Action: Exhaust Bofur to search the top 5 cards of your deck for 1 Weapon attachment. Add that card to your hand and shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Dori
text: Response: After a hero is assigned any amount of damage, exhaust Dori to place that damage on Dori instead.

name: Gandalf
text: Gandalf does not exhaust to commit to a quest. Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, discard Gandalf from play. You may raise your threat by 2 to cancel this effect.

name: Cram
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Cram to ready attached hero.

flavor: "You will have to manage without pocket-handkerchiefs, and a good many other things, before you get to the journey's end. As for a hat, I have got a spare hood and cloak in my luggage." <cite>Dwalin, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Spare Hood and Cloak
text: Attach to a character. Action: Exhaust Spare Hood and Cloak and exhaust attached character to ready another character. Then, attach Spare Hood and Cloak to that character.

flavor: "This was made by Thror, your grandfather, Thorin." he said in answer to the dwarves' excited questions. "It is a plan of the Mountain." <cite>Gandalf, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Thror's Map
text: Attach to a hero. Travel Action: Exhaust Thror's Map to choose a location in the staging area. Make that location the active location. (If there is another active location, return it to the staging area.)

name: A Very Good Tale
text: Action: Exhaust 2 allies you control to shuffle your deck and discard the top 5 cards. Put up to 2 allies discarded by this effect into play under your control. The total cost of the allies put into play cannot exceed the total cost of the allies exhausted to pay for this effect.

name: Foe-hammer
text: Response: After a hero you control attacks and destroys an enemy, exhaust a Weapon card attached to that hero to draw 3 cards.

flavor: At this point Gandalf fell behind, and Thorin with him. They turned a sharp corner. "About turn!" he shouted. "Draw your sword, Thorin!" <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Goblin-cleaver
text: Combat Action: Exhaust a Weapon card attached to a hero you control to choose an enemy engaged with you. Deal 2 damage to that enemy. (Deal 3 damage instead if the enemy is an Orc.)

flavor: To the end of his days Bilbo could never remember how he found himself outside, without a hat, walking-stick or any money, or anything that he usually took when he went out. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Late Adventurer
text: Quest Action: Exhaust a character you control that is not committed to the quest to commit that character to the quest.

name: Expecting Mischief
text: Play during the quest phase, before the staging step. Action: Deal 2 damage to the first enemy revealed from the encounter deck this phase.

name: Burglar Baggins
text: Action: Bilbo Baggins gets +2 [willpower] +2 [attack] and +2 [defense] until the end of the phase. (You may spend a [baggins] resource from Bilbo Baggins' resource pool to play this card even if you do not control Bilbo Baggins.)

flavor: "I shall call you Sting." <cite>Bilbo, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Sting
text: Restricted. Attach to Bilbo Baggins. Bilbo Baggins gets +1 [willpower] +1 [attack] and +1 [defense]. Response: After Bilbo Baggins exhausts to defend, discard the top card of the encounter deck. Deal damage to the attacking enemy equal to the discarded card's [threat].

flavor: "This, Thorin, the runes name Orcrist, the Goblin-cleaver in the ancient tongue of Gondolin; it was a famous blade." <cite>Elrond, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Orcrist
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached character gets +2 [attack]. Response: After attached hero destroys an Orc enemy, add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

name: Glamdring
text: Attach to a hero or Gandalf. Restricted. Attached character gets +2 [attack]. Response: After attached character destroys an Orc enemy, draw 1 card.

name: Bilbo Baggins
text: Bilbo Baggins does not count against the hero limit and cannot gain resources from non-treasure cards. The first player gains control of Bilbo Baggins. Action: Spend 1 [baggins] resource to search your deck for a treasure card and add it to your hand. If Bilbo Baggins leaves play, the players have lost the game.

flavor: "Well, it is the first time that even a mouse has crept along carefully and quietly under my very nose and not been spotted." <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Balin
text: Response: Pay 1 resource from Balin's resource pool to cancel a shadow effect just triggered during an attack. Then, deal the attacking enemy another shadow card. (Limit once per attack.)

flavor: Now he shot with a great yew bow, till all his arrows but one were spent. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Bard the Bowman
text:
Ranged.
When Bard the Bowman makes a ranged attack, the enemy he attacks gets -2 [defense] until the end of the phase.

flavor: Dwarves can make fire almost anywhere out of almost anything, wind or no wind... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Óin
text: While you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, Óin gets +1 [attack] and gains the [tactics] resource icon.

flavor: "Bombur is fattest and will do for two, he had better come alone and last." <cite>Gandalf, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Bombur
text: When counting the number of Dwarf characters you control, Bombur counts as two.

flavor: Glóin lit several more torches, and then they all crept out, one by one... <cite> The Hobbit </cite>
name: Glóin
text: While you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, Glóin gains: "Response: After you play Glóin from your hand, choose a hero. Add 2 resources to that hero's resource pool."

flavor: "My cousins! Bombur and Bofur <cite> we have forgotten them, they are down in the valley!" –The Hobbit</cite>
name: Bifur
text: While you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, Bifur gains: "Response: After you play Bifur from your hand, draw 2 cards."

name: Dwalin
text: Sentinel. While you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, lower the cost to play Dwalin by 2.

flavor: In it smote and vanished, barb, shaft and feather, so fierce was its flight. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Straight Shot
text: Action: Exhaust a Weapon attachment to choose a non-unique enemy with 0 [defense]. Discard the chosen enemy.

flavor: "Come!" called Gandalf. "There is yet time for council." <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Desperate Alliance
text: Action: Choose a hero you control. Until the end of the phase, give control of that hero and all resources in that hero's resource pool to another player. (Limit 1 per phase.)

flavor: As they worked the ravens brought them constant tidings. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Ravens of the Mountain
text: Action: Exhaust a hero you control to shuffle the encounter deck and look at its top card. Place progress tokens on the current quest equal to the revealed card's [threat]. Then, put that card back on top of the encounter deck.

flavor: Out leapt the King under the Mountain, and his companions followed him. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: To me! O my kinsfolk!
text: Action: If you control at least 1 Dwarf hero, put a Dwarf ally from your discard pile into play under your control. Put that ally on the bottom of your deck at the end of the phase.

flavor:
"I am the clue-finder, the web-cutter, the stinging fly. I was chosen for the lucky number."
<cite>Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit</cite>
name: The Lucky Number
text: Action: Choose a character in play (other than Bilbo Baggins). Add Bilbo Baggins' total [willpower], [attack], and [defense] to that character's [willpower], [attack], and [defense] respectively until the end of the phase.

name: Great Yew Bow
text: Attach to a hero with the printed Ranged keyword. Restricted. Combat Action: Choose an enemy in the staging area. Exhaust Great Yew Bow and attached hero to make a ranged attack against that enemy. Declare attached hero as the attacker. No other attackers can be declared for this attack.

flavor: "I have saved you to the last..." <cite>Bard, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Black Arrow
text: Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a hero with Ranged. Response: After attached hero declares an attack, add Black Arrow to the victory display to give attached hero +5 [attack] for this attack.

flavor: "The key that went with the map! Try it now while there is still time!" <cite>Bilbo, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Thrór's Key
text: Attach to a hero. Response: After a location is added to the staging area, attach Thrór's Key to that location. While attached to a location, Thrór's Key gains: "Treat attached location's printed text box as blank, except for traits."

name: Expert Treasure-hunter
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. Response: After attached hero quests successfully, name a card type and discard the top card of your deck. If the discarded card is the named type, take it into your hand.

flavor: "Long ago in my grandfather Thror's time our family was driven out of the far North, and came back with all their wealth and tools to this Mountain on the map." <cite>Thorin, The Hobbit</cite>
name: King Under the Mountain
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Action: Exhaust King Under the Mountain to look at the top 2 cards of your deck. Add 1 to your hand and discard the other.

name: Bilbo's Magic Ring
text: Attach to Bilbo Baggins. Action: Exhaust Bilbo's Magic Ring and raise your threat by 1 to gain 1 [baggins] resource. (Limit once per round.) Response: After Bilbo Baggins exhausts to defend an attack, exhaust Bilbo's Magic Ring and raise your threat by 3 to cancel all damage from this attack.

flavor: "...the Heart of the Mountain; and it is also the heart of Thorin. He values it above a rive of gold." <cite>Bilbo, The Hobbit</cite>
name: The Arkenstone
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust The Arkenstone and raise your threat by X to lower by X the cost of the next ally you play this phase that matches the attached hero's sphere.

flavor: "Mr. Baggins!" he cried. "Here is the first payment of your reward! Cast off your old coat and put on this!" <cite>Thorin, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Mithril Shirt
text:
Attach to Bilbo Baggins.
Attached hero gets +1 [defense] and +1 hit point.

flavor: Royal indeed did Thorin look, clad in a coat of gold-plated rings, with a silver hafted axe... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Thrór's Battle Axe
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +2 [attack]. Response: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, deal 1 damage to another enemy engaged with you.

flavor: Thorin seized a bow of horn and shot an arrow at the speaker. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Thrór's Hunting Bow
text:
Attach to a hero. Restricted.
Attached hero gains Ranged.
When making a ranged attack, attached hero gets +2 [attack].

flavor: ...the great golden cup of Thror, two-handed, hammered and carven with birds and flowers whose eyes and petals were of jewels... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Thrór's Golden Cup
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Add Thror's Golden Cup to the victory display to draw 3 cards.

name: The Spider's Glade
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Travel: Exhaust Bilbo Baggins to travel here.
Forced: At the start of each quest phase, search the encounter deck for 1 Spider enemy and add it to the staging area. (2 Spider enemies instead if 3 or more players are at this stage.) Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Giant Web
text:
While Giant Web is the active location, each character gets -1 [Willpower], -1 [Attack], and -1 [Defense] for each poison it has.
Response: After Giant Web leaves play as an explored location, ready an unconscious character.

name: Forest Stream
text:
While Forest Stream is the active location, poisoned characters cannot quest.
Response: After Forest Stream leaves play as an explored location, discard 4 poison.

name: Old Tomnoddy
text:
Venom.
Forced: At the end of each round, each player must give a hero he controls 1 poison.

name: Crazy Cob
text:
Venom.
When Revealed: This enemy attacks the character with the most poison attached.

name: Lazy Lob
text:
Venom.
When Revealed: Each character committed to the quest gets 1 poison.

name: Fat Spider
text:
Venom.
This enemy gets +3 [Attack] while engaged with a player who controls at least 1 poisoned character.

name: Wicked Spider
text:
Venom.
Forced: When this enemy attacks, defending player must attack 1 poison to a character he controls.

name: Caught in Webs
text: When Revealed: Choose a hero to be removed from the quest and make that hero unconscious. If no hero was removed from the quest by this effect, this card gains surge.

name: Poisoned by Spiders
text: When Revealed: Each character takes damage equal to the number of poison it has. If no characters were damaged by this effect, this card gains surge.

name: Hidden Path
text:
While Hidden Path is the active location, locations in the staging area get -1 [Threat].
Travel: Spend 2 [Baggins] resources to travel here.

name: Dark Bats
text: Forced: After Dark Bats damages a character, attach it to that character. (While attached, counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Attached character gets -1 [Willpower], -1 [Attack], and -1 [Defense].")

name: Fighting Among Friends
text: When Revealed: The first player names a sphere. Then, all non-[Baggins] characters who do not belong to the named sphere are removed from the quest.

name: Weighed Down
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, exhausted characters get -1 [Willpower], -1 [Attack], and -1 [Defense]

name: A Bare Patch
text:
While attached, Smaug the Magnificent gets -3 [Defense].
Response: After the players quest successfully, the first player makes a burgle attempt. If successful, attach A Bare Patch to Smaug the Magnificent.

name: Smaug the Golden
text:
Indestructible. Immune to player card effects. Cannot be engaged.
X is the number of non-Burglar characters committed to the quest.
Forced: After the 6th progress token is placed here, the players advance to stage 4A.

name: Smaug the Magnificent
text:
Indestructible. Immune to player card effects.
Cannot leave the staging area (except by quest effect) but is considered to be engaged with the first player.
Forced: If Smaug the Magnificent is dealt a shadow card with a burgle effect, he makes an additional attack immediately after this one.

name: Croaking Crows
text:
Surge.
Forced: When a location is revealed from the encounter deck, put 1 progress on Smaug the Golden.
Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 1 card from his hand that matches the revealed card's sphere and type.

name: The Lonely Mountain
text:
While at least 1 card is stacked underneath, The Lonely Mountain is immune to player card effects, cannot leave the staging area, and gets -2 [Threat] for each card stacked under it.
Action: While making a burgle attempt, the first player may spend 2 [Baggins] resources to take the revealed card into hand and reveal the next card of his deck.
Victory 10.

name: Great Hall
text:
While Great Hall is the active location, it gains: "Forced: Put 1 progress token on Smaug the Golden at the end of each round."
Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 3 cards from his hand that match the revealed card's type.

name: Secret Entrance
text:
While Secret Entrance is the active location, The Lonely Mountain's [Threat] is reduced by half (round up).
Travel: The first player must exhaust a hero and name a card type to travel here. Then, reveal the top card of the encounter deck. If the revealed card is not the named type, return Secret Entrance to the staging area. (The players cannot travel again this round.)

name: Desolation of Smaug
text:
While Desolation of Smaug is the active location, the first treachery card revealed each round gains surge.
Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 2 cards from his hand that match the revealed card's cost.

name: Western Slopes
text:
Response: When Western Slopes leaves play as an explored location (choose one): the first player draws 2 cards, or remove 1 progress token from Smaug the Golden.

Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 2 cards from his hand that match the revealed card's sphere.

name: Pretending to Sleep
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Put 1 progress token on Smaug the Golden. Then, spend X [Baggins] resources or advance to stage 4A. X is the number of progress tokens on Smaug the Golden.
Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 2 cards from his hand that match the revealed card's type.

name: Known to an Ounce
text:
When Revealed: Each player discards 2 random cards from hand. Until the end of the phase, each Dragon enemy in play gets +1 [Threat] for each event discarded by this effect.
Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 1 card from his hand that matches the revealed card's sphere and cost.

name: Belching Fire
text:
When Revealed: Each Dragon enemy in the staging area makes an immediate attack against the player with the highest total [Willpower] committed to the quest. (Do not deal a shadow card for this attack.)

Burgle: The first player shuffles his deck and reveals the top card. He may discard 1 card from his hand that matches the revealed card's type and cost.

name: Dragon-Spell
text:
When Revealed: Attach to the hero with the most resources without Dragon-Spell attached. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text:
"Attached hero gets -1 [Willpower] for each resource in its resource pool.
Forced: When attached hero spends resources, attached hero takes X damage. X is equal to the number of resources spent")

name: Misty Mountain Eagle
text: Action: The first player may spend 2 [Baggins] resources to (choose one): take control of Misty Mountain Eagle, or discard this ally to discard a non-unique enemy in the staging area.

name: Bolg
text:
X is the number of players in the game.
Immune to player card effects.
Cannot leave the staging area.
The first Goblin revealed each round gains surge.

name: Bodyguard of Bolg
text:
Bolg cannot take damage.
Forced: When this enemy attacks, deal it an additional shadow card for each quest stage in play with no progress tokens on it.

name: Gundabad Wolf Rider
text: Forced: When this enemy attacks, remove 1 progress from the current quest.

name: Gundabad Climber
text: When Revealed: Remove 1 progress from every quest stage in play. (2 progress instead if 3 or more players in the game.)

name: Vanguard of Bolg
text: This enemy gets +1 [Threat], +1 [Attack], and +1 [Defense] for each quest stage in play with no progress on it.

name: Gundabad Archer
text: When Revealed: Each player must deal 2 damage to a character he controls.

name: Ravenous Warg
text: Forced: When Ravenous Wargs attacks, the defending player must declare the character he controls with the most damage as the defender. (Even if exhausted.)

name: Northern Slopes
text:
While Northern Slopes is in the staging area, each Goblin enemy gets +1 [Attack] and +1 [Defense].

While Northern Slopes is the active location, it gains "Forced: When a character leaves play, remove 1 progress from the current quest, if able."

name: Ruins of Dale
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Forced: Remove 2 progress from stage 3B at the end of each round, if able.
Travel: Spend 3 [Baggins] resources to travel here. (1 [Baggins] instead if stage 3B is the current quest.)
Victory 3.

name: Ravenhill
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Forced: Remove 2 progress from stage 4B at the end of each round, if able.
Travel: Spend 3 [Baggins] resources to travel here. (1 [Baggins] instead if stage 4B is the current quest.)
Victory 3.

name: The Front Gate
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Forced: Remove 2 progress from stage 2B at the end of each round, if able.
Travel: Spend 3 [Baggins] resources to travel here. (1 [Baggins] instead if stage 2B is the current quest.)
Victory 3.

name: Hatred Rekindled
text: When Revealed: Each enemy engaged with a player makes an immediate attack. Do not deal shadow cards for attacks made by this effect. If no attacks were made by this effect, this card gains surge.

name: Goblins are Upon You!
text: When Revealed: Each player must serarch the encounter deck and discard pile for a Goblin enemy and put it into play, engaged with him. Then, shuffle the encounter deck. (This effect cannot be canceled.)

name: Heedless of Order
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Choose a different quest to be the current quest until the end of the round, if able. If the current quest did not change as a result of this effect, this card gains Doomed 3.

name: Into Mirkwood
text:
Setup: Each player may shuffle 1 copy Bilbo's Magic Ring into his deck. Search the encounter deck for The Spider's Glade and set it aside, out of play. Then, shuffle the encounter deck and reveal 1 encounter card per player.
Unconscious characters cannot quest, attack, defend, collect resources, trigger abilities, be poisoned, or ready (except by effects that target unconscious characters).

name: Lost in the Dark
text: When Revealed: Reveal stage 3 and create a separate staging area for the first player using that stage. Then, all other players advance to stage 4.

name: Captured by Spiders
text:
When Revealed: Remove all resources from each hero's resource pool. Then, make each character you control (except Bilbo Baggins) unconscious.

Unconscious characters cannot quest, attack, defend, collect resources, trigger abilities, be poisoned, or ready (except by effects that target unconscious characters).
Do not pass the first player token. When this stage is complete, do not advance to stage 4 until the end of the quest phase. (Combine staging areas if necessary.)
Action: Spend 2 [Baggins] resources to ready an unconscious character you control.

name: Battle with the Spiders
text:
When Revealed: Add The Spider's Glade to the Staging area.
Unconscious characters cannot quest, attack, defend, collect resources, trigger abilities, be poisoned, or ready (except by effects that target unconscious characters).
Progress cannot be placed on this stage while The Spider's Glade is in play
Action: Spend 2 [Baggins] resources to ready an unconscious character you control.

If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game and discovered the treasure card Bilbo's Magic Ring.

name: A Warm Welcome
text:
Setup: Search the encounter deck for Smaug the Golden, Smaug the Magnificent, The Lonely Mountain, and A Bare Patch. Set Smaug the Magnificent and A Bare Patch aside, out of play. Add Smaug the Golden and The Lonely Mountain to the staging area. Shuggle the five Erebor treasure cards and stack them facedown under The Lonely Mountain.
Skip the Quest pahse.
Forced: At the end of round, advance to stage 2.

name: The Burglar's Turn
text:
Forced: After questing successfully, place 1 progress on Smaug the Golden. Then, the first player makes a burgle attempt. If successful, the first player takes the top treasure card from under The Lonely Mountain into his hand. Then, the players may advance to stage 3.
Forced: After the first player makes an unsuccessful burgle attempt. Smaug the Golden attacks the first player.

name: Inside Information
text:
When Revealed: Set Smaug the Golden aside, out of play. Add Smaug the Magnificent and A Bare Patch to the staging area.
Players cannot defeat this stage while Smaug the Magnificent is in play.
Forced: If the total number of progress on this stage is greater than the total remaining hit points on Smaug the Magnificent, remove Smaug the Magnificent from play.
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game and discovered any treasure successfully burgled from The Lonely Mountain.

name: Thieves! Fire! Murder!
text:
When Revealed: Remove all progress from Smaug the Golden and set him aside, out of play. Then, add Smaug the Magnificent to the staging area.

Forced: After placing the 7th progress token on this stage, remove all damage from Smaug the Magnificent and set him aside, out of play. Then, add Smaug the Golden to the staging area and reset the quest deck to stage 2B

name: The Gathering of the Clouds
text:
Setup: Search the encounter deck for Bolg and add it to the staging area. Then, shuffle the encounter deck and reveal 1 encounter card per player.

When Revealed: Put stage 2, stage 3, and stage 4 into play at the same time. Then, remove this stage from play.

name: The Eastern Spur
text:
Players cannot advance from this stage unless stage 3 and stage 4 are complete.
Forced: If there is no progress on this stage at the end of the round, each player must discard 1 random card from his hand.

name: Battle in the Dale
text:
Players cannot advance from this stage unless stage 2 and stage 4 are complete.
Battle. (Characters use [Attack] instead of [Willpower] when questing here.)
Forced: If there is no progress on this stage at the end of the round, the first player adds the topmost enemy in the discard pile to the staging area, if able.

name: The Defense of Ravenhill
text:
Players cannot advance from this stage unless stage 2 and stage 3 are complete.
Siege (Characters use [Defense] instead of [Willpower] when questing here.)
Forced: If there is no progress on this stage at the end of the round, each player must discard all resources from each hero's resource pool.

name: The Clouds Burst
text:
When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Bodyguard of Bolg and add it to the staging area, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Progress cannot be placed on this stage. While Bolg is in the staging area, it is considered to be engaged with the first player.
If Bolg is destroyed, the players win the game.

flavor: "I will take the Ring," he said, "though I do not know the way." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Frodo Baggins
text: Response: Spend 1 [fellowship] resource and exhaust The One Ring to cancel the effect of an encounter card just revealed from the encounter deck. Shuffle that card back into the encounter deck and reveal another encounter card.

flavor: "I'm going with him...and if any of those Black Riders try to stop him, they'll have Sam Gamgee to reckon with" <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Sam Gamgee
text: Response: After you engage an enemy with a higher engagement cost than your threat, ready Sam Gamgee. He gets +1 [willpower] +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

flavor: "You can trust us to stick to you through thick and thin to the bitter end" <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Merry
text: Merry gets +1 [attack] for each Hobbit hero you control. Response: After Merry participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, ready another character that participated in that attack.

flavor:
"We Hobbits ought to stick together, and we will"
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Pippin
text: Each enemy in play gets +1 engagement cost for each Hobbit hero you control. Response: After you engage an enemy with an engagement cost higher than your threat, draw a card.

flavor: "I only hope that you do not need rescuing before the day is out" <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Fatty Bolger
text: Action: Exhaust Fatty Bolger to choose an enemy in the staging area and raise your threat by that enemy's [threat]. Until the end of the phase, that enemy does not contribute its [threat]. (Limit once per round.)

flavor: "He gave me a look as plain as Mr. Pippin could speak it: if you don't let me go with you, Sam, I'll follow on my own" <cite>Sam Gamgee, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Bill the Pony
text: Cannot have attachments. Lower the cost to play Bill the Pony by 2 if you control Sam Gamgee. Each Hobbit character gets +1 hit point.

flavor: "But spooks or no spooks, they won't get in The Prancing Pony so easy." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Barliman Butterbur
text: If each hero you control has the Hobbit trait, damage from undefended attacks against you may be assigned to Barliman Butterbur.

flavor: "It is lucky for you that I know you. I was going out to set my dogs on any strangers." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Farmer Maggot
text: Response: After Farmer Maggot enters play, deal 1 damage to an enemy engaged with you. (Deal 2 damage instead if that enemy's engagement cost is higher than your threat.)

flavor: "I have something to do before the end, and it lies ahead, not in the Shire. I must see it through, sir, if you understand me." <cite>Sam Gamgee, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Halfling Determination
text: Action: Choose a Hobbit character. That character gets +2 [willpower], +2 [attack], and +2 [defense] until the end of the phase.

flavor: ...he smoked and blew smoke-rings with the same vigour and delight...<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Smoke Rings
text: Action: Reduce your threat by 1 for each Pipe you control. Each hero with a Pipe attachment gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

flavor: ...they made no noise that even hobbits would hear. Event the wild things in the fields and woods hardly noticed their passing. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Take No Notice
text: Lower the cost play Take No Notice by 1 for each Hobbit or Ranger hero you control. Action: Add 5 to each enemy's engagement cost until the end of the round.

flavor: "I wonder if that is Gandalf coming after us" said Frodo, but even as he said it, he had a feeling that it was not so... <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Frodo's Intuition
text: Action: Each hero you control gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round. Draw 1 card for each Hobbit hero you control.

flavor: In their dark cloaks they were invisible as if they all had magic rings. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Hobbit Cloak
text: Attach to a Hobbit hero. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gets +2 [defense] while defending against an attack by an enemy with an engagement cost higher than your threat.

flavor:
...these blades were forged many long years ago by Men of Westernesse: they were foes of the Dark Lord...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Dagger of Westernesse
text:
Restricted.
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if attacking an enemy with an engagement cost higher than your threat).

flavor: But even the Dúnedain of Gondor allow us this credit: Hobbits first put it into pipes. Not even the Wizards first thought of that before we did. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Hobbit Pipe
text: Attach to a Hobbit character. Limit 1 per character. Response: After your threat is reduced by an event card effect, exhaust Hobbit Pipe to draw a card.

flavor:
"It is a beryl, an elf-stone. Whether it was set there, or let fall by chance, I cannot say, but it brings hope to me"
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Elf-stone
text: Attach to the active location. Attached location gets +1 quest point. Response: After attached location leaves play as an explored location, the first player puts 1 ally into play from his hand.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Mr. Underhill
text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to the Ring-bearer.
Action: Add Mr. Underhill to the victory display to choose an enemy engaged with you. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot attack you.

Victory 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Tireless Ranger
text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gets +1 [Defense] and gains the Ranger trait.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Skilled Healer
text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gets +2 hit points and gains the Healer trait.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Valiant Warrior
text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gets +1 [Attack] and gains the Warrior trait.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Noble Hero
text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gets +1 [Willpower] and gains the Noble trait.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Three is Company
text:
Setup: Set Bucklebury Ferry aside, out of play. Add 1 Black Rider to the staging area and make Bag End the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck.
When a player fails a Hide test, each Nazgul enemy in the staging area engages that player. (Trigger Forced effects after resolving this effect.)
The players cannot advance unless Bag End is in the victory display.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: A Shortcut to Mushrooms
text:
When Revealed: The first player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Black Rider, reveals it (cannot be canceled), and adds it to the staging area.
Shuffle the encounter deck.
When a player makes a Hide test, add 1 to the total [Threat] for each ally that player controls.
When a player fails a Hide test, each Nazgûl enemy in the staging area engages
that player. (Trigger Forced effects after resolving this effect.)

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Escape to Buckland
text:
When Revealed: Add Bucklebury Ferry to the staging area.

When Revealed: The first player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Black Rider, reveals it (cannot be canceled), and adds it to the staging area.
Shuffle the encounter deck.
When a player fails a Hide test, each Nazgûl enemy in the staging area engages that player. (Trigger Forced effects after resolving this effect.)
Response: After a player makes a successful Hide test, place X progress on a non-unique location in play. X is twice the number of players in the game.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Trouble in Bree
text:
Setup: Set all copies of Ringwraith, The Witch-king, Midgewater, and Weathertop aside, out of play. Add The Prancing Pony and Bill Ferny to the staging area.
Shuffle the encounter deck.

The players cannot advance while The Prancing Pony is in play.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Into the Wild
text:
When Revealed: Add Midgewater to the staging area. Each player places 1 progress on the current quest.
Forced: At the end of the round, either remove X progress from the current quest or shuffle 1 out of play Ringwraith into the encounter deck. X is the number of players in the game.
The players cannot advance while Midgewater is in play.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Ringwraiths Attack
text:
When Revealed: Add Weathertop and The Witch-king to the staging area. Search the encounter deck and discard pile and add each Nazgûl enemy found to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

If there are no Nazgûl enemies in play, the players win the game.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Pursued by the Enemy
text:
Setup: Shuffle each burden card from the Flight to the Ford burden set into a Burden deck. Attach An Evil Wound to the Ring-bearer. Set Ford of Bruinen and The Witch-king aside, out of play. Add The Last Bridge and 1 Fell Rider per player to the staging area. Set the Ring-bearer’s life at 15. Shuffle the encounter deck.

The players cannot advance unless The Last Bridge is in the victory display.
Forced: At the end of the round, reduce the Ring-bearer’s life by 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Race to Rivendell
text:
When Revealed: Add Ford of Bruinen and The Witch-king to the staging area.
While at least 1 Nazgûlenemy is in play, Race to Rivendell gets +15 quest points.
Forced: At the end of the round, reduce the Ring-bearer’s life by 1.
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: A Shadow of the Past
text:
You are playing Campaign Mode.
Setup: Attach Mr. Underhill to the Ring-bearer. Add Gandalf's Delay to the staging area. Shuffle Gildor Inglorion and The Ring Draws Them into the encounter deck.

Resolution: Choose Gandalf's Delay or The Ring Draws Them and add it to the Campaign Pool. Then, choose Gildor Inglorion or Mr. Underhill and add it to the Campaign Pool. The chosen cards have been earned by the players.
traits: The Lord of the Rings Part 1

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Bag End
text:
Response: After Bag End leaves play, each player draws 1 card for each Hobbit hero he controls.

Victory 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Woody End
text:
While Woody End is the active location, reduce each Hide X value by 1.

Victory 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Stock-brook
text:
When Revealed: Immediately travel to Stock-brook. If another location is currently active, return it to the staging area.

Victory 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Bamfurlong
text:
Response: After the players travel to Bamfurlong, each player engaged with a Nazgûl enemy may ready a hero he controls.

Victory 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Bucklebury Ferry
text:
Immune to player card effects.
While there is at least 1 other location in play, the players cannot travel here.
Travel: The first player must make a Hide 3 test to travel here.
After Bucklebury Ferry leaves play as an explored location, the players win the game.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Green Hill Country
text: While Green Hill Country is the active location, characters get +1 [Willpower] while committed to Hide tests.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Stock Road
text:
While Stock Road is in the staging area, add 2 to the total [Threat] of the discarded cards when a player resolves a Hide test.
Travel: The first player must make a Hide 1 test to travel here.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Marish
text: Forced: After a player fails a Hide test, shuffle a Nazgûl enemy from the discard pile into the encounter deck, if able.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Black Rider
text:
Hide 2. Cannot have non-Morgul attachments.
Forced: After engaged player fails a Hide test, Black Rider makes an immediate attack.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Evil Crow
text: While Evil Crow is engaged with a player, that player adds 1 to the Hide value for each Hide test he makes.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Crawling Towards Him
text:
Peril. Hide 2.
When Revealed: If you have failed a Hide test this phase, remove each character you control from the quest.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Hunting for the Ring
text:
Doomed 2.
When Revealed: Starting with the last player, each player must either return a Nazgûl enemy engaged with him to the staging area or make a Hide 2 test.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Have You Seen Baggins?
text:
Peril. Surge.
When Revealed: Attach to a hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Limit 1 per hero. Forced: After a player fails a Hide test, discard attached hero.”)

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: A Knife in the Dark
text:
You are playing Campaign Mode.

Resolution: Starting with the first player, each player may choose one of the following boon cards and attach it to a hero he controls: Tireless Ranger, Skilled Healer, Valiant Warrior, Noble Hero. The chosen cards have been earned by the players.
traits: The Lord of the Rings Part 2

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Prancing Pony
text:
Response: After the players travel here, the first player puts 1 ally into play from his hand.
Forced: After The Prancing Pony leaves play, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until X enemies have been discarded. X is the number of players in the game. Put each enemy discarded by this effect into play engaged with the first player.

Victory 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Weathertop
text:
Immune to player card effects.
While Weathertop is in the victory display, each enemy in play gets –1 [Threat].
Travel: The first player must exhaust The One Ring to travel here.

Victory 4.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Chetwood
text: While Chetwood is in the staging area, Spy enemies get +1 [Threat] and +1 [Attack].

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Midgewater
text:
While Midgewater is the active location, enemies cannot attack, take damage, or be engaged.
Forced: After Midgewater becomes the active location, return each engaged enemy in play to the staging area.

Victory 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Weather Hills
text:
Response: After the players travel here, place 1 non-unique enemy in play facedown under this location. While an enemy is under this location, it is out of play.
Forced: After this location leaves play, return each enemy under it to the staging area face-up.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Rider of Mordor
text:
Cannot have non-Morgul attachments.
While Rider of Mordor is engaged with a player, characters that player controls get -1 [Willpower].
While The One Ring is exhausted, Rider of Mordor gets -10 engagement cost.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Bill Ferny
text:
Players cannot optionally engage Bill Ferny.
Forced: At the beginning of the staging step, either shuffle 1 out of play Ringwraith into the encounter deck or each player raises his threat by 1 for each non-[Fellowship] hero he committed to the quest.

Victory 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Shady Bree-lander
text: While The One Ring is exhausted, Shady Bree-lander gains: "Cannot be optionally engaged."

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Squint-eyed Southerner
text: When Revealed: You must either shuffle an out of play Ringwraith into the encounter deck or reveal an additional encounter card.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Unwanted Attention
text:
Peril.
When Revealed: You must either remove 2 heroes you control from the quest or shuffle an out of play Ringwraith into the encounter deck.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Black Breath
text:
Peril.
When Revealed: Attach to a hero you control.
(Counts as a Condition attachment with the text:
"Limit 1 per hero. Reduce attached hero's [Willpower], [Attack],
and [Defense] to 0.")

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Flight to the Ford
text:
You are playing Campaign Mode.
Response: After an enemy is declared as an attacker, shuffle the top card of the burden deck into the encounter deck to cancel that attack. (Any player may trigger this ability.)

Resolution: Add each burden card in play, in the encounter deck, and in the discard pile to the Campaign Pool. The added cards have been earned by the players.
traits: The Lord of the Rings Part 3

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: An Evil Wound
text:
Attach to the Ring-bearer. Attached hero cannot be healed.
When attached hero would take any amount of damage, reduce the Ring-bearer'slife by an equal amount instead.
If the Ring-bearer’slife reaches zero, the players lose the game.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Last Bridge
text:
Immune to player card effects.
X is the number of players in the game.
Travel: The first player must reveal the top card of the burden deck and resolve that card as if it were just revealed from the encounter deck to travel here.

Victory 3.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Ford of Bruinen
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Response: After Ford of Bruinen leaves play as an explored location, all engaged enemies are discarded.
Travel: The first player must reveal the top card of the encounter deck to travel here.

Victory 5.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Troll's Camp
text: While The Troll’s Camp is the active location, each hero gets +1 [Willpower], +1 [Attack] and +1 [Defense].

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Ettenmoors
text:
While Ettenmoors is the active location, do not deal Nazgûl enemies a shadow card during the combat phase.
Forced: After any amount of progress is placed on Ettenmoors, reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Old Road
text: Action: Place the top card of the burden deck on top of the encounter deck to place 4 progress on The Old Road. (Use this action only if you are playing campaign mode.)

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Fell Rider
text:
Cannot have non-Morgul attachments.
While Fell Rider is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, the first player must either reduce the Ring-bearer'slife by 1 or engage Fell Rider."

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Stricken Dumb
text:
Peril.
When Revealed: You must either shuffle the top card of the burden deck into the encounter deck and reveal an additional encounter card, or raise each player's threat by 3 and immediately end the quest phase (do not resolve the quest).

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Enemy is Upon Us!
text: When Revealed: Each engaged enemy makes an immediate attack. If no attack is made this way, The Enemy is Upon Us! gains surge.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Pain Assailed Him
text: When Revealed: Reduce the Ring-bearer's life by 1. Then, reduce the Ring-bearer's [Willpower], [Attack], and [Defense] to 0 until the end of the round.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Nine are Abroad
text: When Revealed: Treat the text box of each character in play as blank (except for Traits) until the end of the round. If there is a Nazgûl enemy in the staging area, The Nine are Abroad gains surge.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Witch-king
text:
Immune to player card effects.
The Witch-king gets -30 engagement cost while The One Ring is exhausted.
Characters with 1 [Willpower] or less cannot defend attacks made by The Witch-king.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Ringwraith
text:
Cannot have non-Morgul attachments.
Forced: When Ringwraith attacks, deal it an additional shadow card if The One Ring is exhausted.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Pale Blade
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Attach to a Nazgûl enemy in play, if able. (Counts as a Weapon attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per enemy. Attached enemy gets +1 [Attack] and cannot take non-combat damage.")

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Power in their Terror
text: When Revealed: Each ally gets –1 [Willpower] until the end of the round. Deal 2 damage to each ally with 0 [Willpower].

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Pathless Country
text: Pathless Country gets +4 quest points while in the staging area.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Piercing Cry
text:
Peril.
When Revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Nazgûlenemy. Either add it to the staging area or put it into play engaged with the first player. Shuffle the encounter deck.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Black Steed
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Attach to a Nazgûl enemy in play, if able. (Counts as a Mount attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per enemy. Attached enemy gets -10 engagement cost and gains: 'Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, return attached enemy to the staging area.'")

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Rode Like a Gale
text: When Revealed: Return each engaged Nazgûl enemy to the staging area. If no enemies were returned to the staging area by this effect, Rode Like a Gale gains surge.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Lure of the Ring
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: The first player must either exhaust The One Ring or raise his threat by 3.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Gildor Inglorian
text:
The first player gains control of Gildor Inglorian.
Forced: At the end of the round, discard Gildor Inglorian. The first player may spend 1 [Fellowship] resource to cancel this effect.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Gandalf's Delay
text: Setup: Add Gandalf’s Delay to the staging area. Each player draws 1 less card in his starting hand.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Ring Draws Them
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: At the end of the phase, each enemy in the staging area engages the first player. If The One Ring is exhausted, this effect cannot be canceled.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Weight of the Ring
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Attach to the Ring-bearer. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: At the beginning of each quest phase, either exhaust The One Ring or reveal an additional encounter card this phase.")

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Fear of Discovery
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: The first player must either exhaust the Ring-bearer or reveal an additional encounter card.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Eaten Alive!
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: The first player must deal X damage divided among heroes he controls where X is the number of players in the game.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Panicked
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: The first player raises his threat by 3 and passes the first player token to the next player.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Overcome by Terror
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: The first player must exhaust The One Ring. If The One Ring is already exhausted, the first player must discard 2 cards at random from his hand.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The One Ring
text:
Setup: The first player claims The One Ring and attaches it to the Ring-bearer.
Attached hero does not count against the hero limit. The first player gains control of attached hero.
If The One Ring leaves play, the players lose the game.

flavor: "But there is more about you now than appears on the surface." <cite>Bilbo, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Frodo Baggins
text: Response: After Frodo Baggins exhausts to defend an attack, exhaust The One Ring and spend 1 [fellowship] resource to target the attacking enemy. Then, this attack deals no damage and each player raises his threat by 2.

flavor: "I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the flame of Anor." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Gandalf
text: Play with the top card of your deck faceup. Once per phase, you may play the top card of your deck as if it was in your hand. When playing a card this way, Gandalf is considered to have the printed [leadership], [lore], [tactics], and [spirit] icons.

name: Galadriel
text: At the end of the round, discard Galadriel from play. Response: After you play Galadriel from your hand, search the top 5 cards of your deck for an attachment of cost 3 or less and put it into play. Put the remaining cards back in any order.

name: Boromir
text: Boromir gets +2 [defense] while defending against an enemy with an engagement cost higher than your threat. Response: After Boromir takes any amount of damage, ready him.

name: Elrond
text: At the end of the round, discard Elrond from play. Response: After Elrond enters play, choose one: heal all damage on a hero, discard a Condition attachment, or each player draws 1 card.

flavor: "Elves may thrive on speech alone, and Dwarves endure great weariness, but I am an old Hobbit, and I miss my meal at noon." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Bilbo Baggins
text: Response: After Bilbo Baggins enters play, search your deck for a Pipe attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

flavor: "You cannot pass!" <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Flame of Anor
text: Action: Add Flame of Anor to the victory display and discard the top card of your deck to ready an Istari character you control. That character gets +X [attack] until the end of the phase where X is the discarded card's cost.

flavor: ...he held his staff aloft, and from its tip there came a feint radiance. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Gandalf's Staff
text: Attach to Gandalf. Restricted. Action: Exhaust Gandalf's Staff to (choose one): choose a player to draw 1 card, add 1 resource to a hero's resource pool, or discard a shadow card from a non-unique enemy.

flavor: ...there was a long silence, broken only by the soft puffs of Gandalf's pipe, as he blew white smoke-rings out of the window. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Wizard Pipe
text: Attach to an Istari character. Limit 1 per character. Action: Exhaust Wizard Pipe to exchange a card in your hand with the top card of your deck.

flavor:
"The Company of the Ring shall be Nine: and the Nine Walkers shall be set against the Nine Riders that are evil."
<cite>Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Fellowship of the Ring
text: Attach to the Ring-bearer. Each hero gets +1 [willpower]. Forced: After a character is destroyed, discard Fellowship of the Ring.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Sting
text:
Attach to a Hobbit hero. Restricted.
Attached hero gets +1 [Willpower], +1 [Attack], and +1 [Defense].
Response: After attached hero exhausts to defend an attack, discard the top card of the encounter deck. Deal damage to the attacking enemy equal to the discarded card’s [Threat].

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Mithril Shirt
text:
Attach to the Ring-bearer.
Attached hero gets +1 [Defense] and +1 hit point.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Glamdring
text:
Attach to a Warrior hero or Gandalf. Restricted.
Attached character gets +2 [Attack].
Response: After attached character destroys an
Orc enemy, draw 1 card.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Andúril
text:
Attach to a Noble hero or Aragorn. Restricted.
Attached hero gets +1 [Willpower], +1 [Attack], and +1 [Defense].
Response: After an attack in which the attached hero defended resolves, exhaust Andúril to target the enemy that just attacked. Declare attached hero as an attacker against that enemy (and resolve the attack).

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Phial of Galadriel
text:
Setup: Attach to a hero in play.
Action: Add Phial of Galadriel to the victory display and remove it from the campaign pool, to give each enemy engaged with you –4 [Attack] until the end of the round.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Three Golden Hairs
text:
Setup: Attach to a hero in play.
Action: Add Three Golden Hairs to the victory display and remove it from the campaign pool, to lower each player’s threat by 3. Then, each player draws 3 cards.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Lórien Rope
text:
Setup: Attach to a hero in play.
Action: Add Lórien Rope to the victory display, and remove it from the campaign pool to give each location in the staging area –2 [Threat] until the end of the phase.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Leaf-wrapped Lembas
text:
Setup: Attach to a hero in play.
Action: Add Leaf-wrapped Lembas to the victory display and remove it from the campaign pool, to ready all heroes in play.

flavor:
"I am Aragorn son of Arathorn and am called Elessar, the Elfstone, Dunadan, the heir of Isildur Elendil’s son of Gondor."
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Aragorn
text: The first player gains control of Aragorn. If Aragorn leaves play, the players lose the game. Action: Spend 2 resources from Aragorn's resource pool to ready a hero.

flavor: "Arise now, arise, Riders of Théoden!" <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Théoden
text: Sentinel. Reduce the cost of the first Rohan ally you play from your hand each round by 1 (to a minimum of 0).

flavor:
"I am not altogether on anybody's side, because nobody is altogether on my side..."
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Treebeard
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Action: Deal 1 damage to Treebeard to give him +1 [willpower] and +1 [attack] until the end of the phase. (Limit 5 times per phase.)

flavor:
"Give me a row of orc-necks and room to swing and all weariness will fall from me!"
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Gimli
text: Sentinel. Response: After an enemy is revealed from the encounter deck, ready Gimli.

flavor: "He stands not alone," said Legolas, bending his bow and fitting an arrow with hands that moved quicker than sight. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Legolas
text: Ranged. Response: After Legolas participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, draw 1 card.

flavor: "I am Bregalad, that is Quickbeam in your language. But it is only a nickname, of course." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Quickbeam
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. Response: After Quickbeam enters play, deal 1 damage to him to ready him.

flavor: "I am the Doorward of Théoden," he said. "Háma is my name." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Háma
text: Combat Action: Ready Háma. He gets +3 [defense] until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase, discard Háma. (Limit once per round.)

flavor: "A smaller and lighter horse, but restive and fiery, was brought to Legolas. Arod was his name." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Arod
text: Attach to a hero or Legolas. Response: After attached character participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, exhaust Arod to place 1 progress token on any location.

flavor: The effect of the draught began at the toes, and rose steadily through every limb, bringing refreshment and vigour as it coursed upwards, right to the tips of the hair. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Ent Draught
text: Play only if you control at least 1 Ent character. Attach to a character. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gets +2 hit points.

flavor: "Here, lord, is Herugrim, your ancient blade." <cite>Háma, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Herugrim
text: Attach to a Rohan hero. Restricted. Reduce the cost to play Herugrim on Théoden by 1. Response: After attached hero is declared as an attacker, exhaust Herugrim to add attached hero's [willpower] to its [attack] for this attack.

flavor: "...it is a gathering of Ents - which does not often happen nowadays." <cite>Treebeard, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Entmoot
text: Play only if you control at least 1 Ent character. Action: Search the top 5 cards of your deck for any number of Ent cards and add them to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

flavor: "Helm is arisen and comes back to war. Helm for Théoden King!" <cite>Riders of Rohan, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Helm! Helm!
text: Play only after the resolving enemy attacks step is complete. Combat Action: Exhaust and discard a Rohan ally you control to choose and discard a non-unique enemy engaged with you.

flavor: "We shall makes such a chase as shall be accounted a marvel among the Three Kindreds: Elves, Dwarves, and Men. Forth the Three Hunters!" <cite>Aragorn, The Two Towers</cite>
name: The Three Hunters
text: Play only if you control [fellowship] Aragorn. Quest Action: Choose 3 heroes committed to the quest. Ready those heroes. Until the end of the round, each of the chosen heroes gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense].

flavor: "He is the chief of the Mearas, lords of horses, and not even Théoden, King of Rohan, has ever looked on a better." <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Shadowfax
text: Attach to Gandalf. Gandalf gains ranged and sentinel. Action: Exhaust Shadowfax to ready Gandalf.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Intimidation
text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a Warrior hero.
Response: After attached hero is declared as the only attacker against a non-unique enemy, exhaust Intimidation to give that enemy -2 [Defense] for this attack.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Hands of a Healer
text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a Healer hero.
Action: Exhaust attached hero and Hands of a Healer to heal up to 3 damage from a hero.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Forewarned
text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a Ranger hero.
Response: After attached hero is declared as a defender against a non-unique enemy, exhaust Forewarned to discard 1 shadow card from the attacking enemy.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Leader of Men
text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a Noble hero.
Response: After attached hero quests successfully, exhaust Leader of Men to add 1 resource to attached hero’s pool.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Beyond All Hope
text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gets +1 [Willpower], +1 [Attack], +1 [Defense] and cannot have treachery card attachments.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Palantir of Orthanc
text:
Attach to [Fellowship] Aragorn.
Quest Action: Exhaust Aragorn and Palantir of Orthanc to discard the top card of the encounter deck. If Aragorn’s [Willpower] is greater than the discarded card’s [Threat], you may add Palantir of Orthanc to the victory display and remove it from the campaign pool to choose a player. That player reveals 1 fewer encounter card this phase (to a minimum of 0).

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Poisoned Counsels
text:
Poisoned Counsels functions like a player card.
Forced: After you draw this card, discard each other card in your hand.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: To Isengard!
text:
Captive heroes are in play but are not under any player’s control. Treat each Captive’s text box as blank.
Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, increase the pursuit value by 1. Then, if the pursuit value is 30 or greater, the players lose the game.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Ugluk
text:
Toughness 3. Cannot have attachments.
Allies cannot be declared as attackers or defenders against Ugluk.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Grishnakh
text:
Forced: After Grishnakh enters play, attach 1 of the Captives to him. If Grishnakh is defeated, place the attached Captive faceup underneath To Isengard!
Forced: At the end of the quest phase, deal 1 damage to the attached Captive.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Ugluk’s Uruk-hai
text:
Peril. Toughness 1. Archery 1.
When Revealed: Either increase the pursuit value by 3, or reveal an additional encounter card.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Wold
text:
While The Wold is the active location, it gains: “Response: After The Wold is explored, each player draws 1 card.”
Travel: Increase the pursuit value by 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: East Emnet
text:
While East Emnet is the active location, it gains: “Response: After East Emnet is explored, add 1 resource to each hero’s resource pool.”
Travel: Increase the pursuit value by 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Plains of Rohan
text: X is the number of locations in the staging area.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Banks of Entwash
text: Forced: After any amount of progress is placed on Banks of Entwash, increase the pursuit value by 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Rest By Night?
text: When Revealed: Either immediately end the quest phase and increase the pursuit value by 3, or deal 1 damage to each character committed to the quest. This effect cannot be canceled.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Strange Weariness
text: When Revealed: Each character committed to the quest gets -1 [Willpower] until the end of the round.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Unseen Barrier
text: When Revealed: The players cannot place more than 3 progress on the current quest this round. (This does not count progress placed on any active location.)

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Defense of Helm’s Deep
text:
Add 1 to the total [Threat] in the staging area for each resource token here.
Forced: At the end of the quest phase, place 1 resource token here.
If there are 8 resource tokens here, add The Defense of Helm’s Deep to the victory display and advance to stage 5A.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Wild Hillman
text: Forced: After Wild Hillman attacks, place 1 progress on the active location.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Warrior of Dunland
text:
Peril. Archery 1.
When Revealed: Warrior of Dunland makes an attack against you.
Forced: After Warrior of Dunland attacks and destroys a character, place 3 progress on the active location.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Soldier of Isengard
text:
Toughness 1. Archery 1.
Forced: After Soldier of Isengard attacks and destroys a character, place 1 progress on the current quest.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Hornburg
text:
While The Hornburg is the active location, reduce the archery total by 1 for each player in the game during the combat phase.
Forced: When The Hornburg is explored, assign X damage among characters in play. X is the number of enemies in play.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Deeping Wall
text:
While Deeping Wall is the active location, each hero gets +1 [Defense].
Forced: When Deeping Wall is explored, raise each player’s threat by 4.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Deeping Culvert
text:
X is 1 plus the number of allies controlled by the first player.
Forced: When Deeping Culvert is explored, each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy, reveals it, and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Postern Door
text:
While Postern Door is the active location, each hero gets +1 [Attack].
Forced: When Postern Door is explored, until the end of the round, players cannot declare attackers.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Helm’s Gate
text:
While Helm’s Gate is the active location, if any player is not engaged with an enemy, the first player reveals an encounter card at the end of each staging step.
Forced: When Helm’s Gate is explored, each enemy gets -20 engagement cost and +2 [Attack] until the end of the round.
