Travel: Each player exhausts a character he controls to travel here.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Torch-lit Hall
text: Forced: After the players travel to Torch-lit Hall, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. If there is a copy of that enemy in the staging area, discard that copy as well. If there is not, add the discarded enemy to the staging area.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Shagrat
text:
Cannot have non-boon attachments. Cannot take non-combat damage.
Allies cannot attack or defend against Shagrat.
Forced: After progress is placed on the quest, Shagrat gets -X engagement cost until the end of the round. X is the amount of progress just placed.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Gorbag
text:
Cannot have attachments.
Forced: After Gorbag engages you, it makes an immediate attack against you.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Wounded Uruk
text:
Wounded Uruk enters play with 2 damage on it.
Forced: After Wounded Uruk engages you, it gets +2 [Attack] until the end of the round.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Orcish Howls
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, each enemy gets +1 [Threat] for each damage on it. If there are no enemies in the staging area, Orcish Howls gains surge.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Black Gate
text:
Immune to player card effects. The players cannot travel here.
The Black Gate gets +1 [Threat] for each resource on it.
Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, place 1 resource here and raise each player’s threat by 1.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Towers of the Teeth
text:
Immune to player card effects.
X is the number of characters controlled by the player with the most characters.
While Towers of the Teeth is the active location, players cannot play allies.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Beleaguered Hills
text:
While Beleaguered Hills is the active location, reduce the total [Threat] in the staging area by X, where X is the total [Threat] of each engaged enemy.
Forced: After Beleaguered Hills becomes the active location, each player engages a non-unique enemy in the staging area.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Waste of Dagorlad
text: While Waste of Dagorlad is the active location, treat the text box of each ally as if it were blank (except for Traits).

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Slopes of Cirith Gorgor
text: Forced: When Slopes of Cirith Gorgor leaves play, the first player shuffles the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discards cards from the top until an enemy is discarded. Then, he puts that enemy into play engaged with him.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Reeking Moat
text:
Forced: After Reeking Moat becomes the active location, choose a non-unique, non-Nazgul enemy in the staging area and place it facedown under Reeking Moat.
Forced: When Reeking Moat leaves play, put each enemy under it into play engaged with the first player.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Wall of Morannon
text:
While Wall of Morannon is the active location, each enemy and location in the staging area is immune to player card effects.
Forced: After Wall of Morannon becomes the active location, return each engaged enemy to the staging area.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Mouth of Sauron
text:
Immune to player card effects. Cannot leave the staging area.
Forced: After a player cancels a ‘when revealed’ effect, The Mouth of Sauron makes an immediate attack against that player.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Nazgul of Mordor
text:
Cannot have non-Morgul attachments.
Forced: After Nazgul of Mordor attacks, either raise your threat by 4, or return Nazgul of Mordor to the staging area.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Gorgoroth Hill-troll
text:
Cannot have attachments.
Forced: After Gorgoroth Hill-troll attacks and destroys a character, the defending player discards a random card from his hand and raises his threat by that card’s printed cost.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Easterling Bowman
text:
Peril. Archery 1.
When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to a questing character you control.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Warrior of Rhun
text:
Peril.
When Revealed: Choose a questing character you control and remove it from the quest.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Hell-hawk
text:
Peril.
When Revealed: Either search the encounter deck, discard pile, and victory display for a Nazgul enemy and add it to the staging area, or attach Hell-hawk to a Nazgul enemy in play. (Counts as a Mount attachment with the text: “Limit 1 per enemy. Attached enemy gets +2 [Threat], +2 [Attack], +2 [Defense] and is immune to player card effects.”)

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Hour of Doom
text:
Doomed 1.
When Revealed: Each player must choose: either raise your threat by 1 for each character you control, or discard the highest cost ally you control.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Jaws of Steel
text: When Revealed: Each players assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is the number of resources on The Black Gate.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Rage Filled Him
text:
Peril.
When Revealed: The Mouth of Sauron makes an immediate attack against you. If this attack destroys a character, raise your threat by 4.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Onslaught of Mordor
text: When Revealed: Each player deals 1 damage to a questing character he controls. Until the end of the phase, each damaged character gets -1 [Willpower] and cannot be healed.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Gwaihir
text:
Ranged. Sentinel.
When Revealed: The first player must choose: either take control of Gwaihir, or spend 1 [Fellowship] resource and discard Gwaihir to discard a non-unique enemy in the staging area.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Tower of Barad-dur
text:
Players do not raise their threat at the end of the refresh phase.
Forced: At the end of the round, each player raises his threat by 1 for each non-[Fellowship] character he controls.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Mount Doom
text:
Immune to player card effects. X is the tens digit of the first player’s threat dial.
The players cannot travel here unless there is at least 20 progress on stage 3B.
Travel: Each player makes a Fortitude test. If a player fails this test, he raises his threat by 9.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Orc-hold
text:
While Orc-hold is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on other locations in the staging area.
Forced: After Orc-hold becomes the active location, shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Discard cards from the top until an Orc enemy is discarded. Put that enemy into play engaged with the first player.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Mordor Road
text:
Mordor Road gets +1 [Threat] for each ally controlled by the player who controls the most allies.
Forced: After Mordor Road becomes the active location, each player discards the top card of the encounter deck. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Plain of Gorgoroth
text:
If a player has failed a Fortitude test this round, Plain of Gorgoroth gets +2 [Threat].
Travel: The first player makes a Fortitude test to travel here. If this test is unsuccessful, raise each player’s threat by 4.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Brake of Thorns
text:
While Brake of Thorns is in the staging area, add (S) to each Fortitude test.
Forced: After Brake of Thorns becomes the active location, each player assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is the tens digit of his threat dial.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Old Water-course
text:
While Old Water-course is the active location, it gains: “Response: When Old Water-course is explored, reduce each player’s threat by 5.”
Travel: Each player must exhaust a hero he controls to travel here.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Gollum
text:
Surge. Immune to non-[Fellowship] player card effects.
Gollum engages the first player.
*Forced: When Gollum is discarded during a Fortitude test, put him into play engaged with the first player. Then, choose an encounter card discarded for this test and ignore its (S) icons.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Ringwraith of Sauron
text:
Cannot have non-Morgul attachments.
While Ringwraith of Sauron is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After a player fails a Fortitude test, Ringwraith of Sauron engages that player and makes an immediate attack.”

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Orc Captain
text: Forced: After Orc Captain engages you, make a Fortitude test. If you fail this test, reveal the top card of the encounter deck.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Big Uruk
text: Forced: After Big Uruk engages you, either raise your threat by 4, or Big Uruk makes an immediate attack against you.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Little Snuffler
text:
Peril. Surge.
When Revealed: Either raise your threat by 1 for each ally you control, or discard an ally you control.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: “Wicked Master!”
text: When Revealed: Gollum makes an immediate attack against the first player. If Gollum is not in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for Gollum and put him into play engaged with the first player.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Lidless Eye
text:
Peril.
When Revealed: Make a Fortitude test. If The One Ring is exhausted, add (SS) to the test. If you fail this test, raise your threat by 10.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Foul Fumes
text: When Revealed: Each player makes a Fortitude test. If you fail this test, deal 1 damage to each character you control. Until the end of the round, treat the text box of each damaged character as if it were blank (except for Traits).

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Heavy and Tired
text: When Revealed: Attach to the hero with the most attachments and exhaust that hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero cannot commit to Fortitude tests. Forced: After you fail a Fortitude test, exhaust attached hero and discard each non-objective attachment on it.”)

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Orc of Mordor
text:
Surge.
Forced: After Orc of Mordor engages you, exhaust a character you control.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Snaga Archer
text:
Archery 2.
Forced: After Snaga Archer engages you, deal 2 damage to a character you control.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Uruk Soldier
text: Forced: After Uruk Soldier engages you, raise your threat by 2.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Drawn to the Ring
text: When Revealed: The first player must choose: Either exhaust The One Ring and reveal an encounter card, or discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and put it into play engaged with him.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Deep Shadows
text:
Doomed 2.
When Revealed: Each player must choose: either discard your hand (with at least 3 cards in it), or he reveals an encounter card.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Evil Vigilance
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: Either discard a questing character you control, or raise your threat by 1 for each questing character you control.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: In Darkness Bind Them
text: When Revealed: Each player exhausts a character he controls. If The Eye of Sauron is in the staging area, characters cannot be readied by player card effects this round.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The One Ring
text:
Setup: The first player claims The One Ring and attaches it to the Ring-bearer.
Attached hero does not count against the hero limit. The first player gains control of attached hero.
If The One Ring leaves play, the players lose the game.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Pass the Two Watchers
text:
Setup: Set Shagrat aside, out of play. Add The Two Watchers (location side faceup) and Topmost Chamber to the staging area. The first player loses control of the Ring-bearer, places it faceup under Topmost Chamber as a guarded objective. Then, the first player attaches Last of the Company to a hero he controls and attaches The One Ring to that hero.

Each non-unique location gets -1 [Threat] and cannot leave the staging area.
While The Two Watchers is in the staging area (enemy side faceup), it is considered to be engaged with each player.
This stage cannot be defeated while The Two Watchers is in play.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Fighting in the Tower
text:
When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards until X enemies are discarded, where X is the number of players in the game. Add each enemy discarded by this effect to the staging area.

Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. If there is a copy of that enemy in the staging area, discard that copy as well. If there is not, add the discarded enemy to the staging area.
This stage cannot be defeated unless Topmost Chamber is in the victory display. When the Ring-bearer is free of encounters, the first player gains control of it.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Escape from Cirith Ungol
text:
When Revealed: Add Last of the Company to the victory display. Attach The One Ring to the Ring-bearer and exhaust the Ring-bearer. The first player moves The Two Watchers from the victory display to the staging area (location side faceup). Each other player reveals an encounter card.

The players cannot travel to The Two Watchers unless there is at least 12 progress on this stage.
While The Two Watchers is in the staging area (enemy side faceup), it gets +3 [Threat] and +3 [Defense] and is considered to be engaged with each player.
This stage cannot be defeated while The Two Watchers is in play. If this stage is defeated, the players win the game.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Two Watchers
text:
Immune to player card effects.
X is twice the stage number of the main quest.
Forced: After the players travel here, flip The Two Watchers to its enemy side and move it to the staging area.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Two Watchers
text:
Immune to player card effects. Cannot be optionally engaged.
Forced: When The Two Watchers deals any amount of damage, cancel the damage and raise the defending player’s threat by X instead. X is the amount of damage just canceled.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: Embassy from The Dark Tower
text:
Setup: Add The Black Gate and The Mouth of Sauron to the staging area. Set Gwaihir aside, out of play. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Dire. When Revealed: In player order, each player places the top card of his deck faceup in front of him until there are a total of 4 faceup player cards between the players. Place the top 4 cards of the encounter deck faceup. Starting with the highest cost player card, pair each player card with the highest threat encounter card remaining until there are 4 pairs. For each pair, the first player must choose: either discard both cards in that pair, or reveal the encounter card to play the player card at no cost.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Battle of the Morannon
text:
Dire When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a different Orc, Troll, or Nazgul enemy to the staging area. Shuffle Gwaihir into the encounter deck.

Dire. During the staging step, the first player does not reveal an encounter card as normal. Instead, he reveals 1 encounter card for each resource on The Black Gate.
Forced: After the players quest unsuccessfully, discard the active location.
This stage cannot be defeated. Each round the players survive gives the Ring-bearer more time to fulfill the quest to Mount Doom.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Land of Mordor
text:
Setup: Add Mount Doom and The Tower of Barad-dur to the staging area. Make Brake of Thorns the active location. Each player searches the encounter deck for a different location and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Dire. This stage gets +4 quest points for each player.
The first treachery revealed each quest phase is immune to player card effects and gains surge.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Road to Isenmouthe
text:
Dire. When Revealed: Search the encounter deck, discard pile, and victory display for Mordor Road and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and travel to Mordor Road.

Dire. Forced: After placing progress here from questing successfully, each player makes a fortitude test. If a player passes this test, he places a resource here. If a player fails this test, he discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and puts that enemy into play engaged with him.
At the end of the quest phase, if the number of resources here is equal to or greater than the number of players, advance to stage 3A.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Last Gasp
text:
Dire. When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until X locations are discarded, where X is the number of players in the game. Add each location discarded this way to the staging area.

Dire. The first treachery revealed each quest phase is immune to player card effects and gains surge.
Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, the first player makes a Fortitude test. If the first player fails this test, no more than 5 progress can be placed here this round.
This stage cannot be defeated unless Mount Doom is the active location.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Crack of Doom
text:
Dire. When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until X enemies are discarded, where X is the number of players. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

Dire. Allies cannot enter play and ‘when revealed’ effects cannot be canceled.
Forced: When Mount Doom is explored, the first player makes a Fortitude test. Discard 1 extra encounter card for each player. If the first player fails this test, the Ring-bearer claims The One Ring for himself and the players lose the game. If the test is successful, the Ring-bearer completes his quest and the players win the game.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Eye of Sauron
text:
Add (S) to each Fortitude test.
Forced: At the end of the round, flip The Eye of Sauron, then move it and each Nazgul enemy in the staging area to The Black Gate Opens staging area. The first player may raise each player’s threat by 3 to cancel this effect.

cycle_name: Lord of the Rings Saga Expansions
name: The Eye of Sauron
text:
Each enemy in the staging area gets +1 [Threat] and -10 engagement cost.
Forced: At the end of the round, flip The Eye of Sauron, then move it and each Nazgul enemy in the staging area to the Mount Doom staging area. The first player may raise each player’s threat by 3 to cancel this effect.

flavor:
"Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens…"
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Gimli
text: Sentinel. Response: After Gimli is declared as a defender, spend 1 resource from his pool to ready another hero. If that hero is Legolas, he gets +1[attack] until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

flavor:
"I go to find the Sun!"
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Legolas
text: Ranged. Response: After Legolas commits to a quest, discard a card from your hand to ready another hero. If that hero is Gimli, he gets +1[willpower] until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

flavor:
They dwelt most often by the edges of the woods, from which they could escape at times to hunt...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Greenwood Archer
text: Ranged. Response: After Greenwood Archer enters play, ready a hero.

flavor:
...the fortress of the dwarves could not be taken by surprise.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Erebor Guard
text: Sentinel. Response: When you play Erebor Guard from you hand, discard the top 2 cards of your deck to reduce its cost by 2.

flavor:
"The Bounders have never been so busy before."
<cite>Sam Gamgee, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Halfling Bounder
text: While there is a side quest in the victory display, Halfling Bounder gains: "Response: Discard Halfling Bounder to cancel the 'when revealed' effects of an encounter card that was just revealed from the encounter deck."

flavor:
"I don't think we've rightly understood till now what they did for us."
<cite>Barliman Butterbur, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Vigilant Dúnadan
text: While there is a side quest in the victory display, Vigilant Dúnadan does not exhaust to defend.

flavor:
...folk that saw them pass marvelled to see such companions…
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Unlikely Friendship
text: Play only if you control a unique character with the Silvan trait and another unique character with the Dwarf trait. Action: Draw 1 card and add 1 resource to the resource pool of a hero you control.

flavor:
...the Captains of the West were well warned by their scouts...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Well Warned
text: Play only if you control a unique character with the Noble trait and another unique character with the Scout trait. Response: After a player engages an enemy, reduce his threat by X, where X is that enemy's printed [threat].

flavor:
...the tides of fate had turned against them and their doom was at hand.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Dour Handed
text: Action: Deal X damage to an enemy engaged with you. X is the number of side quests in the victory display.

flavor:
...each of them had also a short broad sword at his side and a round shield slung at his back.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Dwarven Shield
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1[defense]. Response: After attached hero takes damage from an enemy attack, exhaust Dwarven Shield to add 1 resource to attached hero's pool.

flavor:
Legolas had a bow and a quiver, and at his belt a long white knife.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Mirkwood Long-knife
text: Attach to a Silvan hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1[willpower] and +1[attack].

flavor:
"Now far ahead the Road has gone,
And I must follow, if I can..."
<cite>Frodo Baggins, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: The Road Goes Ever On
text: Attach to a quest card in play. Response: When attached quest is defeated, the first player chooses a player. That player searches his deck for a side quest, adds it to his hand, and shuffles his deck.

flavor:
"For behold! The storm comes, and now all friends should gather together, lest each singly be destroyed."
<cite>Gandalf, The Return of the King</cite>
name: The Storm Comes
text:
Limit 1 copy of The Storm Comes in the victory display.
While this quest is in the victory display, the first ally played by each player each round does not require a resource match.

flavor:
...the Southrons were bold men and grim...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Kahliel
text: You may use resources from Kahliel's resource pool to pay for Harad ally cards of any sphere. Action: Discard a Harad ally card from your hand to ready a Harad character in play. (Limit once per phase.)

flavor:
They forgot or ignored what little they had known of the Guardians, and of the labours of those that made possible the long peace of the Shire.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Andrath Guardsman
text: Response: After you play Andrath Guardsman from your hand, choose a non-unique enemy engaged with you. That enemy cannot attack you this round.

flavor:
"Soon there will be battle on the fields. A sortie must be made ready."
<cite>Gandalf, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Prepare for Battle
text:
Limit 1 copy of Prepare for Battle in the victory display.
While this quest is in the victory display, the first player draws an additional card during the resource phase.

flavor:
...he and his knights still held themselves like lords in whom the race of Númenor ran true.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Yazan
text: Ranged. Response: After Yazan is declared as an attacker, deal 1 damage to a non-unique enemy in play. (Limit once per phase.)

flavor:
"We must press our Enemy, and no longer wait upon him for the move."
<cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Wait no Longer
text: Response: At the beginning of the quest phase, search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for an enemy and put it into play engaged with you. Then, reveal one less encounter card this phase (to a minimum of 0). Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Jubayr
text: Sentinel. Response: After Jubayr exhausts to defend an attack, discard 1 facedown shadow card from a non-unique enemy. (Limit once per phase.)

flavor:
He held a small pipe with a wide flattened bowl...
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Dwarf Pipe
text: Attach to a Dwarf character. Limit 1 per character. Response: After a card is discarded from the top of your deck, exhaust Dwarf Pipe to place that card on the bottom of your deck.

name: Firyal
text: Response: After Firyal commits to the quest, look at the top card of the encounter deck. Then, you may discard the looked at card.

name: Coney in a Trap
text: Play only if you control a unique character with the Ranger trait and another unique character with the Warrior trait. Response: After you engage an enemy, that enemy cannot attack you until the end of the round.

name: Kahliel's Headdress
text: Attach to Kahliel. Restricted. Each Harad character gets +1[willpower]. Refresh Action: Exhaust Kahliel's Headdress to shuffle the topmost Harad ally in your discard pile into your deck.

flavor: “He is one of the wandering folk - Rangers we call them.” -Barliman Butterbur, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Thurindir
text: Thurindir gets +1 [willpower] for each side quest in the victory display. Setup: Search your deck for a side quest and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

flavor: But the Haradrim, being now driven to the brink, turned at bay, and they were fierce in despair... -The Return of the King
name: Kahliel’s Tribesman
text: Action: Exhaust Kahliel’s Tribesman to choose another Harad character. That character gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense] until the end of the phase.

flavor: Their horses were strong and of proud bearing, but rough-haired... -The Return of the King
name: Steed of the North
text: Attach to a Dunedain or Ranger hero. Restricted. Response: After you engage an enemy, exhaust Steed of the North to ready attached hero.

flavor: Gimli hewed the legs from another that had sprung up on Balin’s tomb. -The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Mighty Warrior
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gains the Warrior trait. Response: After you play Mighty Warrior from your hand, draw a card.

name: Proud Hunters
text: Play only if you control a unique character with the Noble trait and another unique character with the Ranger trait. Response: After a hero you control participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, add X resources to that hero’s pool. X is the just destroyed enemy’s printed [threat].

name: Dunedain Pathfinder
text: Forced: After this ally enters play, search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a non-unique location and add it to the staging area. If no location enters play by this effect, discard Dunedain Pathfinder. Shuffle the encounter deck.

flavor: “Well,” said Boromir, “when heads are at a loss bodies must serve...” -The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Backtrack
text: Play only if the main quest has no keywords. Action: Remove X progress from the main quest to place X progress on a location in the staging area.

name: Eryn Galen Settler
text: Response: When the active location leaves play as an explored location, discard Eryn Galen Settler to discard a location in the staging with the same title as the just explored location.

flavor: “I myself dared to pass the doors of the Necromancer in Dol Guldur, and secretly explored his ways...” -Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Explore Secret Ways
text:
Limit 1 copy of Explore Secret Ways in the victory display.
While this side quest is in the victory display, each location in the staging area with the same title as the active location does not contribute its [threat] to the total [threat] of the staging area.

flavor: “...the power of Orthanc cannot be lightly thrown aside...” -Saruman, The Two Towers
name: Steward of Orthanc
text: Response: When you play an event, give it Doomed 1 to draw a card. You cannot trigger this ability if you have already triggered the ability of a Steward of Orthanc this round.

flavor: "Hirgon I am, errand-rider of Denethor, who bring you this token of war." -The Return of the King
name: Hirgon
text: Resonse: After Hirgon quests successfully, play a [tactics] ally from your hand, reducing its cost by 1 (to a minimum of 1). Then, you may raise your threat by 1 to give that ally +1 [attack] and +1 [defense]  until the end of the round.

name: Haradrim Spear
text: Restricted. Attach to a Haradrim character. Attached character gets +1 [attack]. Response: After attached character is declared as an attacker, it gets +3 [attack] for this attack. After this attack resolves, discard Haradrim Spear.

name: Hunting Party
text: Play only if you control a unique character with the Warrior trait and another unique character with the Scout trait. Response: After the players have committed characters to the quest, discard a non-unique enemy in the staging area. Then, reveal an encounter card.

flavor: "The Red Arrow has not been seen in the Mark in all my years!" -Théoden, The Return of the King
name: The Red Arrow
text: Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a Gondor hero. Attached hero gets +1 [willpower]. Valour Response: After attached hero quests successfully, add The Red Arrow to the victory display to search the top 5 cards of your deck for an ally and put it into play.

flavor: "I called for the help of the Dúnedain, and their watch was doubled..." -Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Keep Watch
text:
Limit 1 copy of Keep Watch in the victory display.
While Keep Watch is in the victory display, each non-unique enemy engaged with a player gets -1 [attack].

flavor: "Who are you, and what are you doing in this land?" said the Rider, using the Common Speech of the West… -The Two Towers
name: Rider of Rohan
text: While a side quest is in the victory display, Rider of Rohan does not exaust to quest.

flavor:
"I sit beside the fire and think
of how the world will be
when winter comes without a spring
that I shall ever see." -Bilbo Baggins, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Fireside Song
text: Attach to a Hobbit hero. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gets +1 [willpower] for each Song attached to it.

flavor: "Travellers scowl at us, and countrymen gives us scornful names." -Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Dunedain Lookout
text: Response: Discard Dúnedain Lookout to cancel the 'When Revealed' effects of an enemy just revealed from the encounter deck.

flavor: ...he went forth clad only in rusty green and brown, as a Ranger of the wilderness. -The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Doughty Ranger
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gains the Ranger trait. Response: After you play Doughty Ranger from your hand, draw a card.

flavor: "For the rest, they shall represent the other Free Peoples of the World: Elves, Dwarves and Men." -Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: The Free Peoples
text: Play only if the characters you control have a total of at least 9 different Traits between them. Action: Ready each character in play. Until the end of the phase, each character you control gets +1 [willpower].

name: Fastred
text: Response: After Fastred defends an enemy attack, return that enemy to the staging area to reduce your threat by 2. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Song of Hope
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. Action: Spend 1 resource from attached hero’s pool to give attached hero +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase. (Limit 3 times per phase.)

name: Burst into Song
text: Action: Ready each hero with a Song attachment.

name: Defender of Cair Andros
text: Defender of Cair Andros gets +X [Defense], where X is the tens digit of your threat. (Limit +4 [Defense].) Valour Response: After Defender of Cair Andros is declared as a defender, deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.

name: Oath of Eorl
text: Play only if you control a unique character with the Rohan trait and another unique character with the Gondor trait. Response: At the beginning of the combat phase, you resolve the step in which you attack enemies before resolving enemy attacks this phase. (Each other player resolves the combat phase as normal after you resolve your attacks.)

name: Fearless Scout
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gains the Scout trait. Response: After you play Fearless Scout from your hand, draw a card.

flavor: “Foes and fire are before you, and your homes far behind. Yet, though you fight upon an alien field, the glory that you reap there shall be your own forever.” -Theoden, The Return of the King
name: Rally the West
text: Limit 1 copy of Rally the West in the victory display. While this side quest is in the victory display, each hero gets +1 [willpower].

name: Dúnedain Pipe
text: Attach to a Dúnedain character. Limit 1 per character. Action: Exhaust Dúnedain Pipe and place a card from your hand on the bottom of your deck to draw a card.

name: Old Toby
text: Action: Draw 1 card for each Pipe you control. Heal 1 damage from each hero with a Pipe attachment.

name: Southron Refugee
text: Action: Exhaust Southron Refugee to reduce the cost of the next Harad ally you play this phase by 1.

flavor: ...he had a good many friends, especially among the younger Hobbits (mostly descendants of the Old Took)... -The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Folco Boffin
text: Folco Boffin gets -1 threat cost for each Hobbit hero you control. Action: Discard Folco Boffin to reduce your threat by 7. (Limit once per game.)

flavor: By that time all the bells were ringing in Dale and the warriors were arming. -The Hobbit
name: Knight of Dale
text: Action: Spend 1 [leadership] resource to ready Knight of Dale. (Limit once per round.) Valour Action: Ready Knight of Dale. (Limit once per round.)

flavor: "The wise will stay here and hope to rebuild our town, and enjoy in times its peace and riches." -The Master, The Hobbit
name: Diligent Noble
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gains the Noble trait. Response: After you play Diligent Noble from your hand, draw a card.

flavor: After him thundered the knights of his house... -The Return of the King
name: Riddermark Knight
text: Response: After Riddermark Knight is declared as an attacker, it gets +2 [attack] for this attack. At the end of this attack, discard Riddermark Knight.

flavor: When thirteen had fallen the rest fled shrieking, leaving the defenders unharmed, except for Sam who had a scratch along the scalp. -The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Fierce Defense
text: Combat Action: Deal 3 damage to a non-unique enemy engaged with you. Valour Action: Discard a non-unique enemy engaged with you.

flavor: "Much evil must befall a country before it wholly forgets the Elves, if once they dwelt there." -Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Eregion Survivor
text: While you have no cards in your hand, Eregion Survivor gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense].

name: Heirs of Earendil
text: Play only if you control a unique character with the Noldor trait and another unique character with the Dúnedain trait. Action: Choose a non-unique location in the staging area and raise your threat by X to discard it. X is the chosen location's printed quest points.

flavor: "Leaflock has grown sleepy, almost tree-ish, you might say…" Treebeard, The Two Towers
name: Leaflock
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. Leaflock gets +1 [willpower] for each damaged Ent character you control. (Limit +4 [willpower].)

flavor: … glad would he have been to know its fate who wrought it slowly long ago in the North-kingdom when the Dúnedain were young… -The Return of the King
name: Legacy Blade
text:
Attach to a hero. Restricted.
Attached hero gets +1 [attack] for each side quest in the victory display. (Limit +3 [attack].)

name: Open the Armory
text: Action: Search the top 10 cards of your deck for a Weapon or Armor attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck. Valour Action: Search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Weapon or Armor attachment and put it into play. Shuffle your deck.

flavor: "...he can move like a wind when he is roused." -Pippin, The Two Towers
name: Quickbeam
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Action: Deal 2 damage to Quickbeam to ready him. (Limit once per phase.)

flavor: "He works for Mr. Boffin at Overhill and goes up to the Northfarthing for the hunting." -Sam Gamgee, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Halfast Gamgee
text: Reduce the cost to play Halfast Gamgee by 1 for each side quest in the victory display. Response: After Halfast Gamgee enters play, add 1 resource to a hero's resource pool.

flavor: "By our valour the wildfolk of the East are still restrained, and the terror of Morgul kept at bay; and thus alone are peace and freedom maintained in the lads behind us…" -Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Bulwark of the West
text: Action: Discard an ally you control to choose and discard a Condition attachment.

flavor: "...if it were not for the Beornings, the passage from Dale to Rivendell would long ago have become impossible." -Glóin, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Beorning Guardian
text: Response: After Beorning Guardian participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, discard Beorning Guardian to place X progress on a location, where X is the destroyed enemy's printed [threat].

name: Followed
text:
Play into your play area unattached. 
While unattached, attach to the next eligible enemy that engages you. 

While attached enemy is engaged with you, reduce the total [threat] in the staging area by X, where X is attached enemy's printed [threat].

flavor: "...they may pass to the Sea unhindered and leave the Middle-earth forever." -Haldir, The Two Towers
name: Flight to the Sea
text: Play only if you control a Noldor or Silvan hero. Planning Action: Shuffle a set aside Wind from the Sea into the encounter deck. Then, remove Flight to the Sea from the game.

name: Emyn Arnen Ranger
text: Response: After Emyn Arnen Ranger commits to the quest, choose an enemy with a Trap attachment. Until the end of the phase, Emyn Arnen Ranger gets +X [willpower], where X is the chosen enemy's printed [threat].

name: The Dam Bursts
text: Play only if you control a unique character with the Ent trait and another unique character with the Hobbit trait. Action: Ready each damaged Ent character you control.

flavor: "In Eregion long ago many Elven-rings were made, magic rings as you call them, and they were, of course, of various kinds..." -Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Magic Ring
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero and 1 per deck. Action: Exhaust Magic Ring and raise your threat by 1 to (choose 1): heal 1 damage from attached hero, add 1 resource to attached hero's pool, or ready attached hero.

name: Wind from the Sea
text: Encounter. When Revealed: Ready each hero committed to the quest and remove Wind from the Sea from the game. Shadow: Ready the defending character

flavor:
"He is a strong king, and his realm now reaches south and east of Esgaroth."
<cite>Glóin, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Brand son of Bain
text: Each Dale character you control with a player attachment gets +1 [willpower]. Response: After you play an attachment on a Dale character without an attachment, draw a card.

name: Bard son of Brand
text: While playing an Item attachment, Bard son of Brand is considered to have the printed [leadership], [lore], and [tactics] icons. Response: When a character leaves play, return each attachment attached to that character to its owner's hand. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Redwater Sentry
text: Reduce the cost to play Armor attachments on Redwater Sentry by 1. Redwater Sentry gets +1 [defense] and gains Sentinel while it has an Armor attachment.

flavor:
There were people on the look-out on the banks.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: North Realm Lookout
text: North Realm Lookout gets +1 [willpower] and does not exhaust to quest while it has an Item attachment

name: Warrior of Dale
text: Reduce the cost to play Weapon attachments on Warrior of Dale by 1. Warrior of Dale gets +1 [attack] and gains ranged while it has a Weapon attachment.

flavor:
"Nowhere are there any men so friendly to us as the Men of Dale"
<cite>Glóin, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Long Lake Trader
text: Action: Exhaust Long Lake Trader to move an Item attachment from a character you control to another eligible character.

flavor:
Each one of his folk was clad in a hauberk of steel mail that hung to his knees…
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Hauberk of Mail
text: Attach to a Dale or Warrior character. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gets +1 [defense] (and +1 hit point if attached character has the sentinel keyword).

flavor:
Then Bard II, Brand's son, became King in Dale...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: King of Dale
text: Attach to a Dale or Esgaroth hero. Planning Action: Exhaust King of Dale to reduce the cost of the next Dale ally you play this phase by 1 for each different player attachment on attached hero. That ally does not require a resource match.

flavor:
"They would shoot at us with their great bows of yew…"
<cite>The Lord of the Eagles, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Bow of Yew
text: Attach to a Dale or Warrior character. Restricted. Response: After attached character is declared as an attacker, exhaust Bow of Yew to deal 1 damage to the defending enemy.

flavor:
"You are come to the very edge of the Wild..."
<cite>Gandalf, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Map of Rhovanion
text: Attach to a Dale or Scout character. Limit 1 per character. Response: After attached character commits to the quest, place 1 progress on the active location.

flavor:
...the necklace of Girion, Lord of Dale, made of five hundred emeralds green as grass, which he gave for the arming of his eldest son…
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Necklace of Girion
text:
Guarded (enemy or location).
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gets +2 [willpower] and collects an additional resource during the resource phase.

flavor:
The talk was all of the trade that came and went on the waterways and the growth of the traffic on the river...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Traffic from Dale
text: Planning Action: Choose a Dale hero you control. Add 1 resource to its pool for each character you control with a player attachment. You can only play 1 copy of Traffic from Dale each round.

flavor:
...the grim-voiced fellow ran hotfoot to the Master. “The dragon is coming or I am a fool!” he cried. “Cut the bridges! To arms! To arms!”
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: To Arms!
text: Action: Choose an ally with a player attachment. Ready that ally.

flavor: "Dwarf-mail may be good, but they will soon be hard put to it." <cite>Bard the Bowman, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Valour of the North
text: Response: After a character is declared as an attacker or defender against an enemy with an attachment, that character gets +3 [attack] and +3 [defense] until the end of this attack.

name: Bartering
text: Planning Action: Choose a ready player attachment on a character you control. Return that attachment to its owner’s hand to reduce the cost of the next attachment played this phase by X, where is the chosen attachment’s cost.

name: Grimbeorn the Old
text: Sentinel. Response: After Grimbeorn the Old defends an attack, spend 1 resource from his pool to declare him as an attacker against that enemy (and resolve his attack). The defending enemy gets -2 [defense] for this attack.

flavor: The men of the lake-town Esgaroth were mostly indoors, for the breeze was from the black East and chill, but a few were walking on the quays, and watching… <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Guardian of Esgaroth
text: Guardian of Esgaroth gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], +1 [defense], and +1 hit point for each different player card attachment it has. (Limit +3 to each.)

flavor:
“There are no great weapon-hoards here, lord,” answered Éomer. “Maybe a light helm might be found to fit him...”
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Squire's Helm
text:
Attach to an ally. Restricted.
Limit 1 per ally. 
Attached ally gets +2 hit points.

flavor:
"...sometimes he is a huge black bear, sometimes he is a great strong black-haired man with huge arms and a great beard."
<cite>Gandalf, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Beorning Skin-changer
text: Combat Action: Choose a Beorning ally with printed cost 3 or more in your hand of discard pile. Discard Beorning Skin-changer to put that ally into play.

flavor:
Swiftly he returned and his wrath was redoubled, so that nothing could withstand him, and no weapon seemed to bite upon him. 
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Beorn's Rage
text: Response: After a Beorning character is declared as an attacker or defender against an enemy, that enemy gets -2 [attack] and -2 [defense] until the end of the phase.

flavor:
In spite of the dangers of this far land bold men had of late been making their way back into it from the South, cutting down trees, and building themselves places to live...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Woodmen's Clearing
text: Attach to a location. Limit 1 per location. Response: When attached location leaves play as an explored location, the first player reduces his threat by 3.

name: The Hidden Way
text: Response: At the beginning of the quest phase, search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a location and make it the active location, returning any previous active location to the staging area. Then, reveal 1 less encounter card this phase (to a minimum of 0). Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Long Lake Fisherman
text: Response: After Long Lake Fisherman enters play, name a number. Then, search the top 5 cards of your deck for a card whose printed cost is equal to that number and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

name: Grey Cloak
text: Attach to a [spirit] or Scout character. Limit 1 per character. Encounter Action: Exhaust attached character and discard Grey Cloak to choose a non-unique enemy in the staging area. That enemy does not make engagement checks against you this phase.

name: The Arkenstone
text: Guarded (enemy or location). Attach to a hero. Each unique character you control gains +1 [willpower]. Action: Reduce your threat by 2 to attach The Arkenstone to a hero controlled by another player and raise that player's threat by 2. (Limit once per round.)

name: Haldan
text: While the active location has an attachment on it, Haldan does not exhaust to quest. Response: When the active location is explored, draw 1 card for each attachment on it.

name: Wiglaf
text: Response: After you play Wiglaf, play an Item attachment on him from your hand for no cost. Action: Exhaust an attachment on Wiglaf to ready him. (Limit once per phase.)

flavor: "May it keep you well!" said Theoden. "It was made for me in Thengel's day, while still I was a boy." - The Two Towers
name: Ancestral Armor
text: Attach to a [leadership] or Noble character. Restricted. Limit 1 per character Attached characters gets +2 [defense] and +2 hit points.

name: Glamdring
text: Guarded (enemy or location) Attach to a hero or Gandalf. Restricted. Attached character gets +2 [attack] Response: After attached character destroys an enemy, draw 1 card.

flavor:
It was a path made by strong arms and heavy feet.
-The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Woodmen's Path
text:
Attach to a location with no progress tokens on it.
While attached location is the active location, reduce its quest point value to 1.

flavor: ...Meneldor young and swift. -The Return of the King
name: Meneldor
text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After Meneldor enters or leaves play, place 2 progress on a location.

flavor:
Behind them in long swift lines came all their vassals from the northern mountains, speeding on a gathering wind.
-The Return of the King
name: Flight of the Eagles
text: Action: Return an Eagle ally to your hand to shuffle a set-aside Eagle of the North into the encounter deck. Then, remove Flight of the Eagles from the game.

name: Wild Stallion
text: Cannot have attachments Planning Action: Attach Wild Stallion to an ally you control. (Counts as a Mount attachment with the text: "Restricted. Limit 1 per ally. Attached ally gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], +1 [defense], and +1 hit point.")

flavor:
South away! and South away!
Seek the sunlight and the day
- The Hobbit
name: South Away!
text: Travel Action: Choose a location in the staging area with a player card attachment and make it the active location, returning any previous active location to the staging area. Reduce each player's threat by X, where X is the number of attachments on the active location.

name: Eagle of the North
text: Encounter. Surge. Cannot have restricted attachments. When Revealed: The first player chooses a player to take control of Eagle of the North. The chosen player may choose and discard a non-unique enemy in the staging area.

flavor:
"It is a crime to wander in my realm without leave."
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Thranduil
text: Combat Action: Play a Silvan ally from your hand. You do not need a resource match for this ally. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
In a great hall with pillars hewn out of the living stone sat the Elvenking on a chair of carven wood.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: The Elvenking
text: Attach to a Silvan hero. Action: Exhaust The Elvenking and return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to ready attached hero.

name: Orcrist
text: Guarded (enemy or location). Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +2 [attack]. Response: After attached hero destroys an enemy, add 1 resource to attached hero's pool.

flavor:
Only on the Road would travellers be found...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Forest Road Traveler
text: Forest Road Traveler gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense] for each attachment on the active location.

flavor:
His legs were stretched out before him, showing high boots of supple leather that fitted him well...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Leather Boots
text: Attach to a [lore] or Ranger character. Limit 1 per character. Response: After a location is revealed from the encounter deck, exhaust Leather Boots to ready attached character.

flavor:
"As a bear he ranges far and wide."
<cite>Gandalf, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Giant Bear
text: Cannot have attachments. Action: Ready Giant Bear. At the end of the phase in which you triggered this effect, shuffle Giant Bear back into your deck. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Outmatched
text: Play into your play area unattached. If unattached, attach to the next eligible enemy that engages you. Response: After attached enemy resolves its attack, ready the defending character.

flavor:
"Here am I waiting and waiting down here, while you fellows drink and make merry and forget your tasks. Small wonder if I fall asleep from weariness!"
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Galion
text: Cannot attack or defend. Response: After Galion enters play, he gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round.

flavor:
"You would die before your stroke fell."
<cite>Legolas, Th Two Towers</cite>
name: Quicker Than Sight
text: Response: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to cancel a shadow effect just triggered during combat.

name: Thalion
text:
While there is at least 1 side quest in the victory display, ready Thalion at the beginning of the combat phase. 
While there are at least 3 side quests in the victory display, Thalion loses the ally card type, gains the hero card type and the resource icons of each sphere on a side quest in the victory display.

name: Dáin Ironfoot
text: While Dáin Ironfoot is defending, he gains, 'Action: Discard the top card of your deck to give Dáin Ironfoot +1 [defense] for this attack. (Limit 3 times per phase.)'

name: Soldier of Erebor
text: Action: Discard the top 3 cards from your deck to ready Soldier of Erebor. (Limit once per round.)

name: Man the Walls
text: Play only if no other copies of Man the Walls have been played this round. Planning Action: Reduce the cost of the next ally played by each player this phase by 1. Those allies cannot quest this round.

name: Mirkwood Hunter
text:
Ranged.
Reduce the cost to play Mirkwood Hunter by 1 for each attachment on the active location.

name: Familiar Lands
text: Action: Each location with an attachment gets -2 [threat] until the end of the phase.

name: Warrior Sword
text: Restricted. Attach to a [tactics] or Warrior character. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gets +1 [attack] for each enemy engaged with you. (Limit +3 [attack].)

name: Swift and Strong
text: Response: After a character you control attacks and destroys an enemy, exhaust a Weapon attached to that character to ready that character and give it +2 [attack] for its next attack this phase.

name: Descendant of Girion
text: Reduce the cost to play Item attachments on Descendant of Girion by 1.

name: Valiant Determination
text: Attach to an ally. Attached ally does not exhaust to quest.

name: Ring of Thrór
text: Guarded (enemy or location). Attach to a Dwarf hero. Action: Exhaust Thrór's Ring and discard the top card of your deck to ready attached hero. If the discarded card is an attachment, put it into play.

name: Bilbo Baggins
text: Response: After Bilbo Baggins commits to the quest, choose an enemy in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, Bilbo Baggins gets +X [willpower] where X is that enemy’s [threat]. If the players quest successfully, deal 1 damage to that enemy (2 damage instead if it is guarding a card).

flavor: ...after the coming of Men they took ever more and more to the gloaming and the dusk. —The Hobbit
name: Greenwood Defender
text: Response: After Greenwood Defender enters play, it does not exhaust to defend until the end of the round.

flavor: ...soon Haldir turned aside into the trees and halted on the bank of the river under their shadows. —The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Elf Guide
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose a hero. Add 1 resource to that hero’s pool.

flavor: "Why? Why’s none of my business, or yours." —The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Gaffer Gamgee
text: Combat Action: Return Gaffer Gamgee to your hand to choose an enemy with engagement cost higher than your threat. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot attack you.

flavor:
Ho! Ho! Ho! to the bottle I go 
To heal my heart and drown my woe. 
—The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Drinking Song
text: Action: Count the number of cards in your hand and shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw an equal number of cards. Draw 1 additional card if you control a unique Hobbit character.

name: Sting
text: Guarded (enemy). Attach to a Hobbit hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense]. Response: After attached hero is declared as an attacker or defender against an enemy, deal 1 damage to that enemy.

name: Round Shield
text: Attach to a character. Restricted. Response: After a shadow effect is triggered during combat, exhaust Round Shield to give attached character +2 [defense] for this attack.

flavor: There were toys the like of which they had never seen before, all beautiful and some obviously magical. —The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Erebor Toymaker
text: Response: After you play Erebor Toymaker from your hand, reduce the cost of the next attachment played this phase by 2.

flavor: "We make good armour and keen swords, but we cannot again make mail or blade to match those that were made before the dragon came." —Glóin, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Armor of Erebor
text:
Attach to a Dale or Dwarf character. Restricted. 
Attached character gets +1 [defense] and gains sentinel.

flavor: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." —Thorin Oakenshield, The Hobbit
name: The Shirefolk
text: Play only if each of your heroes is a Hobbit. Action: Reduce your threat by 4.

flavor:
"I am Aragorn son of Arathorn; and if by life or death I can save you, I will."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Aragorn
text: Sentinel. Response: After Aragorn commits to a quest, spend 1 resource from his resource pool to ready him.

flavor:
"Gildor Inglorion of the House of Finrod. We are Exiles, and most of our kindred have long ago departed...
-The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Gildor Inglorion
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from Gildor Inglorion's resource pool to choose a player to draw 1 card (Limit once per round.)

flavor: Nori, at your service." -Nori, The Hobbit
name: Nori
text: Response: After you play a Dwarf character from your hand, reduce your threat by 1.

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

name: Galadriel
text: At the end of the round, discard Galadriel from play. Response: After you play Galadriel from your hand, search the top 5 cards of your deck for an attachment of cost 3 or less and put it into play. Put the remaining cards back in any order.

flavor:
"Give me a row of orc-necks and room to swing and all weariness will fall from me!"
-The Two Towers
name: Gimli
text: Sentinel. Response: After an enemy is revealed from the encounter deck, ready Gimli.

flavor:
"He leads now in all perilous ventures."
-Mablung, The Two Towers
name: Faramir
text: Action: Exhaust Faramir to choose a player. Each character controlled by that player gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

flavor:
"...she was the Evenstar of her people."
-The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Arwen Undómiel
text: Response: After Arwen Undómiel exhausts, choose a character. That character gains sentinel and gets +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

flavor:

-Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Orophin
text: Ranged. Response: After Orophin enters play, return a Silvan ally from your discard pile to your hand.

flavor:

-The Hobbit
name: Bofur
text: Quest Action: Spend 1 [spirit] resource to put Bofur into play from your hand, exhausted and commited to a quest. If you quest successfully this phase and Bofur is still in play, return him to your hand.

flavor:

-Thorin, The Hobbit
name: Fili
text: Response: After you play Fili from your hand during the planning phase, seach your deck for Kili and put him into play under your control. Then shuffle your deck.

flavor:
"Let us join the throng!"
-The Hobbit
name: Kili
text: Response: After you play Kili from your hand during the planning phase, seach your deck for Fili and put him into play under your control. Then shuffle your deck.

flavor:
"We have been keeping watch on the rivers, ever since we saw a great troop of Orcs going north towards Moria, along the skirts of the mountains, many days ago."
-Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Silverlode Archer
text: Ranged.

flavor:
"You cannot cross the rivers again, and behind you there are now secret sentinels that you cannot pass."
-Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Defender of the Naith
text: Sentinel. Response: After a Silvan ally you control leaves play, ready Defender of the Naith.

flavor:
They forgot or ignored what little they had ever known of the Guardians...
-The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Andrath Guardsman
text: Response: After you play Andrath Guardsman from your hand, choose a non-unique enemy engaged with you. That enemy cannot attack you this round.

name: Woodland Courier
text: Response: After Woodland Courier enters play, place 1 progress on a location (2 progress instead if that location has the Forest trait.

flavor:

-Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Naith Guide
text: Response: After Naith Guide enters play, choose a hero. That hero does not exhaust to quest this round.

name: Blue Mountain Trader
text: Action: Choose another player. That player gains control of Blue Mountain Trader. Then, the player moves 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero he controls to the resource pool of a hero you control, or Blue Mountain Trader is discarded. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
...he did not altogether approve of the dwarves and their love of gold...
-The Hobbit
name: Dwarven Sellsword
text: Forced: At the end of the round, discard Dwarven Sellsword unless the players as a group spend 1 [leadership] resource.

name: Celebrían's Stone
text:
Restricted.
Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +2 [willpower]. If attached hero is Aragorn, he also gains a [spirit] resource icon.

name: Steward of Gondor
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the Gondor trait. Action: Exhaust Steward of Gondor to add 2 resources to attached hero's resource pool.

flavor:
"...those who have dwelt in the Blessed Ralm live at once in both worlds, and against both the Seen and Unseen they have great power."
-Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Light of Valinor
text: Attach to a Nolder or Silvan hero. Attached hero does not exhaust to commit to a quest.

flavor:
"You cannot trap me, though you try,
in your cobwebs crazy."
-Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit
name: Unexpected Courage
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust Unexpected Courage to ready attached hero.

flavor:
...anything that Hobbits had no immediate use for, but were unwilling to throw away, they called mathom.
The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Ancient Mathom
text: Attach to a location. Response: After attached location is explored, the first player draws 3 cards.

flavor:
If you want to know what cram is, I can only say that I don"t know the recipe; but it is biscuitish, keeps good indefinitely, is supposed to be sustaining, and is certainly not entertaining...
-The Hobbit
name: Cram
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Cram to ready attached hero.

flavor:
"If there is only one way, then I muse take it. What comes after must come."
-Frodo Baggins, The Two Towers
name: Grim Resolve
text: Action: Ready all characters in play.

flavor:
There is a seed of courage hidden (often deeply, it is true) in the heart of the fattest and most timid hobbit...
-The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Sneak Attack
text: Action: Put 1 ally card into play from your hand. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play, return it to your hand.

flavor:
"There is naught that you can do, other than resist, with hope or without it."
-Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: A Test of Will
text: Response: Cancel the 'when revealed' effects of a card that was just revealed from the encounter deck.

flavor:
"...no road looks toward safety any longer. Be vigilant!"
-Gandalf, The Return of the King
name: Ever Vigilant
text: Action: Choose and ready 1 ally card.

flavor:

text: Response: Cancel a shadow effect just triggered during combat.

flavor:
...but along in the porch upon the topmost step stood Beregond...
-The Return of the King
name: Desperate Defense
text: Response: After a sentinel character is declared as a defender, it gets +2 [defense] for this attack. If this attack deals no damage, ready the defending character.

The dwarves of yore made might spells,
While hammers fell like rining bells
In places deep, where dark things sleep...
-The Hobbit
name: Dwarven Tomb
text: Action: Return a [spirit] card from your discard pile to your hand.

flavor:
"...we went ahead and spoke with feigned voices..."
-Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Feigned Voices
text: Combat Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.

flavor:

-Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Glorfindel
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from Glorfindel's pool to heal 1 damage on any character. (Limit once per round.)

flavor: And winter comes after autumn." - Bifur, The Hobbit
name: Bifur
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from a hero's resource pool to add 1 resource to Bifur's resource pool. Any player may trigger this ability. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
Thorin III Stonehelm, Dain"s son, became King under the mountain.

name: Thorin Stonehelm
text: Response: After Thorin Stonehelm is declared as an attacker, discard the top card of your deck to deal 1 damage to an enemy engaged with you.

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

flavor:
"He stands not alone," said Legolas, bending his bow and fitting an arrow with hands that moved quicker than sight.
-The Two Towers
name: Legolas
text: Ranged. Response: After Legolas participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, draw 1 card.

flavor:
"But there are some of use who still go abroad for the gathering of news and the watching of our enemies, and they speak the languages of other lands."
-The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Haldir of Lórien
text: Ranged. Sentinel.

name: Elrond
text: At the end of the round, discard Elrond from play. Response: After Elrond enters play, choose one: heal all damage on a hero, discard a Condition attachment, or each player draws 1 card.

name: Azain Silverbeard
text: Response: After Azain Silverbeard participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, spend 1 [tactics] resource to deal 2 damage to another enemy that shares a Trait with the destroyed enemy. Any player may trigger this response.

flavor:
"But still we will not sit idle and let Him do all as He would."
-The Two Towers
name: Mablung
text: Response: After Mablung enters play, choose an enemy to get +5 enagement cost until the end of the round. Then, you may engage that enemy, or return it to the staging area

-Sam Gamgee, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Henamarth Riversong
text: Action: Exhaust Henamarth Riversong to look at the top card of the encounter deck.

name: Ioreth
text: Cannot attack or defend. Action: Spend 1 [lore] resource to exhaust Ioreth. Then, heal 3 points of damage from a character. Any player may trigger this action.

-Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Sarn Ford Sentry
text: Response: After Sarn Ford Sentry enters play, draw 1 card for each enemy engaged with you.

flavor:

name: Erebor Hammersmith
text: Response: After you play Erebor Hammersmith, return the topmost attachment in any player's discard pile to his hand.

flavor:

-Legolas, The Fellowship of the Ring
name: Galadhon Archer
text: Ranged. Response: After Galadhon Archer enters play, deal 1 damage to an enemy not engaged with you.

flavor:
...the language was of Elven-song and spoke of things little now in Middle-earth.

name: Galadhrim Minstrel
text: Response: After Galadhrim Minstrel enters play, search the top 5 cards of your deck for an event card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

flavor:

name: Elf-stone

name: Lembas
text: Play only if you control a Noldor or Silvan hero. Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Lembas to ready attached hero and heal 3 damage from it.

name: Gildor's Counsel
text: Play during the Quest phase, before characters are commited to the Quest. Action: Reveal 1 less card from the encounter deck this phase. (To a minimum of 1.)

name: Feint
text: Combat Action: Choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.
